story:
Short Summary

Phonographic Memory is an independently run organization based out of San Francisco, dedicated to examining and celebrating the human experience as framed by music through vinyl records. Bridging cultures and generations, heavy collectors and casual fans, we believe in creating a global community through individuals stories, providing folklore to the physical artifact. People worldwide have a relationship with records that is equally unique and freakishly endearing, and through a multimedia platform of monthly live events, a documentary web series, topical podcast and blog, we get to the heart of that bond. You can hear and see it all at PhonographicMemory.org.


What We Need and Why

For the past year everything from the website, audio recorder, cables, flyers and so on has been paid out of pocket. While we search for grants, we will need a few basic things to ensure the program continues to grow. The first is legal assistance in obtaining non-profit status, a crucial piece needed for receiving grant money. The second order is to compensate our production quartet who all work regular jobs and put in countless hours designing, recording, editing, writing and organizing. There are a bunch of other little things from mics and chords to the storage space for hosting all of these audio and video files that we are about to serve up for the world to enjoy. Our goal for this campaign is modest, but so are we. Federal and state grants are the ultimate goal, and with your help and contributions they will be within reach. Baby steps, like Bob Wiley!

The Impact

In this impersonal digital age, Phonographic Memory brings people together to talk, listen and share a piece of ourselves over vinyl records. Once a month at the Bernal Heights Library we bring people of different ages and backgrounds together who would otherwise have no contact. What we've created in San Francisco can be mirrored anywhere in the world, and through a combination of live events and digital components like the podcast and videos, we believe we can create a global community through a shared love of music. 

Risks & Challenges

We see no risks and a mountain of attainable challenges; we just need the resources. The people and stories are there, we just need to get to them. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Let the music lover in your life know about us; the vinyl aficionado, the storytelling seeking individuals who thirst to hear humans be human, and those looking to explore the things that bond instead of isolate us. Stay up to date and follow all the happenings at PhonographicMemory.org and Facebook.

story:
Note: A little bird told me that the "Back It" button is separate from the perks associated with this campaign, so make sure to click on the specific perk level if you want them so I know who to give them to! Thanks!

Happy New Year!

I am extremely excited to finally be releasing this project. I've been dreaming of this my whole life, especially over the last year as I discovered a sound (and a producer that allowed me to pursue that sound) that felt genuine and exciting and conducive to who I am and who I want to be as an artist. And now I finally feel ready to pursue it with every ounce of energy in my body.

But of course, as a college student, doing a project like this the right way is extremely expensive. I'm looking to raise between $600-800, with any extra funds going to fun extra things like maybe merch? bonus tracks? VINYL? Wow. The rest will go towards paying Andrew Novoa for the countless hours he puts in to arranging and mixing and mastering, as well as paying any other featured musicians on the tracks, and creating professional physical copies and securing copyrights for each of the songs. It's a lot to take on, but I know the end result will be worth it all and I can't wait to share it with all of you.

I would be beyond grateful for any and all donations that you can give. I know there are so many of my friends and family that have supported me and my music for a long time, and I have never taken that support for granted. I want to create art that is meaningful and professional and that reaches as many people as possible, and of course that is never a one-man journey.

In addition, if you cannot donate (or if you yourself are a struggling musician/artist, in which case I do not want nor expect your donation), sharing this campaign is EQUALLY as beneficial to me getting the word out about this project. 

The EP will have 6 tracks total. Expected release will be April 2017. EP will be released on all music selling platforms. Live performances and other fun things to come with it! AAAHHH!! :DDD

Thank you thank you thank you (to anyone who read this far)! Here's to an amazing year ahead!

story:
“How come I’ve never heard of you before?”


INEVITABLY, SOMEONE WILL ASK ME THAT QUESTION when I leave the stage after playing my music. Immediately preceded by, “That’s amazing! I’ve never heard anything like that before.”

I need your help to make sure no one ever asks me that again!

HELP ME FUND NO ORDINARY WINDOW SO I CAN SHARE MY MUSIC

No Ordinary Window started as the title of a new work for solo electric viola. From the moment I sat down to create the music I realized it would be more than just a composition. The new work became the title track of my latest CD, a collection of works I’ve been writing and recording, bit by bit, over the past several years. But it soon became clear that there was more to this than just a recording.

This project has evolved into a passion about sharing music that reaches inside and opens windows to the soul. It’s about a performance experience where the shadows of the setting sun, or the reflection of a stained glass window, seems to flow with the music. It’s about moving the listener in profoundly personal ways.

GIVE SO THAT OTHERS MAY RECEIVE

By contributing to my Indiegogo campaign, you’re helping me get my music out to more people. What's more, you're affirming your support for me as an artist and your belief in the music I create.

Your donation will help offset the costs of recording, producing and promoting the recording as well as, and perhaps most importantly, defray the expenses of bringing the performance experience of No Ordinary Window to places near, far and wide. Hopefully somewhere near YOU!

PLEASE TAKE A LOOK AT THE PERKS AND OFFERINGS which you can receive in exchange for your support. I’ve given this a lot of thought, from the signed CD’s to the opportunity of sponsoring me to bring my workshops into schools, to creating an original soundtrack for your favorite pet video and even bringing the No Ordinary Window Experience to your living room!

Remember, music is a window that never closes… so here’s to opening your own…No Ordinary Window!


SHARE THIS WITH FRIENDS, FAMILY AND CASUAL ACQUAINTANCES!

If you never want to hear, "How come I've never heard of you?" again, spread the word and spread the music!

Thank you...in every language and from the bottom of my heart.

story:
Présentation

Allo! Moi, c'est Monsieur Saturne. Ça fait 5 ans que j'ai fini l'École Nationale de la Chanson et après tout ce temps de réflexion et de grattage de guitare, je me sens enfin prêt à lancer mon premier album solo.

Monsieur Saturne, c'est mon projet, c'est mon personnage, mon rêve. Caché derrière ce nom, je me permets paradoxalement d'être plus authentique et plus libre. 

J'espère que vous prendrez autant de plaisir à découvrir mon univers que moi j'en ai eu à le créer.

Pourquoi j'ai besoin de vous

Pour faire un bel album qui sonne bien, il faut des sous. Un album, ça implique beaucoup d'étapes et de gens, comme un batteur ou un bassiste. C'est aussi une belle pochette, une montagne d'heures de studio, du mixage, du mastering, une belle impression... et pleins d'autres petites choses encore.

Pour aller jusqu'au bout du projet, il me faut des fonds et c'est là que vous intervenez. En achetant d'avance mon album, vous me permettez de terminer celui-ci. Vous pouvez aussi profiter de quelques bonus exclusifs...

Alors qu'est-ce que vous attendez? 

 

 

Merci d'avance :)

story:
Qui sont-ils? 

BAIE, un groupe acadien de la Baie des chaleurs qui trip sur la musique pop et disco. Oui oui, t'as bin compris! Ils vont être le nouveau groupe qui vous feront danser all night long pendant vos tites soirées BBQ, vos pool party, vos ''vindredi'' pis une fois que la pandémie s'en va, sur une belle SCÈNE!  

Pour ceux qui ne les connaissent pas, BAIE est le pride and joy de Chloé Breault (basse+voix) , Matt Boudreau (synth + voix) et Marc-André Boudreau (guitare électrique + voix). Anciennement connus sous le nom de "Loumarin", ils aiment composer des chansons avec des mélodies qui font danser et des paroles mélancoliques parfaites pour les amoureux désespérés. Avec chacun leurs carrières solo respectives, BAIE est un projet sans barrière où ils peuvent essayer n'importe quoi musicalement.

Et pis là, ils sont prêts à enregistrer un album avec l'aide de pas un réalisateur mais DEUX!

Êtes-vous ready? *Drum rolll*   Katrine Noël pis Mico Roy! 

 

Ce que vous supportez:

Les fonds iront pour les dépenses associées à l'album.

  • Le studio
  • Les réalisateurs/producteurs
  • Les musiciens
  • Le mixage
  • Le mastering
  • Le graphiste
  • La pochette d'album

Allez checker s'il y a des contreparties qui vous intéressent!  Et si le coeur vous en dit, ils apprécieraient grandement votre support!

 

 

BAIE <3

story:
Christopher Farrell is a violist and has been a member of the Nashville Symphony since 1999. He received a Bachelor of Music from the University of North Texas under the tutelage of Dr. George Papich, and a Master of Music degree from Indiana University as a student of Atar Arad. Other important teachers include Laura Altz and Connie Brouillette.

As a member of Alias Chamber Ensemble, Christopher can be heard on Alias' CDs Amorisms, Boiling Point: Music of Kenji Bunch, and the Grammy Nominated album Gabriela Lena Frank: Hilos. In addition to performing with the Nashville Symphony and Alias Chamber Ensemble, Christopher is an active studio musician and can be heard on numerous albums by an eclectic range of recording artists.

Christopher's compositions have been performed in Alias Chamber Ensemble season concerts at Vanderbilt University's Blair School of Music and Nashville Symphony OnStage performances at the Schermerhorn Symphony Center. In 2015, Christopher was awarded a Bonnaroo Works/Community Foundation of Middle Tennessee Grant by the Metro Nashville Arts Commission for the creation  of Needle and Thread, Trio for Flute, Viola and Harp.

With your support through this Indiegogo campaign I hope to record these works. In addition I have commisssioned my very talented friend, artist Jill Bergman to create a cover for the CD inspired by the music we will record.  You can see examples of her work at: http://www.jillbergman.com/

 

 

What Is Needed

To record this album I will need approximately $7500. Costs for recording include:

  • Recording engineer
  • Recording site fees
  • Musician costs
  • Mastering costs
  • CD replication costs
  • iTunes fees
  • CD cover art costs
  • Unanticipated costs

The Impact

With your help, I hope to have document of my work. I hope to create new works and to reach a wider audience. This CD will allow me to share my work with the world.

 

Risks & Challenges

Risks include:

  • Difficulty finding a recording site
  • Underestimation of recording costs
  • Underestimation of editing and mastering costs

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word about this indiegogo campaign!

story:
Dear Friends, Family and Lovers (of adventurous music),

As we head into 2017, we are ever more grateful for our friends and supporters, our close artistic collaborators, and the community of adventurous artists around the country. Now is a time to prioritize and revitalize our artistic community, and to celebrate it with far-reaching goals. We need your support to continue Wet Ink's mission of presenting creative, cutting-edge new music.

In our 18th Concert Season, Wet Ink unveils our most ambitious plans yet for the Wet Ink Large Ensemble, a flexible group of over twenty soloists dedicated to championing the work of risk-taking and underrepresented artists. We are excited and proud to be featuring this extraordinary group both in live concerts in NYC, in a reading workshop designed to give emerging composers an in-depth chamber orchestra experience, and finally with our first ever Wet Ink Large Ensemble album! Your contributions are vital to bringing these 3 projects to life -

1) Second Annual Large Ensemble Readings Project (June 2017): providing 2 composers with the rare opportunity to have works for up to 20 musicians rehearsed and recorded in an intensely focused, constructive, and friendly environment (recordings and info on last year’s Readings).

2) Festival of Adventurous Music for Large Ensemble: a pair of concerts on June 12 & 13 in NYC focused on works for large ensemble by the Wet Ink composers, Mikolaj Laskowski, Katherine Young, and more.

3) Large Ensemble Debut Recording: our first album release featuring the Large Ensemble, including works by Alex Mincek, Sam Pluta, Kate Soper, Eric Wubbels, Katherine Young & Anthony Braxton. 

Please consider making a tax-deductible donation of any amount to the Wet Ink Ensemble.  Your donation is vitally important to Wet Ink's ability to present and promote imaginative new music around the world.

Read on for more information about Wet Ink's upcoming projects, recent events, and highlights from last season.  And as always, visit us at www.wetink.org to check out performance audio, video and more.

Sincerely yours,

Alex, Kate, Josh, Eric, Sam, Erin & Ian

 

Wet Ink’s Season 18 Project Highlights

In addition to our June events for Large Ensemble, our season includes a full lineup of chamber concerts and tours:

·  "The Nature of Sound" (Sept) - a rare evening of electro-acoustic music in 12 channel surround sound, focused on the legacy of French electronic music pioneer Bernard Parmegiani, along with recent works by Sam Pluta, David Adamcyk, Chris Mercer and Paula Matthusen.

·  Eric Wubbels Album Release concert (Sept) - a celebration of the release of Eric Wubbels's "Duos with Piano, Book 1" on Carrier Records, an incredible body of work representing 8 years of collaboration with Wet Ink.

·  "TOCSIN": 3 premieres by Patrick Higgins (Nov) - Wet Ink Large Ensemble with Vicky Chow and Mivos Quartet, as part of an immersive multimedia evening at Pioneer Works.

·  Kate Soper's "Ipsa Dixit" @ EMPAC (Troy, NY) and Dixon Place (NYC) - development, performance, and recording of the staged version of Soper's evening-length monodrama "Ipsa Dixit", written for Wet Ink, at the state-of-the-art Experimental Media and Performing Arts Center in Troy, NY (Dec), followed by a run of NYC shows at Dixon Place (Feb). In collaboration with director Ashley Tata.

·  Winter Chamber Concert (Dec) - our annual self-produced chamber concert, with guest performers Mariel Roberts (Mivos) and Ryan Muncy (ICE), featuring work by Murat Çolak (2016 Large Ensemble Readings selection) and Clara Iannotta alongside the Wet Ink composers.

·  And many other events, including residencies at Lawrence University and Western Michigan University, performances in Chicago, Princeton, and Northampton, and more!

Highlights from 2015-16

·  New Music New College (Sarasota, FL) - Wet Ink performed "Ipsa Dixit" in September at this outstanding Sarasota-based concert series devoted to contemporary music.

·  Performa 15: "Erwartung" in Times Square - the Wet Ink Large Ensemble made history in November as part of the first ever opera production staged in Times Square.

·  Anthony Braxton Portrait Concert @ National Sawdust -  the most recent installment of Wet Ink's Portrait Concert series, a program showcasing the extraordinary breadth and scope of Braxton's output.

·  Smith College Residency – our second year in residence at Smith college, including collaborations and classes with student composers, and concerts of Wet Ink repertoire.

·  First Annual Large Ensemble Readings - a fun and productive day with participant composers Emily Praetorius, Zeynep Toraman, and Sam Yulsman.

·  And many other events, including an appearance on the Chicago Symphony Orchestra MUSICNOW series,  a Large Ensemble concert in collaboration with Columbia Composers, and tours in the Mid-West and New England.

In collaboration with director Ashley Tata.·  Winter Chamber Concert (Dec) - our annual self-produced chamber concert, with guest performers Mariel Roberts (Mivos) and Ryan Muncy (ICE), featuring work by Murat Çolak (2016 Large Ensemble Readings selection) and Clara Iannotta alongside the Wet Ink composers.·  And many other events, including residencies at Lawrence University and Western Michigan University, performances in Chicago, Princeton, and Northampton, and more!Highlights from 2015-16·  New Music New College (Sarasota, FL) - Wet Ink performed "Ipsa Dixit" in September at this outstanding Sarasota-based concert series devoted to contemporary music.·  Performa 15: "Erwartung" in Times Square - the Wet Ink Large Ensemble made history in November as part of the first ever opera production staged in Times Square.·  Anthony Braxton Portrait Concert @ National Sawdust -  the most recent installment of Wet Ink's Portrait Concert series, a program showcasing the extraordinary breadth and scope of Braxton's output.·  Smith College Residency – our second year in residence at Smith college, including collaborations and classes with student composers, and concerts of Wet Ink repertoire.·  First Annual Large Ensemble Readings - a fun and productive day with participant composers Emily Praetorius, Zeynep Toraman, and Sam Yulsman.·  And many other events, including an appearance on the Chicago Symphony Orchestra MUSICNOW series,  a Large Ensemble concert in collaboration with Columbia Composers, and tours in the Mid-West and New England.

story:
We are asking for your help to raise the funds needed for a new equipment truck! 

We are Omaha Street Percussion, a entertainment group that performs by drumming on recycled household items. We incorporate rhythm and dance into our routines. Our group also teaches percussion in multiple public schools in the Omaha, NE area. We work with about 75-100 students each school year in after school programs. We also perform around 120 times per year. 

Our truck was used to transport all of our gear to each show. We typically perform 2-3 times per week, so an equipment truck is highly needed. We are hoping to raise funds to purchase a new vehicle that can enable us to continue to perform and teach drums and percussion in Omaha and the midwest!

story:
About The Harper Conspiracy (THC)

Susan Harper has been writing and playing original music for over a decade. "Harper" as she likes to be called, has found her musical soul mates. Together, they are ready to launch their brand of tunes for all to enjoy. A little about the band:

  • Harper and Shaina are a power duo who sing leads and harmonies. Harper plays rhythm guitar and Shaina rocks electric and upright bass.
  • Ken Curtiss plays guitars that bend and expand in the music.
  • Phillip Orozco blows saxophone and harmonica.
  • Aiden Ward-Richter's energetic drumming drives the rhythm.

We have been working hard to prepare for our recording session on April 30th. Its a lot of fun, but takes time, effort and investment. All of us are doing our best to contribute, and having our friends, family and fans help out, will make a big difference.

You can hear our live recording from a recent show HERE

All proceeds from this fundraiser will help pay for the EP recording, mastering, duplication, artwork and distribution

Here' s some stuff we have to express our appreciation for your contribution:

  • A downloadable EP
  • Some THC swag including an original bumper sticker and homemade button
  • VIP tickets to our EP release party (date TBD)
  • An invitation to a THC House Party
  • Lots and lots of good Karma!!!!

Your contribution is an affirmation and inspiration

As a band, it takes a lot of effort and practice to be ready for performances and recordings. It feels great to rehearse and work out a tune, and having you with us is even more awesome!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Please share this campaign with your friends and family - we want to include everyone!

story:
The Will to Survive

Hi! First and foremost, if you are reading this right now, we would strongly encourage you to watch our statement video if you haven't already. We feel that it fully captures the essence of our band and the passion we feel for the music we make. We've come to the point in our careers where the creation of a full length album is the only thing we feel will project us to the next level of this endeavor. The issue is that, at our level at least, playing music isn't the most lucrative profession and subsequently, we're all a little poor! We pour every bit of the resources that we can spare into this band, but it's not quite enough at times. Because of that, we could really use your help, and anything that you could contribute would not go unnoticed or unappreciated! We'll be setting up perks based upon different tiers of contributions. Until then, our EP is up for free download at www.thewilltosurvive.bandcamp.com We can't express to you how much this means to our lives, we aren't taking this project lightly, and we're very serious about music and hope to be able to make a career out of this band. The perks that we're offering will be available upon completion of the album, and if you qualify for any of the perks, email us at thatstoughmusic@gmail.com with a screenshot of your confirmation page and include your name and address. Then, one week before the album is released to the general public, we will personally mail your gifts directly to your home! Thank you for reading this, and if you decide to contribute, just know that it means the world to us and we'll never forget it. To those of you who have seen us live or listened to our music in any capacity, we cannot express to you how much your support means to us... It's why we do what we do in the first place.

                            Love,

                                 TWTS (Adam, Ben, Austin and Nic)

 

What your contributions will be going towards:

 The recording, mixing, mastering and production (we have pressing covered) of It's    Hard to Speak Through Chattering Teeth (8 tracks plus 1 hidden track)

A small portion of your contributions will be going toward artwork for the album packaging

story:
Hello friends,

My name is Evan Schaaf. I am a 19 year old composer from Houston, Texas.

This campaign is to raise funds for the recording of my first String Quartet, a mammoth of a piece that has been in the works for three years. The money raised will go towards compensating professional musicians for rehearsal and recording time, in addition to purchasing a binaural microphone.

The Recording:

If you aren’t quite sure what binaural recording is, it basically captures the recording environment as accurately as possible - by using ear-shaped cups atop high-resolution microphones, binaural recording can replicate the directionality and depth of sounds within a space with incredible precision.

When you listen back using headphones, it essentially feels like you are actually in the recording space. For this project, I thought recording with binaural imaging would create an intensely intimate listening experience - you should feel as if the instruments within the quartet are surrounding you.

The Piece:

The piece is made up of a hybrid-graphic 198-page score - a single movement to be performed without pause for approximately four hours.

There are three primary conceptual goals that operate within the piece:

1. To engage in active ponderance about the conventions of musical composition (harmony, rhythm, form, timbre) and the nature of aesthetic appeal

2. To relentlessly produce an environment of introspection for the listener

3. To question the influence of short and long-term memory on perception in regards to the intimate and subjective process of listening

The Inspiration:

About two years ago, I began to discover the terrifying power of modern and contemporary classical music - the radical experimentalism, the diverse tonal and timbral language, the expansive expressive potential, and most of all, the perfection of the string quartet.

To me, the string quartet - comprised of two violins, one viola, and one cello - is one of the most powerful and essential ensemble configurations that modern music has to offer. The quartet makes a composer focus on only the essentials of music - harmony, melody, rhythm, timbre, form, and concept. Each of these must be constructed with great eloquence when a composer is granted only four parts - each instrument is entirely exposed without the ornament and distance of an orchestra. From Shostakovich to Cage - I swept through every quartet I could find until I found a resting place with my now-favorite Feldman and Xenakis, both of whom I feel have greatly influenced my quartet.

The Budget:

The following are contained within the $2500 fundraising goal:

$500 - Binaural Microphone

$1750 - Musicians’ Compensation

$250 - Overhead & Fees

The recording space has been graciously provided to me by my parents, and the recording will be entirely self-engineered.

If the funding goal is not reached, the rewards will still be distributed as fully as possible. If the total raised funds is under $500 and a binaural microphone cannot be purchased, the distributed product will be in simple stereo. The raised funds will then go towards purchasing effects plugins or a condenser microphone, both of which would still contribute to the completion of the project. If necessary, volunteer musicians will be recruited and the recording process will likely take longer and yield a lesser quality product. 

If the funding goal is exceeded, the extra money will either go towards purchasing higher quality recording equipment or towards hiring musicians with greater experience. All of the funds will be put back into the project, regardless of the amount raised.

The Deadline:

This IndieGogo Campaign was launched on the 25th of May, 2014. It will continue for 3 weeks, until Sunday, June 15, 2014.

Rehearsals will continue throughout the month of June and the recording date should be in early-mid July. The final product should be released by the end of August 2014. All rewards are cumulative and will be released by the end of August. 

The Challenge:

While I do not anticipate any issues during the rehearsal and recording process, it seems that some hiccups are inevitable. It might be a challenge to find musicians who have the endurance and patience to perform the piece as it was intended, and rehearsals might take up more time than I previously planned.

That being said, I have a great amount of support from my friends and family, and I am confident that I can reach out to them and find the musicians I need if I cannot find them on my own. I keep a very open schedule and am dedicating the entirety of my Summer to ensuring the completion and success of this project.

After recording, I have no doubt that the mixing process will go smoothly as I have many years of experience working with audio (I'm a Recording Arts student at LMU in Los Angeles). Although this is my first contemporary classical project, I have produced many albums and EPs for myself and other local artists in the Houston area. I have experience recording and otherwise engineering Rock, Metal, Drone, Electronic, Jazz, and Experimental music. I am confident in my ability to engineer this project and I believe that the decision to self-produce is both economical and appropriate given time restraints.


Thank you all for your interest and contributions.

story:
Who Are The Ukrainian Bobsledders?

We are a three-piece indie/alternative rock band from Allentown, PA. The band consists of Casey Creveling on guitar/vocals, A.j. "Charles" Foulke on bass, and Austin Albright on drums. We have been playing together for over a year, and have become very passionate about the band and our music. Unfortunately, the odds seem to be stacked against us. It's hard to become established in the music scene, especially if you don't have anything to market yourself with. Also, we're all college students, which means our windows of opportunity are closing. If we don't make serious headway in the next few years, it will become harder and riskier to keep doing what we love with the same level of passion and devotion. That's where all of you lovely people come in.

Our Goal

The aim of our campaign is to raise enough money to record a 3-song EP. The recordings will primarily be used for marketing purposes. They will showcase our sound for venues and promoters in the hopes of landing us more gigs. We can also use them to start building a fan base. When visitors check us out online, they can hear something other than old basement demos. We're looking to raise $500 which will be enough to cover:

  • Tracking for guitars, drums, and vocals
  • Mixing 
  • Mastering

We won't be pressing CDs because all the funds we raise will go solely to studio time. If we raise more than our goal, we'll get to record some additional songs, which would be awesome! If we don't, we'll do our best to work with what we were given to generate some content for all of you.

Rewards

It's only fair to reward your generous support. We've tried to assemble some enticing rewards. Supporters can earn copies of the EP once it's released, handwritten letters, personalized songs, and even an invitation to join our fantasy football league! If you have any questions, or want something we don't have listed, feel free to contact us!

Risks & Challenges

Like any other project, there are some risks involved. Casey could break his hand and be unable to play guitar, Austin could get his drums stolen, or A.j. could wake up with amnesia and forget all the songs. There are also some more realistic hurdles, the most challenging being time management. The studio we selected bills by the hour. We believe that $500 worth of studio time (16-17 hours) will be enough to get our songs completed, but we won't know for sure until we're physically in the studio. Some things may take longer than anticipated to get them to sound just right. We are preparing as much as possible. We've practiced our songs so that we know them inside and out, we've played to a metronome, and have made notes of all our gear settings so that we can replicate our desired sound once we're recording. Regardless of what happens, we ensure our supporters that if our campaign gets funded, an EP we are proud of will be released, most likely in late August.

Other Ways You Can Help

We're college kids, so we understand that some people may not be able to contribute. If you can't support us monetarily, don't fear! There are other ways you can help:

  • Share our campaign with any friends who might have an interest in indie music.
  • Share our band page.
  • Go see a show and support some local bands.

The Bottom Line

You've heard what our campaign is about, so to conclude, we'd just like to list some other reasons for why contributing would be a great idea:

  • You can support indie music. 
  • If someone stops you on the street and asks if you helped make someone's dream come true today, you can honestly answer "yes."
  • Casey's birthday is in late July and getting the campaign funded would be a great birthday gift for him.
  • You'll get good karma and a warm fuzzy feeling inside (probably).
  • You can make history. If we don't record these songs, they may be lost forever. 

Honestly, we wouldn't be able to thank you enough if you helped us record this album. We love playing music and think we have a good thing going. Our songs have a lot of meaning and purpose and we'd love to get the opportunity to share them with the world. Thanks so much for even getting this far in our pitch. If you could contribute, it would mean the world to us. If you have any questions or comments, we would love to talk to you about our project and what we're doing. Send us an email at theukrainianbobsledders@gmail.com and we'll get back to you as soon as possible. Also, feel free to check us out on social media:


facebook.com/TheUkrainianBobsledders

soundcloud.com/The-Ukrainian-Bobsledders

twitter.com/The_UBs

(Sorry all our URLs aren't the same).


Once again, thank you from the bottom of our hearts.


Love,

The Ukrainian Bobsledders


7/21 UPDATE:

We're excited to announce the title and track listing for the EP. The EP will be called Role Strain and contain the tracks "Teenagers from the Frozen Lagoon," "SB-129," and "Holy Saint Francis." Thanks so far to everyone for their support!

story:
Welcome!

We are very excited to be in the studio right now working on what will be Andalusia Rose's second release. We're even more excited, because this is the first release that will reflect our current line-up. Who? Wendy Lee Gadzuk on guitar and vocals, Jeff Vengeance on bass, percussion and back-up vox, and Paul Jarvis Hopkins on drums and back-up vox. For those of you unfamiliar with our sound, we are a female-fronted dirty rock trio who have been compared to Concrete Blonde and Patti Smith, "moodily melancholic" (LA Weekly) with a "twangy-bluesy Southern rock vibe" (Tucson Weekly). We've been holing up at Catacombs Studio in San Francisco's Mission district with engineer/producer Eric Moffat for the past couple of months, creating a lush melodic journey of sound, full of swampy, swirling, stinging guitars. 

Photo by Debbie Kirk

Being artists of many mediums, it has always been our vision to create something that speaks to our aesthetics on as many levels as possible. We want to be able to give you the full experience of what this band is about, from the music, to the production, right down to the artwork and packaging. Vinyl is near and dear to our hearts, and it seems we are not alone. But vinyl is expensive. Which leads us to...

What We Need & What You Get


We are funding this entire project ourselves, without the support of a record label. Which is wonderful, because we can stay true to our vision and work on our own timeline. But the reality is, it does get pricey. We have set a goal of raising $5000 to help with our costs which include:

  • Studio time (a lot of $$!)
  • Mastering (approx. $800)
  • Pressing 500 12" records (approx. $2,800)
  • Pressing 500 cd's (approx. $800)
  • Publicity for the new record
The combined total for all this will far exceed $5000...so it's a good thing we all have day jobs! Meanwhile, we are humbly asking for your support and help to make this project become a reality. We believe in what we are doing and want to get our new music out into the world and into your hands asap. We would love for you to be a part of this journey and are offering all kinds of fun perks in exchange for your generosity, ranging from the obvious digital downloads and records, to the original cover art by Wendy, drum lessons with Paul, a mix tape from Jeff, cookies, etc! Take a look and see what suits your fancy. If you don't see anything that does, send us a message at the email link above and we will see what we can do for you!


Also, add $10 to any perk and receive our old CD as well.


"Our Lady of the Blue" 8"x10" print by Wendy Gadzuk.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute at this time, that's okay...we get it! If you are creative types like us, we know that it's not always possible. You can help us out in other ways by sharing our campaign with your friends by using this link or the Indiegogo share tools above. Email your friends, share on Facebook, do whatever! You can also just drop us a line to say hi, which is always appreciated. Visit us on Facebook here: Andalusia Rose

Here is a little clip from the record in progress:


Also: 

Join and/or share the FB event page for little updates and videos pertaining to our progress in getting this done! 


https://www.facebook.com/events/670196526363520/?source=3&source_newsfeed_story_type=regular

One of our exclusive signed 8"x 10" prints offered by Mike Rosati!!
story_txt:
Welcome! We are very excited to be in the studio right now working on what will be Andalusia Rose's second release. We're even more excited, because this is the first release that will reflect our current line-up. Who? Wendy Lee Gadzuk on guitar and vocals, Jeff Vengeance on bass, percussion and back-up vox, and Paul Jarvis Hopkins on drums and back-up vox. For those of you unfamiliar with our sound, we are a female-fronted dirty rock trio who have been compared to Concrete Blonde and Patti Smith, "moodily melancholic" (LA Weekly) with a "twangy-bluesy Southern rock vibe" (Tucson Weekly). We've been holing up at Catacombs Studio in San Francisco's Mission district with engineer/producer Eric Moffat for the past couple of months, creating a lush melodic journey of sound, full of swampy, swirling, stinging guitars. Photo by Debbie KirkBeing artists of many mediums, it has always been our vision to create something that speaks to our aesthetics on as many levels as possible. We want to be able to give you the full experience of what this band is about, from the music, to the production, right down to the artwork and packaging. Vinyl is near and dear to our hearts, and it seems we are not alone. But vinyl is expensive. Which leads us to...   What We Need & What You GetWe are funding this entire project ourselves, without the support of a record label. Which is wonderful, because we can stay true to our vision and work on our own timeline. But the reality is, it does get pricey. We have set a goal of raising $5000 to help with our costs which include:
Studio time (a lot of $$!)
Mastering (approx. $800)
Pressing 500 12" records (approx. $2,800)
Pressing 500 cd's (approx. $800)
Publicity for the new record
The combined total for all this will far exceed $5000...so it's a good thing we all have day jobs! Meanwhile, we are humbly asking for your support and help to make this project become a reality. We believe in what we are doing and want to get our new music out into the world and into your hands asap. We would love for you to be a part of this journey and are offering all kinds of fun perks in exchange for your generosity, ranging from the obvious digital downloads and records, to the original cover art by Wendy, drum lessons with Paul, a mix tape from Jeff, cookies, etc! Take a look and see what suits your fancy. If you don't see anything that does, send us a message at the email link above and we will see what we can do for you!Also, add $10 to any perk and receive our old CD as well."Our Lady of the Blue" 8"x10" print by Wendy Gadzuk.Other Ways You Can Help If you are unable to contribute at this time, that's okay...we get it! If you are creative types like us, we know that it's not always possible. You can help us out in other ways by sharing our campaign with your friends by using this link or the Indiegogo share tools above. Email your friends, share on Facebook, do whatever! You can also just drop us a line to say hi, which is always appreciated. Visit us on Facebook here: Andalusia RoseHere is a little clip from the record in progress:Also: Join and/or share the FB event page for little updates and videos pertaining to our progress in getting this done! https://www.facebook.com/events/670196526363520/?source=3&source_newsfeed_story_type=regularOne of our exclusive signed 8"x 10" prints offered by Mike Rosati!!

story:
Short Summary

Help me (award winning singer songwriter Kiya Heartwood) record "The Living Tree," an all acoustic solo CD, and help me build a community website for you, my listeners.

What We Need & What You Get

I need your help to record "The Living Tree," an all acoustic solo CD.  I also have a vision of us building a community website  called " The Caravan" where you can access all my music, from rough demos of new songs to the orchestrated music, choir pieces and earth-centered worship services I've written and co-written. Other resources will be available to members including chord charts, lyrics, resources for writers, my blog, poetry and group surveys where Caravan members can participate, if they like,  in the development of future projects such as CD's, and DVD's.

The Impact

You and I both know that music is music, but I've run into lots of folks who make divisions where there don't necessarily have to be any.  Some fans of rock and pop music who like what I've written for my bands, Radio Cafe or Stealin Horses, don't necessarily embrace the folkier, political or acoustic aspects of my solo CD's or the songs of my duo Wishing Chair. The choir and more classical pieces I've written since studying composition confuse some even more. I like that I am a wide writer and yet I struggle to define (in terms the music business would understand) what kind of songwriter I really am and to describe my music so it can get to the people who need and want it.  By offering you all of my music and by creating the Caravan  I will integrate my spiritual understanding of art and craft with the nuts and bolts of making a living.

The Caravan is a member based website offering the committed listener full access to all my music as well as additional features and resources to build a virtual community. I want to know who I'm writing for and create a way for us to get to know each other. My writing is practical; I want to be of use to you in your life. What do you struggle to express? What change do you work for, and how might this music become a part of that?

Many supporters say they love hearing me perform at house concerts and songwriter festivals with just my guitar. They are always asking if I have a CD that sounds like that. I've always had to say no until now. It's time to begin this next chapter of my music with a stripped down collection of new and old songs. 

 I am working on two rock projects later this year. One is a special project with my former bandmates in Stealin Horses and the other is a band called Pie Tramps with former 4 Non Blondes bassist Christa Hillhouse and Australian drummer Clinno Bugger here in Austin. These projects are exciting and rowdy and fulfilling on the rock and roll end of things. This all acoustic singer songwriter project will be exciting in a completely different soul fulfilling way. I hope you will join me in this adventure!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by posting links to this campaign and spreading the word with the Indiegogo support tools.You can send me suggestions for old songs you'd like rerecorded on the solo project or any thoughts about performance venues or elements that could be added to the Caravan website.  My old guitar has cracked, and its sound is gone. I know there is another guitar coming to me, but I'm not sure what its path will be. You could keep your fingers crossed for me and my next guitar to find one another. I will tell you all about it on "The Caravan".  Thank you for your continued support!

story:
Being an opera singer takes extraordinary talent, incredible discipline and a great deal of luck. Opera singers are quite similar to non-profit arts organizations where earned income is only a portion of the total yearly operating budget.  I myself, have been a cater waiter, actor at birthday parties, freelance writer and paid studio audience member in order to fund my operatic career.  With the cost of each audition ranging from $35 to $50 dollars, voice lessons being approximately $150 and coachings costing about $75 a pop, many aspiring opera singers spend more time trying to fund the cost of the career vs. having a career. 

The great singers of the past had individual sponsors who would help fund their
careers, but in today’s world, those who support the arts tend to donate to organizations versus individuals.  However with websites like indigogo.com, "creatives" have found a way to fund projects ranging from marketing a new recording project to securing funds for a European audition tour.  In 2011 I successfully funded a Kickstarter.com project entitled “Rogues and Scoundrels:
Rethink the Recital” which I performed on April 8, 2011 in Columbus, Ohio to a full house.  “Rogues and Scoundrels" takes the recital format and mixes in elements of narration, performance art and cabaret.  It is currently in negotiations to be performed in the 2014-2015 season.

I have been fortunate that the last three seasons have been filled with wonderful singing engagements and have allowed me to make the bulk of my living as a singer. During the 2012-13 season I spent $1,108.67 in audition expenses (fees, accompanists and travel) and am expecting to nearly double that with auditions in New York as well as throughout the United States. Additional expenses include working with a voice teacher  and vocal coaches.  In opera, it is said that if a singer gets 1 job out every 10 auditions, then they are doing quite well.  Last season I sang 21 live auditions and received 10 contract offers (I had to turn down two jobs due to scheduling issues.)  I was also fortunate to receive three return engagements. 

Since I see myself as the CEO of Eric McKeever, Inc., I believe that I must look at my career very much like a business person would look at a corporation.  Many companies have investors who help build capital so that the business can succeed.  My goal is to raise $2000 to cover a majority of my projected audition and preparation expenses.  Funds raised will be used directly for audition and audition related expenses.  I am seeking "investors" who believe in my talent and would like to be part of the success of Eric McKeever, baritone.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Chad Brawley. I'm a Christian musician from Houston, Texas that is committed to using the arts to serve all people. 

God has used my background, educational experiences and passion for ministry to push me forward into this season of service. As a Director of Worship Arts for many years, I've noticed that congregations participate most (musically) when songs are relevant, pitched with them in mind, have great music and theologically sound lyrics. This project includes all of these elements....intentionally.

The WeWorshipProject is designed to serve the Body of Christ with music that encourages personal/corporate participatory, passionate and purposeful expression of love and worship to God. With this project, it's our goal to get as many people as possible singing and participating in personal and corporate worship..regularly. We'd like for this music to energize the worship culture/atmosphere in churches all across the world. Heartfelt praise and worship brings such LIFE to life. Literally, lives will be changed for the better!

What We Need & Why

We are in need of $15,000 to complete the project. The live recording was last winter in Houston, Texas. The event was AMAZING! Talented musicians and vocalists blended their gifts and worshipped God in passionately. Now the post production process is underway. We are recording overdub vocals, adding horn and string arrangements, mixing and etc. All of these procedures are very expensive, as they are quite lengthy and involve studio time and multiple fees. Your help will enable us to complete this huge project WITH EXCELLENCE.

There will be a fresh debut concert in the winter of 2012. You are absolutely invited to join us! (more details to follow) 

The Impact

God the father is so in love with us and desires close relationship. Music can be used as an excellent tool of expression to and worship of God. I've seen lives changed over time because of passionate and heartfelt connection with the Father though prayer, scripture and the use of music in the life of the believer. I've seen the Holy Spirit use His Word coupled with music to influence the hearts of non-believers as well. Additionally, we've been charged with the responsibility and opportunity to celebrate with music! 

Other Ways You Can Help

All donations are valuable and important to us. We are very grateful for each of them. If you are not able to make a monetary donation at this time, please be sure to earnestly pray for us, this project and it's reach across the world. Pray that God is glorified and people everywhere take their worship lives up a notch!

Most of all, I ask that you ALL please share this info with your family and friends. We will appreciate all of the help we may receive.

story:
Hi Folks! 

Thank you for Watching and Sharing My Campaign!

I'm Penelope Santana!

And this is the project that I bring to all you you!


Here you have some Background info:

I'm a musician from DR and I'm totally committed to the craft of music. I Work as a music Educator and Musician! This Year I auditioned to an Amazing Colleague of Music in the US! (Berklee Colleague Of Music), and i was Accepted and Awarded with Half and Scholarship! :)  Scholarship Letter

I had a 10% Help from an Educational Institution in my country to pay for the other half  of the tuition, which helps me a lot! But I still need another 40% (US 16,000) to complete my first year as they are 4 in total. My goal is raice ($US 18,000 - Indiegogo fees + Bank Fees = $US16,000) ;)

I'm trying to enroll on Spring (January 2014) because that exactly year my scholarship expires and I can't lose this great opportunity.

This is a bid deal for me and all the people that have been in this situation; it defines a very important time in anyone's life. Been able to expand your horizons and go for what you love and want to do no matter the cost.

And how sweet from you all, to help me to achieve this!

I really need your help to make this happen. Don't worry too much about the quantity! ANY little bit helps me!

Click Here to Like Facebook Page! :)


PERKS!

Here on your right you have these pretty cool perks for you! It will be very easy to contact me so I can send/give to you the perks as soon as I can.

Classes are personalized via Online (Skype, Google Video). You can write to me specifically what you would like to learn/achieve and I'll do my best to make it happen.


FOUNDS RAISED

With the money raised on this Campaign I'm going to be able to play for my first Year of Studies. After that term I'll be able to work and search for more opportunities to keep paying my tuition. Whether or not I reach my goal the money raised is still going to my studies and it's a big help for me! Your help make a BIG difference!


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't contribute right now, it's Ok! Make the word out! Make son NOISE about this Campaign! Help me Spread it to the World!

You can also use the Indiegogo Shae Tools ( Twitter, Facebook, Blogs...)

Click here to LIKE Facebook Page!   and Share ;) 


BAND INFO:

Here are some links of EL METRO: 

Facebook

Bandcamp

Twitter

Instagram


WHERE CAN YOU FIND ME? 

Twitter

Facebook

Instagram


ADITIONAL VIDEO INFO:

*Thank you to Gabriela Deneb, Dave Prestol and Miguel Lora for helping me to make this and encouraging me to do it!


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hola a todos! 

Gracias por ver y compartir Mi Campaña!


Soy Penélope Santana!

Y este es mi proyecto que les brindo a todos ustedes!


Aquí tienes más información complementaria:

Soy Músico de Rep.Dom y estoy totalmente comprometida al arte de la música. Trabajo como Educadora y Músico! Y en este año en curso audicioné a una increíble Universidad de Música en los Estados Unidos!(Berklee Colleague of Music),  y fui Aceptada y Premiada con Media Beca! :) Carta de Beca 

Obtuve un 10$ de ayuda de una Institución Educacional del país para poder pagar por la otra parte de mi matrícula, lo cual me ayuda mucho! Pero todavía necesito otro 40$ ($US16,000) para completar mi primer año de estudios, ya que son 4 años. Mi meta es ( $US18,000 - Tarifas de Infiegogo = $US16,000)  ;)

Estoy tratando de inscribirme en Primavera (Enero 2014) porque ese mismo año se vence la Beca y no puedo dejar pasar esta oportunidad.

Esto es un gran logro para mi y todas las personas que han estado en esta situación; define un momento muy importante en la vida de una persona. Tener la oportunidad de expandir tus horizontes e ir detrás de aquello que amas y quieres hacer sin importar el costo.

Y que amable de todos ustedes, al ayudarme a lograr esto!

Realmente necesito tu ayuda para hacer esto posible. No te preocupes tanto por la cantidad! CUALQUIER pequeña ayuda, me ayuda!

Click aquí para ir a Página de Facebook!


GRATIFICACIONES!

Acá a tu derecha tienes una gratificaciones muy Cool! Para darte las gracias por tu colaboración! Será muy fácil contactarme para así poder enviarte/darte tus regalos tan pronto como pueda!

Las Clases son personalizadas vía Online (Skype, Google Video), puedes escribirme y contarme que te gustaría lograr/aprender y haré los posible para que lo puedas realizar!


FONDOS GANADOS

Con los fondos obtenidos en esta campaña podré pagar por mi primer año de estudios. Después de este podré trabajar y buscar mas oportunidades para seguir pagando mi matricula. Logre o no logre recaudar todo el dinero, este de todas formas va hacia mis estudios, pues es una GRAN ayuda! Tu puedes ayudar a hacer una GRAN diferencia!


OTRAS MANERAS DE AYUDAR

Si no puedes contribuir en este momento, esta bien! Habla de esta campaña! Haz ruido sobre ella! Compártela en la redes Sociales y riega la voz!

Puedes también usar las herramientas de compartir de Indiegogo ( Twitter, Facebook, Email...)


INFORMACION DE LA BANDA:

Aquí tienes los links de la Banda EL METRO:

Facebook

Bandcamp

Twitter

Instagram


DONDE ME PUEDES ENCONTRAR?

Twitter

Facebook

Instagram


INFORMACION ADICIONAL DEL VIDEO

*Gracias a Gabriela Deneb, Dave Prestol y Miguel Lora por ayudarme con el video y alentarme para hacer esto.

Acá a tu derecha tienes una gratificaciones muy Cool! Para darte las gracias por tu colaboración! Será muy fácil contactarme para así poder enviarte/darte tus regalos tan pronto como pueda!
Las Clases son personalizadas vía Online (Skype, Google Video), puedes escribirme y contarme que te gustaría lograr/aprender y haré los posible para que lo puedas realizar!

FONDOS GANADOS
Con los fondos obtenidos en esta campaña podré pagar por mi primer año de estudios. Después de este podré trabajar y buscar mas oportunidades para seguir pagando mi matricula. Logre o no logre recaudar todo el dinero, este de todas formas va hacia mis estudios, pues es una GRAN ayuda! Tu puedes ayudar a hacer una GRAN diferencia!

OTRAS MANERAS DE AYUDAR
Si no puedes contribuir en este momento, esta bien! Habla de esta campaña! Haz ruido sobre ella! Compártela en la redes Sociales y riega la voz!
Puedes también usar las herramientas de compartir de Indiegogo ( Twitter, Facebook, Email...)

story:
Sanctified: Deitor Darker & the Infinites

A multi-media rock opera concept album: music, literature & illustration

Claire on a Dare presents, "Sanctified:  Deitor Darker and The Infinites" -- a full length concept album that chronicles the 100+ year-long affair of Deitor and Claire, two lovers possessed by demons and gifted (or cursed?) with infinite life.  Lust, power, desperation and betrayal propel them through a tormented struggle as they battle for one final existential resolution.

This multi-media art project combines the music of Claire on a Dare, their full original story, and the lush illustrations of Timothy Tang into a thrilling journey for the senses.

Let's Hear the Music

Your support in this campaign lets us get the Sanctified tracks recorded.

We've composed an all original story and complete album.  Now we need your help to bring it to life in it's full glory.  We're preparing to head into the studio in mid January of 2014 for a planned album release in the Summer of 2014.  But we can't make it happen alone.

Meanwhile, if you're wondering about the song playing in the background of our video, it's called Man's World.  It's the first recording with this lineup, and a good representation of the styles you can look forward to in the Sanctified Rock Opera.  

We recorded this for an upcoming movie called Hola Venky, another successfully Indiegogo-funded video project. (The movie features a cameo appearance by Steve of Claire on a Dare, so check it out!)

(You can find music from our earlier EP below) 

Meet the Illustrator

Claire on a Dare is thrilled to announce our collaboration with the talented Timothy Tang. His beautiful illustrations will bring the story of Deitor and Claire to life in vivid imagery.  His work will be included with the record.  

  

Please visit his website to view more art, and LIKE his page on Facebook to follow his work.  

The Sanctified Story

As we continue to refine the prose, we'll offer up sneak peaks of the story in progress on our blog for you to follow.   We also welcome your feedback, so please leave comments.

We will reveal a new chapter, along with lyrics to a song, every Sunday night throughout this campaign, beginning Nov 24, 2013.  Tune in to our blog at claireonadare.com to follow the story, and LIKE us on Facebook for real time updates.
  • Chapter 1 + Lyrics to Girl Called Claire
  • Chapter 2 + Lyrics to Love Burns
  • Chapter 3 + Lyrics to Truth Serum
  • Chapter 4 + Lyrics to All Too Familiar & Far From Home

Meet the Musicians

Claire on a Dare is an indie rock band from the San Francisco Bay Area.  Our members have a rich and diverse background in the music scene; we've done original songwriting, founded groups of our own, and collaborated with various musicians and performers.

Here's just a small sample of other recent projects we've worked on.

  • Carla Riggi - "Claire" - vocals
    • Other projects: Troupe Serge (Serge Gainsbourg tribute), Tower of Floyd (Pink Floyd tribute), Blue Scorpion Dance Theater (guest artist), Jai Young Kim (guest artist), Hey Man Hey
  • Stephen Paul Dix - songwriter, guitar, keys
    • Other projects: Arctic Zone, Martian Scoundrels, The Ethereals, Brother Orchid, Logan 5
  • Mark Olson - lead guitar
    • Other projects: Lazzari Experiment, various blues and jazz excursions
  • Raymond Nonato - bass
    • Other projects: Redshift, Real Social Anxiety, Tonepoet
  • Les Shanrock - drums
    • Other projects: Mute Angst, Envy, Miscreants, Screaming from the Altar, Grimace & the Fakers, Swivel, Faust, Green Room, Throes

Want More Music?

Here you can enjoy the music from our most recent EP, featuring Carla, Steve and Doug Johnson.  There will be a little of this flavor in the new album, but we're driving more toward shoegaze and psychedelic roots for Sanctified.



Your Donations Make Art Possible

As we talked about in a recent blog post, independent art is very much by the people and for the people.  Without your belief in our vision and support to bring it to life, we could not make this happen.

And for that we thank you with all our hearts!

Your generous donations will help us reach the following milestones:

  • 4 days of studio recording for our 5-member group
  • Music production, mixing, mastering
  • Basic travel, food and lodging while recording - we're frugal, we promise
  • CD and Record Album release - yes, we want to send you a beautiful vinyl album
  • Story Printing
  • Illustration Printing
  • Album marketing and promotion
  • Gifts to say thank you for helping us make this dream a reality!


Other Ways You Can Help

We're VERY grateful for every way you help support this project, and that doesn't have to be simply monetary.   There are so many different ways you can help bring this project to life, and we'd like to say thank you for these types of contributions too, so let us know!

  • Share the link to this fundraiser throughout your social networks like Facebook and Twitter
  • Come out to our live shows.  We have only 2 left before we dedicate ourselves to this recording project!
  • Check out our past albums on iTunes

Many Thanks!!  We greatly appreciate your support!

And for that we thank you with all our hearts!

story:
Our Short Story

We are, simply put, a rock and roll band from Salisbury, Maryland.  We grew up playing music together in various projects ranging from church youth groups to worship teams and touring regionally, and eventually found ourselves hanging out in a studio writing songs.  

While we would love to play more shows for everyone and grow a fan base, we find ourselves needing to put out our music so that people can identify with what we are doing . 

We live in an area where the local, original music scene has lost steam.  There are no all ages venues (yet), nor are there really any promoters throwing shows that don't consist of cover bands that play for 4+ hour sets.  That isn't us, nor do we want it to be.  

We believe we can help cultivate our local music scene by releasing an EP, playing shows, and helping motivate other bands in our area.

The first step in this is to release our music so people can hear it.  This is where you come in.  We have created 5 original songs we want to share with you.  We like them, and think you will too!  

We want to go into the studio for a few weeks and record, mix, and master these 5 songs.  Possibly more, if we exceed our goal.  But we think 5 is a good start.

By YOU contributing, you will be helping our vision come to life.  The world is better with music, so help us make the world better!


Check out our demo of one of the songs we will record in the studio... 



What We Need & What You Get

Let's break it down in more detail:

We need funds.  We all have bills, jobs, mortgages, families, and have to provide for them.  We really can't afford to do this on our own, but collectively with your help, we can make it work!

Broken down the costs look like this:

  • Recording and editing = $3750
  • Mixing = $1500
  • Mastering = $1000
  • Production costs (strings, drum heads, equipment) = $750
  • Indiegogo Fees: $500

All-in this is going to cost AT LEAST $7,000.  That might be a shocking number to most, but we are actually working with a member of our band, Garrett, who will produce, record and mix the record, at a significantly discounted rate, while still allowing us to spend the proper amount of time on it.  

These things take time and we don't want to release a "demo" quality product.  We want it to sound amazing and have the energy that we get when we play the songs live.  

Now that we covered that, take a look at these "perks".  We think we have some really cool things for you!  

If for some reason we don't reach our goal, Indiegogo gets roughly 10% of ALL donations we receive. With a reduced budget, we wouldn't be able to spend enough time to record all 5 of these songs.

The Impact

YOUR contribution, will allow this project to happen.  You will be making music with The Vinroots!  It's almost like you are the 5th member of the band.  Exciting!

WE actually think that this project, if funded successfully, will help kickstart the orginal music culture that is produced in Salisbury.  There is so much talent here.  So many local musicians that NEED to be making music, and aren't, simply because there isn't much of a way to connect the artist to the fans.  This campaign changes that for us.  And eventually for many artist from here like us.  

Crowdfunding has changed entire communities of artist, storytellers, and creatives alike.  Let this be another example!  


Shipping

Domestic shipping is built into each package. For international shipping, please raise your contribution by $10 after you select your package! See below for more details.

FAQs

  • What sizes are available for the shirt & where do I pick?
    Standard sizes of S-XL will be available. Prior to shipment we'll send you an email and you'll be able to choose your size.
  • When will the album come out?
    We have not announced a release date as of yet but will communicate that to you at the end of this campaign.
  • When will my stuff ship?
    Just prior to release of the album (see above). Digital copies of the album will be emailed to everyone at least 72 hours prior to official release.
  • How do I pay for the international or extra shipping?
    After clicking "Contribute Now" and selecting your package you can increase the contribution amount in the field above by $10 or more.
  • I forgot to pay $10 or more for the international or extra shipping!
    No problem, just click "Contribute Now" again and make a contribution that is not for any specific package. Please make sure you make this contribution under the same email address as the original. Thanks!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we will still love you and appreciate you even reading this!  You can still help though by doing the following:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.  Thanks so much for being apart of this community! 

Cheers!

The Vinroots. 

Pete, Chad, James, Garrett

story:
About

Contributors fund some of the best ideas, so why should you invest your hard earned money into our projects!?

Well we at 99% have been making some serious noise in the industry for over the last 3 years, with the fact it is run by a family makes all the difference, and the personal touches we can create are astounding. Ran By the Rhymes family which consists of Insight & Kirsty and also with a little help from our son Raiden.

 

OUR WORK

We have worked with nearly every genre of musician you can imagine! From Blackberry adverts - BMW commercials, we have licenced our music to a whole host of programmes, including, channel 4 (Uk), channel 5 (Uk), Adult Swim (USA) and many more..

Now its time for 99% to release our music to the masses, and create something no other audio engineering firm would allow, to distribute some of there best work to the masses..

..With a Vinyl and Cassette only release!

You can check out some of the sounds that will be included on the album on our bandcamp music page: http://www.99percent.bandcamp.com/

Thanks for taking time out your day to read this and help us achive our goal of good music and putting out profits back into the community!

What We Need & What You Get

Why we need your support (Breakdown):

-£1000 for the pressing on the vinyl

-£250 for the artwork and cover.

-All profits from the sale of this album after release will be going straight to local charitys, mainly Maggies Cancer Caring Centres.

-If donations exceed the required amount we will also be donating it to out chosen charity. 

All funds for Production costs, Artist fees, Studio time, Licensing, Promotional costs have all been raised through the support of our fans.

The Impact

If we don't reach our goal of £1,250, we will be charged a 9% fee of all money raised. So please, help us get to our goal. We've put a lot of time and effort into this project and we'll be pretty bummed if we can't get you the quality product you deserve.

Please share this with as many people as you can! You can use Indiegogo's Share Tools, post it on Facebook, Twitter, email or text it.

Other Ways You Can Help 99% Studios

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Promote this page, via Facebook, Twitter, ect.
  • Check out our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/99-Studios/444239985588652?fref=ts
  • Download some of our previous material from the music page: http://99percent.bandcamp.com/

And that’s all there is to it, support the artists, and the music shall keep coming! :-)

story:
Short Summary

My name is Dave. Hi.  I have been making music since childhood and it has always been a dream of mine to do it for a living somehow.  2013 has been a land mark year for me.  I've lost my job, booked a small tour, sold all of my belongings and will be living out of my Jetta for the next few months while I tour until I can afford to pay rent somewhere and call this music thing I love to do, a career. 

What We Need & What You Get

What I need is help funding the remaining travel expense that I can not already cover myself.  This campaign, when funded, will enable me to perform the gigs I have already booked as well as covering fuel costs, merchandise costs that I will be selling, and any repairs that may come up. Oh and possibly some ramen noodles at times :) 

I have been custom making shirts for a few weeks to sell as merch and give as perks for those who contribute.  I've also constructed and painted a custom backdrop to tour with that one lucky contributor will own at the close of the tour.  I'm giving songs, banners, stickers, and a plethora of other awesome rewards to contributors.

Even if I don't reach my goal, the funds are still going to everything I have already mentioned.  Keeping love on the road!  

The Impact

The Impact is unmatched in my opinion. I am taking a huge step with faith that this will be successful for me, that my dream will become my reality. That every movement thus far has lead to this movement and hence justifies such a leap.

If you choose to contribute, I will be blessed and truly forever in debt to you.  No amount of money could reflect the meaning of your support and so can never be repaid. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you choose not to contribute monetarily, yet still want to support.  Please share this cause/campaign with all of your friends, and around your social networks.  That in itself out values money if you ask me.  I truly thank you for your time in checking out my campaign and I hope to see you all out on the road this summer. 

-KEEPLOVE

story:
Thank you for visiting the Darrow Chemical Company campaign page!

Many of you are familiar with our band and we thank you for your continued support. But for those that aren’t, Darrow Chemical Company comes from the ashes of several namesake underground bands. Past member projects include Mister Monster, Gotham Road, Michale Graves Band (Ex Misfits), Blitzkid and The Doomsday Prophecy.

This band was started in late 2009 and we have prided ourselves on being a hard working DIY band from that moment. Since October 2011 Darrow Chemical Company has released 2 studio EP’s and 1 live EP on our own label, W.H.B. Records. A split 7” on No Balls Records (Germany) and a Second Pressing of our 1st Studio EP in cassette format (W.H.B. Records). We also embarked on a self booked, financed and promoted national tour, not to mention a pretty impressive line of DIY merchandise.

To this point, we have been able to operate our careers through our own resources and funding. We’re pretty proud about what we’ve been able to accomplish over the last decade. We have established long term relationships and have met great friends all over the globe as a result.

With that said, we think we’re capable of offering the fans so much more in terms of quality of music, promotion, merchandise and volume of touring if we had investors to help us reach the necessary financial platform.

Darrow Chemical Company is in the pre-production process of their 3rd studio EP and planning their 2nd US tour to support it. The band needs a reliable tour van. We also look to step up the production value of our recordings, want to provide new merchandise and want to ensure a successful round of tours and EP with adequate promotional materials.

This is where you, the fans, and Indiegogo come into play!

We look at this as an opportunity for us to achieve all of our goals and an opportunity for you to invest in a project and group of musicians that you believe in. We have tried to come up with fun and valuable perks at every level as an incentive to invest in our campaign without being too cheesy about it.

We’ve set our campaign goal at $10,000. The following is an outline of the items our budget will cover:

- A reliable tour van (A Bulk of the budget will be reserved for a tour van. The better the van, the more tours we’ll be able to do)

- A trailer for our gear

- Insurance and maintenance costs for tour van (Something is bound to go wrong)

- Recording, mixing and mastering of a 5-6 song EP

- Graphics, artwork and layout for EP

- Digital distribution costs and physical pressing of the EP

- Backdrop and a few other production items to enhance our live performance

- New/additional merchandise and restocking of the old merchandise. (We have some really cool ideas)

- Promotional Items such as tour posters, postcards, flyers, street team incentives/mailers, etc… (This is mandatory and can get pricey!)

- Cost of shipping and producing the perks and incentives made available through this campaign. 

Perks and Incentives!

Our perks and incentives for pledging include

-     An advanced copy of the EP

-     2 Exclusive shirts 

-     Guitar lessons from Loki

-     Sponsorship programs

-     Name our van contest

-     Loki records a guest guitar track on your bands next album

-     A special cover song challenge!

-     Private shows

-     Music gear

-     And much more

You’ll see a much more detailed rundown of our perks in the right column! We will be adding and removing perks as we go along so if you see something you're interested in, act quick! You never know how long that perk will be available. We worked hard on trying to create incentives that gave you an excellent value on your investment and are fun. We hope that you like what we have to offer!

You define our success!

We’re excited about this campaign. We’re lucky to have had such loyal support from our family, friends and fans throughout the years. We’re looking to create a team concept with all of you. This band begins and ends with you. We can only hope to entertain and inspire you to the best of our abilities.

Every contribution counts!

No contribution is too small. Every pledge makes a world of difference. We are humbled by your contributions and appreciate your efforts all the same!

Can’t invest monetarily?

Trust us. We understand that times are tough. But maybe you can invest a little bit of your time? Please take a moment and share this campaign on ALL of your social networks and even spread it by word of mouth. You can use the social networking tools available on this site to help share our page!

Let’s get the maximum exposure possible for this campaign. If our goal is reached or exceeded, you can rest assured that we will work our asses off to produce the best sounding record that we’re capable of and we’ll secure the most reliable van available so we can see you all in the near future!   

We humbly thank you so much for the support.
Let’s do this!
Slayer Be With You

***PERK UPDATES***

New Darrow Chemical Company Full Discography Perk Includes!

Darrow Chemical Company “A Nightmare on Seventh Avenue” CD. Only 245 released. SOLDOUT NO LONGER AVAILABLE!

Darrow Chemical Company: “Live in Brooklyn” CD Only 100 released. SOLD OUT NOLONGER AVAILABLE!

Darrow Chemical Company/Vagora Split 7" Only 138 released. SOLD OUT NO LONGERAVAILABLE!

Darrow Chemical Company “A Nightmare on Seventh Avenue” Cassette Only 245 released.

Ghouls Night Out Presents: Songs to Murder that Special Someone 2 CD

Darrow Chemical Company “Lone Star State” CD

You will also get our upcoming EP 1 week earlier than it’s release date.

This is a rare chance to collect our whole discography in one swoop!
Limited to 2!
Perk available for $245 contribution

 

Women's Tank Top & Canvas Tote bag

 

Exclusive Shirt Design #1

 

Exclusive Shirt Design #2
story_txt:
Thank you for visiting the Darrow Chemical Company campaign page!
Many of you are familiar with our band and we thank you for your continued support. But for those that aren’t, Darrow Chemical Company comes from the ashes of several namesake underground bands. Past member projects include Mister Monster, Gotham Road, Michale Graves Band (Ex Misfits), Blitzkid and The Doomsday Prophecy.  This band was started in late 2009 and we have prided ourselves on being a hard working DIY band from that moment. Since October 2011 Darrow Chemical Company has released 2 studio EP’s and 1 live EP on our own label, W.H.B. Records. A split 7” on No Balls Records (Germany) and a Second Pressing of our 1st Studio EP in cassette format (W.H.B. Records). We also embarked on a self booked, financed and promoted national tour, not to mention a pretty impressive line of DIY merchandise.  To this point, we have been able to operate our careers through our own resources and funding. We’re pretty proud about what we’ve been able to accomplish over the last decade. We have established long term relationships and have met great friends all over the globe as a result.  With that said, we think we’re capable of offering the fans so much more in terms of quality of music, promotion, merchandise and volume of touring if we had investors to help us reach the necessary financial platform. Darrow Chemical Company is in the pre-production process of their 3rd studio EP and planning their 2nd US tour to support it. The band needs a reliable tour van.
