story:
Summary (short version)

This campaign will help realise the debut album of Norwegian artist Espen Solheim. Complementing experimental noise music with visual art and dubious writing.

 

Summary (long version)

Hi, my name is Espen Solheim, a Norwegian artist that's been keeping himself busy both with music, visual art and writing for quite some time.

This is where this campaign comes into light. Letting you help me grow this project into fruition. My mad plan of a music project complimented both by my visual art and some dubious writing.

The project has slowly been in development for quite some time now. Growing from a simple idea over a decade ago, turning into something too ambitious, put on the shelf several times, waiting for the right time. And slowly the pieces have fallen into place and the timing seems right now to make this happen!

As I said. This is where you step in! By helping fund this project you get to both help realize it, but also you get these nifty perks.

For those of you new to crowdfunding, it should be quite self evident how things work. But feel free to ask around, it has been a growing phenomenon these last couple of years and help a lot of independant artist realise their dreams. But I won't go into it too much since most of you out there are probably familiar with the setup.

In any case. You have my eternal gratitude just for reading this and showing your interest in the campaign even if you don't feel you can contribute in a monetary way. Feel free to help in other ways if you can. Spread the word, make people aware of the campaign and you'll make a man happy!

 

The Nitty Gritty (details)

So let us get into the details of the campaign, for those of you who like to read and have survived this far. As far as genre goes, the music can be called noise music, experimental. This might make a couple of you wretch and some of you just wonder what the heck I am talking about. The video on top should give some kind of teaser or hint as to how the music will sound. Hopefully it will sound interesting to some people out there, but as you quickly might realize, this is not about mainstream pop music.

Regarding the artworks. Most of it will be in a style suited to the atmosphere of the music. First of all there will be a series of photographs and maybe after a while there will be some drawings or paintings. Hard to say, I like to keep the future of the project open to go in any direction. There will be both figurative and abstract photographies. You could say some of them will be "experimental" in the proper sense of the word. Future updates will show of some of these pictures and give some kind of indication of what I am talking about.

The writing? Well... you will just have to wait and see. Some of you might already see where I am coming from with this and have some clue as to how that will turn out. But I don't want to spoil anything just yet.

 

Where does the money go?

I am asking for a $500 minimum (and there will be stretch goals should this campaign be crazy successful) simply because this is the lowest amount you can set in an IndieGoGo campaign. But the project will be possible to realise with less, so it is set up with flexible funding in mind.

Most of the money will go into equipment that will make it possible for me to do this independently without the help of labels or anything that would compromise the integrity of it all. I've been in the business of making music for a while now and labels, especially for niché projects like this seem redundant and become a detriment to creativity and growth in the market. But let's leave the politics out of this.

Some of the money will of course also go into production of the physical part of the album and make it possible for me to showcase prints of the artworks on concerts and other events.

 

So why should you help?

I could spout clichés about how it will warm a tired mans heart and stuff like that. And it would be true. But you won't just be helping me, you would be helping an idea. The direct interaction between consumer and creator, leaving the labels and big suits out of it. You decide what you want to hear and see and make things possible with your direct help, instead of products being shoved down your throats by some money machine trying to sell the next teen idol.

Or you could be more direct about it. You'd get cool perks for a fraction of the price!

As we say in Norway: "Løp og kjøp!"

story:
Short Summary

Join the Mimesis Ensemble in molding a dynamic new repertoire for the 21st century which reflects the intellectual, emotional, and social experiences of people today.  We need your ongoing partnership in our 5th season to continue connecting our composers, artists and audiences in a dynamic way.  

The Mimesis Ensemble has enjoyed an exciting year so far - here are some of the highlights!

  • We released our debut CD with Bridge Records in the Fall, 2012, featuring Mohammed Fairouz's opera, Sumeida's Song.
  • We returned to Carnegie Hall in Jan, 2013, with a program titled "Portraits" which featured chamber music by Anna Clyne, Alexandra du Bois, Mohammed Fairouz, and Daniel Bernard Roumain.  The program explored works which each told a musical story.
  • We are busy preparing for our final concert on May 4, 2013, at Merkin Concert Hall, titled "Change," with works by Caleb Burhans, Patrick Burke, Mohammed Fairouz, Judd Greenstein, and David T. Little.  The program explores the dynamic and vibrant changes occuring in our world, and in our music.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to complete the season, and also prepare for our 2013-14 season!  Here is where your donations go - 

  • Hall Rental
  • Artist Fees
  • Percussion Rental
  • Publicity
  • Rehearsal Space
  • Purchasing the scores/parts
  • Hall deposits for our 2013-14 Season
  • additional funds raised will support our 2013-14 Season

We view our work as a partnership with our donors and audience members, and rely on your financial assistance and presence at our concerts.  Our mission together is to explore the artistic vision of our composers, and to walk boldly towards the future.

The Impact

We believe that the ability of the arts to deepen our experience as human beings relies strongly on our willingness to remain open to, and support the music of our time.  Our ensemble's name, "Mimesis" means reflection, and refers to the way in which the arts reflect our experience as intellectual, emotional, and social beings.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Volunteer!
  • Attend our concerts
  • Help us spread the word 

We are building a community around this music, and invite you to be a part of this bold mission!

story:
Who or What is My God, It's Full of Stars?

My name is Rob Sweitzer.  I am a member of and keyboardist for the band known as MAE (Multisensory Aesthetic Experience) (Tooth & Nail Records 2003 - 2007)(Capitol Records 2007-2008).  MGIFOS is my new project.  "M29" is my EP of songs scheduled to be recorded and co-produced with Dave Elkins (MAE, Schematic) in Nashville, TN at 4115 Studios in November 2014.

After having been an active member of MAE in both writing and domestic and international touring, due to personal reasons and intra-band tension, I left MAE in 2008 to focus on home life back in Virginia and to pursue my own path in music. Unfortunately, shortly after my return to Virginia, I began to suffer depression which led to a mountain of unfinished demos and the inability to sustain a healthy home life.

In 2010, after some critical discussions with MAE leading to amends being made, I returned to contribute to the (e)vening EP, play keys on the "Goodbye, Goodnight" Tour as well as the Destination: Beautiful Anniversary shows in our hometown of Virginia Beach, Virginia in February 2013.

Although things seemed to be comparatively better for me at that point, it was not long after those shows in 2013 that the ongoing and undiagnosed depression caught up with me and reached an apex resulting in my attempt to find peace beyond this life.  As the philosopher Schöpenhauer once said, and I paraphrase, my fear of death was outweighed by my fear of living (or, really, the exhaustion of trying and my perceived failure to live).  Fortunately, a friend intervened and helped prevent what would have been an irreversible event.

It's taken some time, some heartfelt reflection, and some proactive measures to deal with a very dark time in my life.  I haven't reached nirvana and I don't think I ever will, but I have learned that challenges in life are not obstacles, or at least they don't have to be, but rather are opportunities to grow and become a stronger living being for myself and for others around me.

This EP - "M29" contains songs that capture my reflections on life and death, the meaning of existence, the strength of love, the peculiar relationship between light and dark, the universal calling of something tremendously larger than myself to know and be known, to love and be loved, the ongoing internal war between myself and God (or the interpretation of God by others and institutions as established truth), among other things.

It is my sincerest desire to share these songs with you with the hope that the content and the music will let you know that you are not alone in your individual and personal journey to find who you are.  The darkness serves the light in finding your way, one does not exist without the other and they both serve to help in learning the lessons you need to be stronger for yourself and ultimately for those with whom you may cross paths both now and in the future.


What MGIFOS Needs for M29

The goal that you see on this page has been calculated to cover the following expenses for a six (6) song EP and the perks provided for contributors to the campaign:

  • Use of 4115 Studios
  • Engineer fees
  • Production fees
  • Instrumentalist fees
  • Recording (tracking)
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Vinyl pressing
  • Online distribution
  • Marketing and publicity for the distribution of the EP
  • Fees associated with putting together donor perks/packages including but not limited to shirts, limited edition posters, additional bonus material of music tracks not on the EP called "Sketches," as well as limited edition printing of a photobook from my years in MAE.

What You Get For Contributing to M29

Please refer to the packages on the right hand side of the page or images below to learn more about what you get for supporting the "M29" campaign.

Where Do The Funds Go If The Goal Is Not Reached?

This campaign is under the fixed funding infrastructure which means that if the goal is not met, at the close of this campaign, all contributors who have paid for a perk will not be charged.  If, however, this campaign is 100% funded, your contributions will be automatically transferred from your credit card or Paypal account into MGIFOS's Paypal account to be used for all of the expenses listed above in making this EP come to life.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some of you may not be able to contribute at this time or some of you may choose not to contribute monetarily and that's perfectly fine, the good news is you still can help:

    • Tell others about this campaign and spread the word!
    • On this page you will find Indiegogo share tools which are easily at your disposal for sharing.  Please share this campaign with friends, family, co-workers and know that I thank you from the depths of my heart.

    Finally, the wound is where the light enters in and when it does, that is when healing takes place.  For those who find themselves in a  dark place, open yourself up to let the light overcome that darkness.  Share your problem with the ones you love but also find professional help from those who know how to help treat depression and all of its gradients including suicidal ideations.

    Call 1.800.273.8255 National Suicide Prevention Lifeline if you need immediate help.

    Love to all of you - Rob

  Other Ways You Can Help Some of you may not be able to contribute at this time or some of you may choose not to contribute monetarily and that's perfectly fine, the good news is you still can help: 
Tell others about this campaign and spread the word! On this page you will find Indiegogo share tools which are easily at your disposal for sharing.  Please share this campaign with friends, family, co-workers and know that I thank you from the depths of my heart. 
 Finally, the wound is where the light enters in and when it does, that is when healing takes place.  For those who find themselves in a  dark place, open yourself up to let the light overcome that darkness.  Share your problem with the ones you love but also find professional help from those who know how to help treat depression and all of its gradients including suicidal ideations.Call 1.800.273.8255 National Suicide Prevention Lifeline if you need immediate help.Love to all of you - Rob

story:
Quick Summary


Hey everyone!

As you all might know, we are the band Breckenwood. The idea behind our music has been alive for a very long time. It wasn't until 2012 when we released our debut album, "Take Me There" that our vision became a reality. It has been two years since we recorded Take Me There, and we have since then listened to it hundreds of times. At first, we absolutely loved it! We got an amazing deal and recorded it for free, as well as mastered for free. Now we are looking to take the next step forward, and this time, it wont be as cheap.

Although our previous cost of recording was non existent, we still had to pay for merch and getting CDs pressed, as well as various other expenses. Fortunately for us, we had Buzz Record's advancing us money to achieve these goals. As our contract is over, we no longer have that monetary contribution to help us, which is why we are reaching out to people like you.

As a band, we feel we owe it to not only ourselves, but also to you to produce music that is both professional sounding, and kick ass.
Through this Indygogo campaign, it is our goal to raise the funds required to record, and promote our new music. This includes recording with Rob Freeman (Producer of triple platinum song Stereo Hearts) of Pop-Punk band Hidden in Plain View, getting merch, distributing recordings, and starting touring funds.

Please give what ever you can! We have all kinds of awesome and affordable perks in place to compensate you for helping make this happen!

Here Is What We Need

What your donation will go toward:

  • First and foremost, we need to record! A large portion of the money raised will be for this specifically.
  • Merch! We need cool new shirts, and all kinds of other fun stuff to give out at our shows!
  • Music distribution! We need to be able to have physical copies of our music and be able to get digital copies to our fans no matter where they are!
  • Tour funds! We need a trailer and a new vehicle because Garrett's minivan isn't cutting it anymore. We don't expect much money to go to this but any left overs will.

Deep Impact

Breckenwood is going places, this is for sure. We are being looked at by much larger, national record label's and making connections with important people in the industry. Our tours have been getting bigger and bigger, and we do not expect them to stop growing. Most importantly, the biggest impact of this Indygogo is to get our music out there, to you.

    No Money? No Problem!!!

    Money is tight these days and we totally understand If you cannot contribute financially, but here are some ways you can still help our cause:

    • Share our Indygogo page on all of the social media forums you can!
    • Like and share our updates on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and Tumblr!
    • Come out to our FREE shows! They happen more often than you'd think!
    • Tell your friends about us!
    • Let us know what you think about our music!

story:
Short Summary

CrowdTunes is replacing outdated jukeboxes with an engaging, easy to use music marketplace powered from patrons' phones; we provide a free, turnkey music solution to bars that can be setup in less than five minutes and drive sales through an improved customer experience and revenue sharing. 

At approximately two-thirds of social venues, patrons have little to no control over the music. For the remaining locations, owners spend ~$5K to install a physical system, like TouchTunes, or pay a nightly fee to a DJ or Band. CrowdTunes provides a solution that falls between these two alternatives by allowing users to control the playlist without requiring a capital outlay from venue owners. CrowdTunes is a combination of three separate products:

1) Internet radio: The bar owner will be able to create a catered playlist that will play songs when no one is bidding on the music. This playlist can range from 100 songs to 20 million songs depending on the owners’ preferences.

2) Mobile jukebox: Patrons will be able to play songs within the owners’ playlist for a nominal fee (one credit) when no one else is bidding. Songs will play in the order with which they were bid unless someone wants to bid more than one credit to bump their songs to the top of the queue.

3) Marketplace for music: On high volume nights, patrons will bid collectively to push their songs to the top of the queue. These nights are the main driver of revenue with individual songs played for as much as $20 per song.

The current technological environment is ripe for the disruption CrowdTunes is bringing to the market. Virtually all restaurants are equipped with wireless internet capabilities and emerging technologies (i.e. ChromeCast, Smart TV’s, and advancements in Bluetooth), which will allow bars to leverage their existing hardware to install our music management system. This environments permits CrowdTunes to be connected in less than 5 minutes and on display for the entire bar to see.

Jukeboxes have been around since the early 1900’s and haven’t evolved over that time. We are still feeding dollars into clumsy machines that offer no personalization and limited interaction. The time has come for CrowdTunes to bring the jukebox into the 21st century and revolutionize the bar experience.

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to leverage existing relationships and resources to bring our product to market with minimal funding. We are in the process of collecting information regarding future costs including web development, android development, music acquisition costs, etc. Our initial analysis projects funding of $250K to fully launch the product. To date, we are 100% bootstrapped with all development work done in-house and a total of $6k raised through Duke University competitions. Check out our current prototype available now on the Appstore.

The proposed $25,000 raised in this competition will be allocated in the following ways.

1.  $15,000 for product development including existing product optimization and Android/HTML5 development.

2.  $10,000 legal analysis validating our existing music licensing strategy and intellectual property.

In the event we are unable to collect the entire $25,000, have no fear, your investment will be put to good use. We plan to release an alpha version of our product in late January with several permanent installations planned at bars and restaurants near you.  As these installations occur, we will let you know so you can head out with your friends to impose your will and music tastes on the entire bar with your preloaded credits and new CrowdTunes swag.

The Impact

We really want to impress upon you that this is much more than just a crazy idea.  We have built a working prototype and tested this concept several times throughout the fall of 2013 with great success. The atmosphere was frenetic with patron socialization increasing significantly.  In fact, we had an unsolicited investment offer from one of the bar owners and inquiries to install CrowdTunes permanently when fully commercialized by several others.

Let’s be real.  We aren’t out here to save the planet or cure world hunger. We believe the jukebox is ripe for innovation considering the evolving technical landscape in all venues we frequent on a daily basis. We are sick of being subject to Taylor Swift and Miley Cyrus out at the bars with our buddies when in reality we are looking to enjoy a taste of the 80’s and something like Asia – “Heat of the Moment”. Furthermore, at 1:30 AM as the bar is coming to a close and you just can’t go home without hearing Will Smith’s “Gettin’ Jiggy Wit It”, have no fear. CrowdTunes provides the transparent and dynamic marketplace to get your song playing immediately.

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to contribute, but still want to help? Great – we still need you!

Next time you are at your favorite watering hole and college bar, let the owner or manager know about CrowdTunes. Let them know about the ease of installation, the improved customer experience, and the potential to transform music from a cost center to a profit driver. Furthermore, handsome referral bonuses are awarded for new bar installations!

story:
We are Crunk Witch!

Our names are Brandon and Hannah and we make bass heavy, fantasy soaked, electropop music with an outdated program called Buzz. We live in northern Maine and have been releasing music and touring since our start back in 2009. This fundraiser is for our third album that will come out on August 13th 2014. It's a special date as it is the day after our 5th wedding (and band) anniversary, as well as the day before Brandon's 30th birthday. It's a big week!

Heartbeats in Hyperspace, an album for the fans!

After Jenna Marbles blasted the Battle Beyond, after Faith in the Thief, after the 100+ live shows, we really just wanted to write an album for you guys. An album that:

  • we would want to play live, cover to cover
  • sounded like the things we love (anime, video games, etc.)
  • you would be proud of.

The result is a supercharged, energetic, and upbeat record that we are beyond pumped about! Here's a new song from the album called "Hyper Magic":


Here's a demo from the album called "Hero":


You are our label!

Your contributions will help us bring our music to more people just like you. How much we raise will dictate how far we can take this.

    Awesome Rewards!

    Everything from digital downloads to a private show, we really threw it all in there for you. Stuff like a super rad shirt design made by Ryan Scully! (available in Womens: S, M & L and  Mens: S, M, L, XL & XXL)


    We'll do a full Crunk Witch version of your favorite song:


    There's even live gear we've used on tour that you can get, like:


    OR



    OR EVEN


    We'll even make you your own personal theme song so everyone can hear how awesome you are! There is a lot in here to get, so choose your reward wisely!

    Sum it up yo!

    We truly appreciate your support and involvement with Crunk Witch. It has meant so much to the both of us. We'd like to personally thank Ryan Scully for killing it on the art, our friends Matt and Diana Leighton for helping conceptualize it, Jason & Jess Bosch for helping us do the first music video, and all of our close friends for listening to the record and giving us direction and encouragement. No matter what happens, thank you for being here and for being you!

    with our love,
    Brandon & Hannah <Crunk Witch>

story:
Nous sommes La Fabrique, une coopérative de solidarité sherbrookoise engagée dans la construction d'un monde où les valeurs de partage, de démocratie, de créativité, d'autonomie et de respect de l'environnement en sont les fondations.

Nous croyons que notre projet est une opportunité incroyable de démocratiser les moyens de production, les moyens de création et les connaissances collectives au sein de la communauté.

Nous croyons que tous les citoyens, entrepreneurs et artistes doivent avoir accès à des outils et des espaces abordables pour mener à bien leurs projets les plus fous! 

Ça vous intéresse? Alors bienvenue à La Fabrique!

Pour plus d'information sur la coop et nos services, visitez notre nouveau site web.


 


Description des produits

Nous avons plusieurs produits et services en vente! Et regardez bien, certains sont à prix spéciaux pour des quantités limités! Voici un récapitulatif de ce que nous offrons...

Le gaminet de coton réconfortant d' OÖM Ethikwear au couleur de votre coop préférée. La Fabrique s'occupe de la sérigraphie du logo!..


Pour les curieux, voici à quoi ressemble notre fameuse, mais surtout exclusive, cravate en bois...


...et l'oeuvre exclusive d'ULTRA-NaN, artiste sherbrookois, créée spécialement pour La Fabrique sous le thème de la coopération !


- Ajoutez 5$ pour la livraison au Canada, ou 15$ à l'internationnal, sinon vous pourrez passer à La Fabrique lorsque votre article sera prêt; 

- Articles "Recevez-le pour Noël" : cravate en bois, carte d'abonnement et chèque-cadeau de formation... Commandez au plus tard le 15 décembre et mentionnez "cadeau de Noël" en commentaire privé suite à votre achat.

 

La Fabrique, c’est quoi?


Un atelier collectif

L’atelier collectif permet de rendre accessible des espaces communs de fabrication ainsi que des outils, traditionnels et à la fine pointe de la technologie, à nos membres. Pour répondre aux besoins particuliers des utilisateurs, nous visons à offrir des forfaits diversifiés selon la nature et la fréquence de l’utilisation des lieux.

Des formations diversifiées

Les formations sont essentielles au succès de La Fabrique. Elles permettent le partage des connaissances entre les membres tout en permettant à des professionnels d’enseigner leur art (ex : fabriquer sa propre chaise, introduction à l’impression 3D, cours de poterie, introduction à la soudure). De plus, des formations seront obligatoires pour utiliser les outils dangereux afin d’assurer la sécurité de tous et d’éviter les bris d’outils.

Des espaces de création individuels

L'atelier collectif offre un potentiel de création important qui est bonifié par la présence d'espaces de créations offerts en location aux membres. Ces ateliers à aire ouverte ou fermés permettent aux membres d'avoir un espace bien à eux pour la réalisation de leurs projets, de leurs créations ou des leurs activités commerciales.

Espaces de créations - Artisan's Asylum (Boston)


Le projet et son impact

Deux ans de prototypage

Depuis que l'idée est née il y a environ deux ans de cela dans l'appartement de la rue Denault à Sherbrooke, beaucoup de choses se sont produites. Nous avons premièrement créé un "prototype" d'atelier qui nous a permis de s'accoutumer avec la gestion d'un atelier. Dans la dernière année et demie, environ 50 personnes différentes ont payé une cotisation mensuelle pour utiliser le petit atelier de la rue Denault. Une quinzaine de formation ont été organisées pendant ce temps, touchant plus de 180 personnes. Le concept mis de l'avant par l'association "La Petite Fabrique" fut un grand succès et a permis à l'organisation de se faire connaître à Sherbrooke.

Atelier de fabrication de savon - La Petite Fabrique

L'année 2014, une GROSSE année

L'année 2014 fut très chargée pour La Fabrique. Étude de marché, plan d'affaire, création de partenariats, structuration à l'interne, recherche de locaux, financement, stratégie de communication... beaucoup de travail a été fait. Un des importants jalons que nous avons franchi l'automne dernier est la fondation de la coopérative. Le 9 septembre dernier, La Fabrique a passé d'association à coopérative de solidarité, faisant ainsi son apparition dans le paysage sherbrookois comme nouvelle entreprise. À l'assemblée d'organisation, 23 personnes étaient présentes afin de cofonder la coopérative.

Assemblée générale d'organisation - ArtFocus
Nous avons donc énormément travaillé pour nous rendre où nous sommes aujourd'hui. Notre travail a d'ailleurs été remarqué à plusieurs reprises pendant l'année. Nous nous sommes mérités le deuxième prix au niveau national du Concours québécois en entreprenariat dans la catégorie économie sociale, nous avons remporté le prix de la catégorie Relève, jeunes entrepreneurs lors du Gala découvertes coopératives organisé par le Conseil québécois de la coopération et de la mutalité, le Prix du jury lors du concours Ensemble, on va plus loin organisé également par le CQCM et finalement un prix lors du Change Maker Challenge d'Ashoka Canada.
Tout cela, tout en continuant de faire rouler La Petite Fabrique, où des membres viennent régulièrement réaliser leurs projets!

David Allard Martin et Étienne Plante - Gala Découvertes Coopératives (Québec)

La Fabrique s’en vient!

Tout ce travail, c'est pour converger vers l'idée que nous avions dès le départ : créer un atelier de 10 000 pieds carrés à Sherbrooke. Et cette idée est très proche de se réaliser. Depuis la fondation de la coopérative, plusieurs membres se sont joints à la coopérative. Tous et toutes travaillent afin de faire aboutir le projet le plus rapidement possible. Nous avons trouvé un local au centre-ville de Sherbrooke qui pourrait accueillir nos installations.
Notre objectif est donc d'ouvrir nos portes à l'hiver 2015, mais pour cela, on a besoin de vous!!!

Présentation aux membres intéressés aux espaces de créations individuels

Pourquoi 7 500$?

Nous sommes bien conscients que La Fabrique ne verra pas le jour seulement avec 7 500$, mais c’est ce dont nous avons besoin en ce moment pour que le projet devienne réalité. Ce montant nous permettra de débloquer le reste de notre financement (prêts et subventions qui nous ont été octroyés), en plus de fournir un capital essentiel à l'achat d'outils et à la réalisation des travaux d'améliorations de nos nouveaux locaux.

Comment vous pouvez prendre part à l'aventure

  • Achetez l'un des produits à l'effigie de La Fabrique ;
  • Vous savez que vous aller utiliser La Fabrique lors de son ouverture? Super! Achetez l'un des services en prévente! 
  • Devenez membre de la coopérative en venant nous visiter lors de nos fameux 5@9. Visitez notre page Facebook ou abonnez-vous à notre Infolettre pour être tenu au courant ;
  • Vous êtes loin de Sherbrooke, ou vous ne pensez pas utiliser les services de La Fabrique? Devenez membre de soutien! Cela vous donne tout de même un droit de vote à l'assemblée générale et vous permet de nous soutenir financièrement ;
  • Vous avez des outils qui pourraient permettre à nos membre de créez? Ils pourraient nous intéresser de les recevoir ou des vous les louer!

Un énorme MERCI de la part de La Fabrique et de ses membres!

Passez un super temps des Fêtes :)

Des formations diversifiées
Les formations sont essentielles au succès de La Fabrique. Elles permettent le partage des connaissances entre les membres tout en permettant à des professionnels d’enseigner leur art (ex : fabriquer sa propre chaise, introduction à l’impression 3D, cours de poterie, introduction à la soudure). De plus, des formations seront obligatoires pour utiliser les outils dangereux afin d’assurer la sécurité de tous et d’éviter les bris d’outils.
Des espaces de création individuels
L'atelier collectif offre un potentiel de création important qui est bonifié par la présence d'espaces de créations offerts en location aux membres. Ces ateliers à aire ouverte ou fermés permettent aux membres d'avoir un espace bien à eux pour la réalisation de leurs projets, de leurs créations ou des leurs activités commerciales.

Espaces de créations - Artisan's Asylum (Boston)

Le projet et son impact


Deux ans de prototypage
Depuis que l'idée est née il y a environ deux ans de cela dans l'appartement de la rue Denault à Sherbrooke, beaucoup de choses se sont produites. Nous avons premièrement créé un "prototype" d'atelier qui nous a permis de s'accoutumer avec la gestion d'un atelier. Dans la dernière année et demie, environ 50 personnes différentes ont payé une cotisation mensuelle pour utiliser le petit atelier de la rue Denault. Une quinzaine de formation ont été organisées pendant ce temps, touchant plus de 180 personnes. Le concept mis de l'avant par l'association "La Petite Fabrique" fut un grand succès et a permis à l'organisation de se faire connaître à Sherbrooke.


Atelier de fabrication de savon - La Petite Fabrique
L'année 2014, une GROSSE année
L'année 2014 fut très chargée pour La Fabrique. Étude de marché, plan d'affaire, création de partenariats, structuration à l'interne, recherche de locaux, financement, stratégie de communication... beaucoup de travail a été fait. Un des importants jalons que nous avons franchi l'automne dernier est la fondation de la coopérative. Le 9 septembre dernier, La Fabrique a passé d'association à coopérative de solidarité, faisant ainsi son apparition dans le paysage sherbrookois comme nouvelle entreprise. À l'assemblée d'organisation, 23 personnes étaient présentes afin de cofonder la coopérative.

Assemblée générale d'organisation - ArtFocus
Nous avons donc énormément travaillé pour nous rendre où nous sommes aujourd'hui. Notre travail a d'ailleurs été remarqué à plusieurs reprises pendant l'année. Nous nous sommes mérités le deuxième prix au niveau national du Concours québécois en entreprenariat dans la catégorie économie sociale, nous avons remporté le prix de la catégorie Relève, jeunes entrepreneurs lors du Gala découvertes coopératives organisé par le Conseil québécois de la coopération et de la mutalité, le Prix du jury lors du concours Ensemble, on va plus loin organisé également par le CQCM et finalement un prix lors du Change Maker Challenge d'Ashoka Canada.
Tout cela, tout en continuant de faire rouler La Petite Fabrique, où des membres viennent régulièrement réaliser leurs projets!



David Allard Martin et Étienne Plante - Gala Découvertes Coopératives (Québec)


La Fabrique s’en vient!
Tout ce travail, c'est pour converger vers l'idée que nous avions dès le départ : créer un atelier de 10 000 pieds carrés à Sherbrooke. Et cette idée est très proche de se réaliser. Depuis la fondation de la coopérative, plusieurs membres se sont joints à la coopérative. Tous et toutes travaillent afin de faire aboutir le projet le plus rapidement possible. Nous avons trouvé un local au centre-ville de Sherbrooke qui pourrait accueillir nos installations.
Notre objectif est donc d'ouvrir nos portes à l'hiver 2015, mais pour cela, on a besoin de vous!!!



Présentation aux membres intéressés aux espaces de créations individuels
Pourquoi 7 500$?
Nous sommes bien conscients que La Fabrique ne verra pas le jour seulement avec 7 500$, mais c’est ce dont nous avons besoin en ce moment pour que le projet devienne réalité. Ce montant nous permettra de débloquer le reste de notre financement (prêts et subventions qui nous ont été octroyés), en plus de fournir un capital essentiel à l'achat d'outils et à la réalisation des travaux d'améliorations de nos nouveaux locaux.


Comment vous pouvez prendre part à l'aventure


Achetez l'un des produits à l'effigie de La Fabrique ;
Vous savez que vous aller utiliser La Fabrique lors de son ouverture? Super! Achetez l'un des services en prévente! 
Devenez membre de la coopérative en venant nous visiter lors de nos fameux 5@9. Visitez notre page Facebook ou abonnez-vous à notre Infolettre pour être tenu au courant ;
Vous êtes loin de Sherbrooke, ou vous ne pensez pas utiliser les services de La Fabrique? Devenez membre de soutien! Cela vous donne tout de même un droit de vote à l'assemblée générale et vous permet de nous soutenir financièrement ;
Vous avez des outils qui pourraient permettre à nos membre de créez? Ils pourraient nous intéresser de les recevoir ou des vous les louer!


Un énorme MERCI de la part de La Fabrique et de ses membres!
Passez un super temps des Fêtes :)

story:
Because the campaign did so well, Indiegogo has made it an INDemand campaign which means it can stay open and people can continue to make donations and get rewards! The EP is so close to being done and I am so excited to share this new music with you! We may not be releasing it to the public for a while because we have some big plans for it and need to wait for the right moment, BUT if you are a backer, you will get your rewards before it's released! All the more reason to become a backer and spread the word! The hardcopies will probably be pretty much exclusive to Indiegogo supporters at least for a good while so go ahead and choose your reward and get on board! 


THANK YOU! WE got to 100%! Today is the LAST DAY to get to some STRETCH GOALS :) Lets get to $10,000 and at least 150 backers!

Reaching BEYOND that will make a huge difference in my ability to make promotional materials like music videos for you to enjoy and to hire someone to promote the songs and to TOUR! These things are critical to the success of the recording and will allow me to come perform for you and meet you and connect with people and spread of message of love and hope and that we are not alone! 
When we hit $8000, I'll add my last album "The Left Atrium" to the rewards for everyone who donated! 
LETS spread the word and keep up the momentum!
Here's the video of one of the new songs for the album I promised for when we reached 100%:

Music has always been a big part of my life. Growing up on a farm in Florida with no TV, my parents records and grandparents Rogers and Hammerstein musicals were my source of entertainment (other than playing outside - remember that?) and soundtrack for my life. 

Songs help us through life. For me, being able to write and sing them has been an outlet for my big feelings. It allows me to capture them in a moment, a melody, a poem and acknowledge them and let them exist without consuming me. You should really try it! Many of the new songs have a through-line of telling a story or writing a story and the idea that we are the authors of our lives. We get to say how it goes and what it means regardless of what may have happened along the way.

I want to connect with people through my songs - many of them are about the hard times, but with a message of hope and that we are not alone. 

Please join me by choosing your rewards and becoming a backer today!

I intend to use this record to find representation who will work with me to bring my music to the next level through promoting the album, touring, local radio, and getting my songs in TV and films! I also believe very deeply in paying artists what they are worth! I'll be working with several amazing, talented, musicians and artists and a producer to make each song its fully expressed experience with piano (maybe me playing some more of it!), cello, fiddle, claps, and who knows what else! Last time there were wine glasses, spoons, and a tiny mechanical lady-bug toy!

Many opportunities have been opening up to me recently in the form of being invited to play at festivals, and on a big tour. (more on that as it unfolds!), making it to the finals in competitions, and meeting people in the industry who are into what I'm doing.

I've been doing a lot more co-writing this time around and I'm excited about the results! And a couple of the songs have been a LONG time in the making! The seeds were planted years ago and now you finally get to experience the colors and scents of the flowers! 


Where are your generous donations going?
$7000 - Will go to paying the studio and producer to make the songs sound beautiful
$2500 - will pay the talented musicians who will play on the record
$300 - will pay for mastering - this is important for it to sound good for radio and such!
$1500 - will go to artwork design and photos which will be used for the CD, posters, website, and promotion. Having a "brand image" makes a big difference!
$1100 - will go to duplicating the CD's and packaging
$4000 - will enable me to have an effective PR campaign for the album to get it to the ears of fans as well as pitching to industry folks (labels, management, booking, licensing for TV and Film)
$3000 - will be a great boost for touring and submitting and traveling to festivals 
$2000 - will go toward making some visually and emotionally captivating music videos to go with the songs and to be my calling card 

Flex goal #1: $10,000 will allow me to get some wonderful artwork and  cover the cost of duplication, campaign rewards, and platform costs. 

Flex goal #2: $15,000 will cover my initial promotional budget which matters because it gives me the potential to significantly impact the future success of this recording. Getting it to the ears of lots of fans and people who can make a difference!

Flex goal #3: $22,222 will give me a boost for  touring and allow me to make a music video which is important for connecting with people and having an effective PR campaign! Not to mention, it allows me to express other sides of my creativity (acting and film making) and tell a story in those media and share it with you!

What You Get When You Contribute:
Of course you will get the MUSIC as well as some extra special things! 

Support me at the $750 or more level and I'll wine and dine you with me as the chef! I've always loved cooking and I'm pretty good at it! I'll come with a friend or two and we'll whip you and a couple of friends up a feast complete with appetizers, main course (I make a delicious pasta with smoked salmon and tomato cream sauce or butternut squash with brown butter sage sauce - or we can figure out a menu that makes your mouth water) and dessert (this is my specialty! I love to make them all cute and pretty too!) and whatever drink tickles your fancy! There's a good chance I might play a song or two for you while you digest!

OR if you're more into the music than the eating, support me at the $1000 or more level and I'll bring the show to your house! Invite as many people as will fit and I'll serenade you all! I love these shows because they are so intimate with everyone sitting on couches and I get to interact with you all more. It can turn into a bit of story-time between songs with people asking questions and its really fun!

Or you could enjoy another thing I create - jewelry! My "Forget-Me-(k)Not" solid silver ring will remind you of how much I appreciate you and whatever you want it to. And I won't forget you!

Be part of this story by choosing your rewards and becoming a backer today! Thank you so much!

story:
Hello Everyone!

       My name is Dariusz (Dar-oosh) or Darek for short if you'd like. I'm a father and freelance, lead, art and programming developer for SoundRunner. I'm a Polish immigrant to the US at the age of 4 and have always had a strong passion for all things tech (like many software developers have!). SoundRunner is a game I've always wanted to see created and is inspired by games like Gunstar Heroes, Megaman, Audiosurf, Metroid, and Cave Story.  

      I started a campaign on KickStarter a while back which didn't meet it's goal but showed me something very important, and that's that, there are people who are interested in my project! So I decide to revamp my campaign and lower my goal so that I could make enough to pay for the Greenlight submission fee and let interested people give the game a shot. 

     So the goal is small but any contributions past the goal will be used towards development in the sense that it will open up more time for me to develop as life goals like my son's college fund, and savings for a house will be built up and I won't need to work part-time work as frequently.

   I appreciate all contributions, but I also appreciate comments and people letting me know if the game is interesting, so if you can't contribute but want to give me a hoo-rah then give me a hoorah! 



Previously I would have put the money into purchasing a new machine, since the one I currently have is an older machine. But as I thought about it, I no longer thought it was really a development requirement.  So, I've decided to focus all my efforts on getting the Steam Greenlight Submission Fee covered so that I can put the game up on Steam and give people the opportunity to give it a try pre-release. 

Money past $100 will go towards living expenses, medical bills with some investment into my current machine to extend it's life.

I would make the goal lower however the minimum is $500.



SoundRunner is a video game in which the player plays Botty.  Who is Botty? Botty was part of your system's Viral Defense System but something went horribly wrong and a slew of viruses,malware, worms and horrible nasty stuff broke into the system and destroyed the V.D.S.  With that they completely eviserated Botty's companions and took down the system.
 Botty tripped right before the fight and fell straight into the Recycle Bin. This saved him however as one of the Bits who worked the Recycle Bin found him there and fixed him up in the aftermath of the chaos.  With the damage done to Botty his Circuit Platform Generator was destroyed. Klerp, the Recyle Bin Bit that saved Botty, could only find and Audio File Modulatorand hacked it into Botty. This allowed them to save Botty but his ability to move freely was destroyed in the process.
All hope seemed lost until the Viruses reached the system's music files and began dumping them into the Bin. One of the files hit Botty's C.P.G and fused with his circuits, suddenly platforms began to spawn.  However the sound caused them to be differently and act unstable. This coupled with the fact that they would crumble after time led to new worries.
Klerp gathered parts and altered Botty, replacing one of his arms with a File Grabber and replaced his wheels with two bipedal legs to increase his speed. The allowed him to move through the platforms before they crumbled. At the end of the audio file the final platform remained, so Klerp attached a tracking device to Botty to allow them to use his Quick Transfer Manager Cannon to shoot Botty to his last platform and continue his journey towards the viruses plagueing the system. New hope arose for the system, the only question that remains is, is it too late to stop the absolute formatting of the Bit's world?

The Gameplay


[Please Note the Blue Aura in the video is for Debugging the Sound Analyzer]

Players will pick a song and hop into the Q.T.M cannon once the song is done being converted (conversion only happens once). They are then launched to an initial platform where they begin their run. As they run enemies, platforms, and obstacles spawn to try and stop the player. Powerups also spawn to help the player.  At the end of the level the player is graded based on their Accuracy, Remaining Health, Speed  and Distance covered. This leads to a Grade and multiplayer for how many Bitcoins they received for their run. 
Players can replay songs for additional distance scores, bitcoins or to just get a higher grade on a large difficulty. (Each song allows you to slide a difficulty slider that alters how much a song affect a level, how quickly enemies spawn and the rate of power ups. 
Players can use Bitcoins to buy weapons, abilities, upgrades and cosmetic changes.

During the initial song selection phase the player has access to a Town Hub where they can purchase upgrades and change their appearance and equip difference weapons and abilities.

As the player builds up distance they eventually unlock a boss fight. Boss Fights, like platforming segments are also affected by music. One a Boss Fight is complete the player unlocks a new level with different enemies, aesthetics, obstacles and greater bitcoin earnings. 

     Weapons will be available for purchase at each locations town hub. They'll cost Bitcoins and once purchased can be equipped in a load-out screen before the level begins.   




Each Weapon will have 3 different levels. The weapon gains XP while running through the level and killing enemies without taking damage. Taking damage causes the weapon to lose XP. This leads the player to have to be cautious while running with a full-powered weapon, as even though the full-powered weapons are overpowered, taking damage kills the players momentum and causes them to have to rebuild their weapon. 

Current weapons designs are below:

Standard Issued File Remover (Complete) - Chargeable projectile that does okay to high damage depending on the charge. At full charge it will deflect bullets it passed through.  (The players starts with this weapon)
Level 1: Fire a single bullet, explodes on enemies or platforms
Level 2: Gain a slight homing capability, the bullets curve slightly towards enemies.
Level 3. Increases homing range, the bullets also go through platforms and explode on the first enemy.

The Cursor - Fires a cursor at the enemy rapidly by holding down the mouse button.
Level 1 - Cursor takes 3 bullets to kill a small enemy, and the fire rate isn't great.
Level 2 - Cursor takes 2 bullet to kill a small enemy and the fire rate is a little better

Level 3 - Cursor one shots small enemies and fires like a gattling gun. It also allows the player to levitate a bit off the ground if fired downward towards a platform.

Mouse Trail (Complete) - A trail of Byte plasma follows your recital, any enemy it touches explodes. Constantly hovers around your mouse, you must slice through enemies to cause damage. Does high damage but disintegrates after a while.
Level 1: Fire up to one orb that rotates and disintegrates after it strikes two enemies.
Level 2: Fire up to two orbs that rotates around the cursor and disintegrate over time.

Level 3: Fire up to three orbs that rotate around the cursor and take a while to disintegrate. 

Cut and Paster - Absorbs an enemy and allows you to shoot it as a projectile, as the enemy is fired it's standard bullet pattern is also fire from it at enemy's as it passes by. Collision with another enemy destroys this projectile along with whatever enemy it hits. Damage is based on enemy's size and statistics.

Overclocker - Slows down time around the player and shields them, fires off a circle of bullets. Falls under a countdown timer, once the timer is reached, there is a recharge period. Between recharges acts as an unchargable Standard Issue File Remover. 

Enemies will vary among the different levels in the game.  On the first level, for example, the primary enemy will be a Damaged Byte. Which is a Byte that was infected with the virus and now mindless fires at anyone who comes close. While other levels will begin to have more complex and complicated enemies such as a Bad Sector which will only take damage when their weak spot is showing. 

Some Enemies are Below:

Damaged Byte: Damaged by a virus on the system, what's left of these Bytes attacks you mindlessly.  (Small Enemy)

Malware: This enemy will take your projectile and turn it against you if you fire at them at the wrong time. (Medium Enemy)

Spyware: This enemy will cloak itself and trace your movements for a little bit before revealing themselves and trying to slash at you. (Medium enemy)

Worm: This enemy will slow your movement down if they touch you and weigh you down, forcing you to try and shake them off. (Small Enemy)

Trojan: Should this enemy succeed in touching you it will flip your controls and confuse you momentarily (Medium Enemy)

Bad Sector: A large enemy shielded by a thick memory wall. Shooting them in the head does critical damage (Large Enemy)

Root Kit: This enemy will mimic your moves backwards and attempt to run into you and explode (Medium Enemy)

Spam: This enemy will constantly puff smoke to blind your vision while you try to traverse the level. (Medium Enemy)

Obstacles will block your path from time to time to give the level some depth and more challenge between fighting enemies. Some Obstacles are listed below:

Some Obstacles are Below:

Moving Pathway: These pathways are pretty common for audio files, they move with the sound wave, you'll have to use them to get across gaps or jump over them.

Memory Leak: Your modulator will malfunction momentarily and spawn a vertical wall, shoot the center or dash through the center to cause it to explode and get out of your way.

Overheating Component: Your pathway is too hot, use your grapple to run over the top segment and avoid crashing.

Compromised Sector: A sphere will spawn between two platforms modifying the gravity around them. Watch your jumps, or send a few of your projectile sin to destroy it. 

Bosses will be revealed in Klerp's PC once the player has accumulated enough distance from running along pathways. These bosses are all viruses that are based off actual Historical viruses. The bosses health will be determined by the length of a song/difficulty, a higher difficulty means a longer hard boss fight. The player must try to kill the boss before their song ends. If you fail however, you can always shoot back up and try again with another song or the same one. Boss performance will also be graded like platform level performance and include bonus rewards for high grades. Check out some of the bosses below:

The Creeper: The Creeper was one of the first viruses ever created, it's main purpose was to show that vulnerabilities do exist in computer systems and can be exploited. It would replicate and display the message "I'm the creeper, catch me if you can!".  It was later removed by the Reaper. Though it did nothing more than display a message, it seems all the corruption in the system has caused the Creeper to become empowered.  The Creeper will fire projectiles with the beat of the music and block it's vulnerable eye from time to time forcing the player to jump onto it's revolving platforms, where it will open it's eye and attempt to fire a beam at the player.

The Wabbit: This boss is based of a virus which would replicate itself until it started to clog a system's memory and performance. This Boss creates miniature copies of itself that the player must try and continually destroy between taking advantageous shots at the boss.

Animal: This boss will frequently pause the battle to continue a game of Simon. If the player wins a round the boss takes double damage between attacking. If the player gets it wrong the boss spawns a couple of adds.

Elk Cloner: This virus used to dominate the Apple II. It's grown bitter in age over everyone's idea that Apple has never and cannot have viruses. The Elk Cloner will require the player to hop across moving platforms while avoiding his large removable storage projectile. Between projectiles he will occasionally sob uncontrollably in frustraiton causing the platforms to stop moving and slews of enemies to spawn. 

King Virus: Very little is know about the leader of the attack on the system. This final boss will combine the moves of all the other viruses into one last epic showdown. Can you defeat the Virus King?


Thank you for taking the time to look over my indiegogo. Let me know what you think of my project!

Previously I would have put the money into purchasing a new machine, since the one I currently have is an older machine. But as I thought about it, I no longer thought it was really a development requirement.  So, I've decided to focus all my efforts on getting the Steam Greenlight Submission Fee covered so that I can put the game up on Steam and give people the opportunity to give it a try pre-release. Money past $100 will go towards living expenses, medical bills with some investment into my current machine to extend it's life.I would make the goal lower however the minimum is $500.




SoundRunner is a video game in which the player plays Botty.  Who is Botty? Botty was part of your system's Viral Defense System but something went horribly wrong and a slew of viruses,malware, worms and horrible nasty stuff broke into the system and destroyed the V.D.S.  With that they completely eviserated Botty's companions and took down the system. Botty tripped right before the fight and fell straight into the Recycle Bin. This saved him however as one of the Bits who worked the Recycle Bin found him there and fixed him up in the aftermath of the chaos.  With the damage done to Botty his Circuit Platform Generator was destroyed. Klerp, the Recyle Bin Bit that saved Botty, could only find and Audio File Modulatorand hacked it into Botty. This allowed them to save Botty but his ability to move freely was destroyed in the process.All hope seemed lost until the Viruses reached the system's music files and began dumping them into the Bin. One of the files hit Botty's C.P.G and fused with his circuits, suddenly platforms began to spawn.  However the sound caused them to be differently and act unstable. This coupled with the fact that they would crumble after time led to new worries.Klerp gathered parts and altered Botty, replacing one of his arms with a File Grabber and replaced his wheels with two bipedal legs to increase his speed. The allowed him to move through the platforms before they crumbled. At the end of the audio file the final platform remained, so Klerp attached a tracking device to Botty to allow them to use his Quick Transfer Manager Cannon to shoot Botty to his last platform and continue his journey towards the viruses plagueing the system. New hope arose for the system, the only question that remains is, is it too late to stop the absolute formatting of the Bit's world?The Gameplay

[Please Note the Blue Aura in the video is for Debugging the Sound Analyzer]
Players will pick a song and hop into the Q.T.M cannon once the song is done being converted (conversion only happens once). They are then launched to an initial platform where they begin their run. As they run enemies, platforms, and obstacles spawn to try and stop the player. Powerups also spawn to help the player.  At the end of the level the player is graded based on their Accuracy, Remaining Health, Speed  and Distance covered. This leads to a Grade and multiplayer for how many Bitcoins they received for their run. Players can replay songs for additional distance scores, bitcoins or to just get a higher grade on a large difficulty. (Each song allows you to slide a difficulty slider that alters how much a song affect a level, how quickly enemies spawn and the rate of power ups. Players can use Bitcoins to buy weapons, abilities, upgrades and cosmetic changes.During the initial song selection phase the player has access to a Town Hub where they can purchase upgrades and change their appearance and equip difference weapons and abilities.
As the player builds up distance they eventually unlock a boss fight. Boss Fights, like platforming segments are also affected by music. One a Boss Fight is complete the player unlocks a new level with different enemies, aesthetics, obstacles and greater bitcoin earnings. 
     Weapons will be available for purchase at each locations town hub. They'll cost Bitcoins and once purchased can be equipped in a load-out screen before the level begins.   


Each Weapon will have 3 different levels. The weapon gains XP while running through the level and killing enemies without taking damage. Taking damage causes the weapon to lose XP. This leads the player to have to be cautious while running with a full-powered weapon, as even though the full-powered weapons are overpowered, taking damage kills the players momentum and causes them to have to rebuild their weapon. 
Current weapons designs are below:
Standard Issued File Remover (Complete) - Chargeable projectile that does okay to high damage depending on the charge. At full charge it will deflect bullets it passed through.  (The players starts with this weapon)Level 1: Fire a single bullet, explodes on enemies or platformsLevel 2: Gain a slight homing capability, the bullets curve slightly towards enemies.Level 3. Increases homing range, the bullets also go through platforms and explode on the first enemy.
The Cursor - Fires a cursor at the enemy rapidly by holding down the mouse button.Level 1 - Cursor takes 3 bullets to kill a small enemy, and the fire rate isn't great.Level 2 - Cursor takes 2 bullet to kill a small enemy and the fire rate is a little better
Level 3 - Cursor one shots small enemies and fires like a gattling gun. It also allows the player to levitate a bit off the ground if fired downward towards a platform.Mouse Trail (Complete) - A trail of Byte plasma follows your recital, any enemy it touches explodes. Constantly hovers around your mouse, you must slice through enemies to cause damage. Does high damage but disintegrates after a while.Level 1: Fire up to one orb that rotates and disintegrates after it strikes two enemies.Level 2: Fire up to two orbs that rotates around the cursor and disintegrate over time.
Level 3: Fire up to three orbs that rotate around the cursor and take a while to disintegrate. 
Cut and Paster - Absorbs an enemy and allows you to shoot it as a projectile, as the enemy is fired it's standard bullet pattern is also fire from it at enemy's as it passes by. Collision with another enemy destroys this projectile along with whatever enemy it hits. Damage is based on enemy's size and statistics.
Overclocker - Slows down time around the player and shields them, fires off a circle of bullets. Falls under a countdown timer, once the timer is reached, there is a recharge period. Between recharges acts as an unchargable Standard Issue File Remover. 
Enemies will vary among the different levels in the game.  On the first level, for example, the primary enemy will be a Damaged Byte. Which is a Byte that was infected with the virus and now mindless fires at anyone who comes close. While other levels will begin to have more complex and complicated enemies such as a Bad Sector which will only take damage when their weak spot is showing. Some Enemies are Below:Damaged Byte: Damaged by a virus on the system, what's left of these Bytes attacks you mindlessly.  (Small Enemy)Malware: This enemy will take your projectile and turn it against you if you fire at them at the wrong time. (Medium Enemy)Spyware: This enemy will cloak itself and trace your movements for a little bit before revealing themselves and trying to slash at you. (Medium enemy)Worm: This enemy will slow your movement down if they touch you and weigh you down, forcing you to try and shake them off. (Small Enemy)Trojan: Should this enemy succeed in touching you it will flip your controls and confuse you momentarily (Medium Enemy)Bad Sector: A large enemy shielded by a thick memory wall. Shooting them in the head does critical damage (Large Enemy)Root Kit: This enemy will mimic your moves backwards and attempt to run into you and explode (Medium Enemy)Spam: This enemy will constantly puff smoke to blind your vision while you try to traverse the level. (Medium Enemy)Obstacles will block your path from time to time to give the level some depth and more challenge between fighting enemies. Some Obstacles are listed below:Some Obstacles are Below:Moving Pathway: These pathways are pretty common for audio files, they move with the sound wave, you'll have to use them to get across gaps or jump over them.Memory Leak: Your modulator will malfunction momentarily and spawn a vertical wall, shoot the center or dash through the center to cause it to explode and get out of your way.Overheating Component: Your pathway is too hot, use your grapple to run over the top segment and avoid crashing.Compromised Sector: A sphere will spawn between two platforms modifying the gravity around them. Watch your jumps, or send a few of your projectile sin to destroy it. 
Bosses will be revealed in Klerp's PC once the player has accumulated enough distance from running along pathways. These bosses are all viruses that are based off actual Historical viruses. The bosses health will be determined by the length of a song/difficulty, a higher difficulty means a longer hard boss fight. The player must try to kill the boss before their song ends. If you fail however, you can always shoot back up and try again with another song or the same one. Boss performance will also be graded like platform level performance and include bonus rewards for high grades. Check out some of the bosses below:The Creeper: The Creeper was one of the first viruses ever created, it's main purpose was to show that vulnerabilities do exist in computer systems and can be exploited. It would replicate and display the message "I'm the creeper, catch me if you can!".  It was later removed by the Reaper. Though it did nothing more than display a message, it seems all the corruption in the system has caused the Creeper to become empowered.  The Creeper will fire projectiles with the beat of the music and block it's vulnerable eye from time to time forcing the player to jump onto it's revolving platforms, where it will open it's eye and attempt to fire a beam at the player.
The Wabbit: This boss is based of a virus which would replicate itself until it started to clog a system's memory and performance. This Boss creates miniature copies of itself that the player must try and continually destroy between taking advantageous shots at the boss.Animal: This boss will frequently pause the battle to continue a game of Simon. If the player wins a round the boss takes double damage between attacking. If the player gets it wrong the boss spawns a couple of adds.
Elk Cloner: This virus used to dominate the Apple II. It's grown bitter in age over everyone's idea that Apple has never and cannot have viruses. The Elk Cloner will require the player to hop across moving platforms while avoiding his large removable storage projectile. Between projectiles he will occasionally sob uncontrollably in frustraiton causing the platforms to stop moving and slews of enemies to spawn. 
King Virus: Very little is know about the leader of the attack on the system. This final boss will combine the moves of all the other viruses into one last epic showdown. Can you defeat the Virus King?





Thank you for taking the time to look over my indiegogo. Let me know what you think of my project!

story:
Hello. We are Sugar Ransom &thesecretpistols. We are a band in Milwaukee. 

We just made our sophomore album. We named it HopeFiend and we want to share it with you.

  • The record is really, really good
  • A pre-order helps us pay to print it 
  • As soon as we print and release this, we can work on more new music
  • yay!


The music industry is undergoing massive structural changes

In the meantime, you can be our record label! $4,000 pays to

  • print physical copies of the record (COMPACT DISCS, FOLKS!)
  • pay the beautiful people who helped make it
  • print more copies of our debut album, Mercy Hunt. We've been outta them for awhile, so...

Art for Art's Sake

We're not in this for profit. We made this record so that people will listen to it, but we're not independently wealthy: that's where you come in. A pre-order gets HopeFiend off the ground and into your ears. Any records we sell after this campaign will pay for gas to drive to gigs and enable future projects. 

We're Gonna Do This

Come hell or high water, really. But monetary help from fans (the audience kind, not the ceiling kind) will make for a higher quality product. We really appreciate this support. 


xoxo,

-Ransom et al

story:
Howdy friends, 

Welcome to our new production of the music of J.D. Hutchison and his band, Realbilly Jive. Their new recording, You And The World Outside, will be produced by two-time Grammy winner, Tim O'Brien, along with John Edwards, and Realbilly Jive. 

J.D. has been called “One of the most famous performers nobody's heard of.” We hope you can help us change that! In fact, although he has chosen to live a quiet life in the Appalachian hills, J.D. Hutchison has had a profound influence on four generations of musicians, from coast to coast, through his live performances, his early still-collected recordings with The Hutchison Brothers, and through the recordings of his remarkable compositions by Hot Rize, Robert Earl Keen, KT Oslin and other artists. His capacity for the singular turn of phrase—from the vernacular of his home to the sophistication of Wodehouse, all melodically linked—assures his place as one of the original songwriters and performers to come from the music now called Americana.

Lest his legacy be lost, this recording project is a sincere attempt to bring his significant contributions to a greater audience. Now we have a great team assembled to accomplish this. Realbilly Jive, featuring Mimi Hart, John Borchard, Dave Borowski, Jimmy Smailes and Geoff Goodhue are his brilliant backup band for this project, with several special guests, including Tim O'Brien.

The projected release party will be September 2016, but to "git 'er done" we're going to need a little help from you. With your financial help, we can make this happen. We will then release the CD and get your rewards and gifts to you in a timely manner. 

Your pledge of support will go toward:

• Recording, Mixing, and Mastering 14 songs — new gems & some old favorites.

• Publicity/promotion to get the word out to as many people as possible. 

• Album artwork & design. 

• Manufacturing, printing, and delivering the CDs.

Our thanks in advance for your help in moving this project to fruition. And a big "THANKS" for the work so generously provided already by Tim O'Brien, Jan Fabricius, John Edwards, Jake Loew, Mimi Hart, John Borchard, Jeff deLaval, Kait Flower, and Realbilly Jive!

story:
We, Jenna Sommers and Adam Kandel, met in the summer of 2014 at a local music festival in Maryland and the timing was divine. We were both in a place, ripe and ready to create new and inspired music.  We shared with each other our musical roots and present musical whereabouts and found them to be one and the same, like mirrors reflecting a unified vision of music to empower conscious evolution.  We were in awe discovering profound parallels in our influences, ranging a wide spectrum of roots reggae, psychedelic rock and jam. Growing from our roots, and through our evolution into Mantra chanting and World music traditions, Limitless Love was born.
   Last winter, we recorded 9 original songs that blended our influences and something entirely new emerged. Heart felt funky grooves and potent lyrical messages, coupled with powerful Sanskrit mantra, our music invokes freedom, love, and conscious awakening. We collaborated with many musical friends and family, who enriched the soundscape with a variety of expression and instrumentation. From Didjeridoo and harmonium to trumpet and saxophone, the diverse sound textures create a beautiful tapestry of soulful and uplifting music.
   We devoted hundreds of hours in the studio co-creating this project, drawing from our shared experience with songwriting, recording, producing and mixing. We put a tremendous amount of work and love into making this album and the music reflects this deep care and commitment to the art form. We've also created all of the visual art and designed the cd cases ourselves, It is a truly homegrown project!
   Fast forward to today, we are now in the final stages of completing the album, with only mastering and printing remaining. We are honored to pass the album on to renowned producer Ben Leinbach to master the tracks. Based in California, Ben is best known for producing many beloved musicians and kirtan artists, such as Jai Uttal and Deva Premal. We are thrilled to have his hands and heart in this project. Learn more about Ben at www.oldbullmusic.com
   It is our intention to offer the "Limitless Love" album to you now as an opportunity to pre-order your copy and at the same time be a part of manifesting this vision. We think of it in the same way folks can buy into a CSA share(Community supported agriculture) and receive home grown food throughout the season, fresh from the farm. In this case it's a CSM(Community Supported Music) initiative where your pre-purchase assures the project's fruition and you reap all of the sweet musical fruit as well as providing others the opportunity to enjoy it too. We thank you for your support in this mission and we believe it to be part of creating a world with more love, joy, and peace, for ourselves and each other. "Limitless Love" is a collection of music dedicated to spreading this message, and these songs have the potential to help us remember our true nature, as beings full of beauty, light, and love.

story:
So why contribute to building this world of DREAMS? 

Well, first of all, the MUSIC! Music unites, brings us together, breaks down barriers inside ourselves and amongst ourselves, and can totally change our mood. The songs on Dreams (5 originals and 3 covers) are designed to do just that. So, by contributing, not only will you get this new music before anyone else (tasty treats for your ears, a boon to your playlists!), but you will amplify the mission to bring this lightness and joy to millions more people around the world who need it.

 

Second of all, PERKS!  We know you’re busy. We know crowdfunding is no novelty these days, and that you could contribute your money to many different causes, people, and products. When you join our mission to create a world of Dreams (come true!), you get rewarded with fun, unique, dreamy gifts like music, a custom journal, coffee with the artists, and more.  Also did we mention our undying gratitude and the knowledge that you made it possible for a couple dreamers and artists to get their rocket ship off the ground and flying?

 

Third, CONNECTION!  You know how we’re all crouching down in our cell phones, computers, and ear buds all day?  Music gives us a chance to come out of that shell and CONNECT. Especially live music. There’s nothing quite like sharing the vibration, and raising the vibration, together- and that’s what we’ll be doing with our Dreams performances and tour (plans in the works!)  Your contributions will enable us to create magic moments for many people around the country (and hey, maybe the world!) as we travel to bring this music to them, and will help defray costs such as touring vehicles, gas, hotels, equipment...and by allowing us to work with some people with much more experience in media, digital music, and video creation to spread the music even further (think playlists, press clips, and breaking the internet with how many people watch our YouTube video.  Remember, the EP is called DREAMS!)

 

By contributing to the making of Dreams, you become a producer, in effect, on this project.  It’s like the olden days of traveling troubadours who stopped in to play for kings and queens at the palace ball-  you become a king or a queen, giving a stage to these troubadours, when you contribute.

We understand that everyone may not be able to contribute. But you can still help support us by spreading the word and Sharing the campaign far and wide! Be sure to use the Indiegogo SHARE tools available  and all your media forums to get the word out! From Cassandra, Tony and the team, all our love and gratitude!
