story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Bill Trabilcy, and you may remember me from our efforts last year - Gloves Go Far. We set out to raise funds to purchase 100 gloves in 100 days for the children of Nicaragua and succeeded beyond our wildest dreams!

This year, we are returning to ask for your support for a program that is near and dear to my heart - music. As a long-time saxophone player, I know the joy and escape music can provide. I wanted to share my passion for music by launching our newest initiative - Clarinets Go Far.

This time, we have joined forces with Tres Mundos Center for Cultural Arts in Granada, Nicaragua to get 10 clarinets in 10 weeks! The Foundation "Casa de los Tres Mundos" is an institution created to initiate, support and promote cultural projects in Nicaragua and Central America. This center provides the financing and coordination for an integrative rural development project in Malacatoya, as well as, promoting artistic, musical and educational activities that provide support for the poorer segments of Nicaraguan society.


What We Need

We have sourced out good, student quality clarinets for purchase on eBay; each costs approximately $75.00 (that includes shipping).  Our goal includes raising enough funds for 10 clarinets in 10 weeks while having some left over for other transport expenses like: airline overage luggage fees, ground transport fees, and any minor repairs the equipment may need. All additional funds raised will go directly to Tres Mundos Center.


The Impact

Isaac Stern, a Soviet-born violinist and conductor, renowned for his recordings and for discovering new musical talent once said, "One who is making music, does not learn to hate. One who is making music learns to hear, to listen and to think." We wish to give children in Nicaragua the gift of music.

Risks & Challenges

Challenges could include:

  • transport - solution: estimate transport fees and allot resources accordingly
  • repairs - solution: repair before transport or repair at Tres Mundos with additional funds raised

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate today? That's okay 

1) See if a friend, family member,  local school or music store wants to donate a clarinet! Message us for shipping instructions.

2) Get others involved by hosting a fundraiser, bake sale or ensemble and play to raise money for the cause!

3) Share our story! Word of mouth is a powerful tool.
story_txt:
Short Summary Hello, my name is Bill Trabilcy, and you may remember me from our efforts last year - Gloves Go Far. We set out to raise funds to purchase 100 gloves in 100 days for the children of Nicaragua and succeeded beyond our wildest dreams!
This year, we are returning to ask for your support for a program that is near and dear to my heart - music. As a long-time saxophone player, I know the joy and escape music can provide. I wanted to share my passion for music by launching our newest initiative - Clarinets Go Far.
This time, we have joined forces with Tres Mundos Center for Cultural Arts in Granada, Nicaragua to get 10 clarinets in 10 weeks! The Foundation "Casa de los Tres Mundos" is an institution created to initiate, support and promote cultural projects in Nicaragua and Central America. This center provides the financing and coordination for an integrative rural development project in Malacatoya, as well as, promoting artistic, musical and educational activities that provide support for the poorer segments of Nicaraguan society.
   What We Need We have sourced out good, student quality clarinets for purchase on eBay; each costs approximately $75.00 (that includes shipping).  Our goal includes raising enough funds for 10 clarinets in 10 weeks while having some left over for other transport expenses like: airline overage luggage fees, ground transport fees, and any minor repairs the equipment may need. All additional funds raised will go directly to Tres Mundos Center.

    The Impact Isaac Stern, a Soviet-born violinist and conductor, renowned for his recordings and for discovering new musical talent once said, "One who is making music, does not learn to hate. One who is making music learns to hear, to listen and to think." We wish to give children in Nicaragua the gift of music.  Risks & Challenges Challenges could include:


transport - solution: estimate transport fees and allot resources accordingly
repairs - solution: repair before transport or repair at Tres Mundos with additional funds raised


    Other Ways You Can Help Can't donate today? That's okay 
1) See if a friend, family member,  local school or music store wants to donate a clarinet! Message us for shipping instructions.
2) Get others involved by hosting a fundraiser, bake sale or ensemble and play to raise money for the cause!
3) Share our story! Word of mouth is a powerful tool.

story:
Please, listen to more of our music in the gallery! 

We are very excited to record our second album this Spring – Signal in the Static.

The Signal in the Static is a message of appreciation and togetherness. It's the feeling that only comes from sharing experiences with the people around us, reveling together in the visceral experience that is life.

You know, the future ain't what it used to be.  But we are awfully glad to be here to share it with you.  What the world needs now is personal connection.  We feel it at our shows when people gather and relate to one another.  By funding this CD you are contributing to the belief that the collective human condition is expressed through and celebrated by music.  The music brings us together, and we're together for the music!  You will be helping us make our dreams come true.  

We're planning a big year and it's important to be prepared for what's coming. We would be so humbled if you would help us with this campaign. You'll help us to spread our belief that togetherness, groove, and self expression are necessary elements of the human experience.  You'll help us play more around our hometown of Rochester, New York by getting our music in the hands of radio DJs, increase our chances to get into well known summer festivals like Grassroots or Greyfox, and get recognized by music lovers around the world!  Also, we'd love to give our loyal fans a CD that represents the Crawdiddies experience.  

The Breakdown Showdown and Hoedown

(What We Need & What You Get)

We are asking for your help so that we can afford the many requirements for making a great album that will (hopefully) stand the test of time.  Things like:

  • Recording, mixing  and mastering with the great Gary Holt of Holt Studios in Mount Morris, NY;
  • Help with producing the album from great musicians that we respect;
  • Graphic representation of the recording process and the ideals of the album, including an album cover with original, Rochester-made artwork;
  • Replication and packaging of 500 CDs; and
  • Crowd-sourcing fees.

Note that we're not making an empty request here.  Please take full advantage of the perks we're offering to all those who contribute at any level.  They're listed to the right, and they include things like signed CDs, music lessons, hand-made jewelry, hand-made ornamental yet musically functional washboards (!), a home-cooked meal with the band, house concerts...   We're excited to participate in this 'barter system' style of album production.  We truly can't do it without you!

Other Ways You Can Help

We 100% understand that some people just can't contribute and that some could forget before the campaign is up (March 29, 2015). But if you act now to share this with one friend and they share it with one friend you have helped us beyond what you realize! 

If you aren't able to contribute financially, please consider taking some of these other steps in helping us reach our goal:

  • Make some noise about us to your friends, see if they'd like to contribute;
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools;
  • 'Like' us on Facebook, or Share one of our YouTube videos;
  • Visit our website www.thecrawdiddies.com and check out our upcoming shows;
  • Come say Hi!

And that's all there is to it.

About The Crawdiddies

For those of you we haven't met yet, here's a little about who we are.

We are an acoustic blues/Americana band from Rochester, New York (we simply call our music BluesGrass).  We're on a mission to bring you our toe tappin', soul-filling original music.  For several years we have played at house concerts, music venues, and festivals honing our craft, creating a buzz, and playing our hearts out. Our last CD was released in 2012 and a lot has changed since then, including the instrumentation of the band.  Please visit our website www.thecrawdiddies.com for more information about us and to see some videos of what we do.  We are so appreciative to have the opportunity to make music and play for people who love music.  

Please join us in the process and be a beacon to spread the Signal in the Static.

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

Die Deutschen Meisterschaften der erwachsenen Mehrkämpfer (10-/7-Kampf) sind 2015 sowohl in der Halle, als auch im Freien ausgefallen. Die Absage der Meisterschaften im Freien wiegt doppelt schwer, weil diese sehr kurzfristig publiziert wurde, so dass kein Athlet seine Jahresplanung umstellen konnte. Daraufhin wurden Alternativen gesucht, die jedoch aufgrund der Terminproblematik (Athleten und Trainer stellen sich seit einem Jahr auf einen Termin ein!) nur unzureichend waren.

Einige Trainer fanden sich zusammen und veranstalten nun zum ursprünglichen DM Termin eine Alternative: Das Mehrkampf Meeting Ingolstadt

Aufgrund der Kürze der Zeit mussten alle organisatorischen Aufgaben ehrenamtlich gelöst werden. Die Stadt Ingolstadt unterstützt das Projekt, indem das Stadion, trotz des Beginns des Fußballbetriebs, zur Verfügung gestellt wird. Die Zeitmessung wird ehrenamtlich durchgeführt. Die Kampfrichter und Helfer haben sich ehrenamtlich gemeldet. Und all dies nur, damit die Sportlerinnen und Sportler ein Ziel haben, auf das sie ein Jahr hin trainiert haben...

Diese Kampagne soll sowohl den Athleten optimale Bedingungen garantieren, als auch den Helfern Unterstützung geben. Die Stadionmiete, die Miete der Zeitmessanlage, der Transport einer zweiten Stabhochsprunganlage aus Pfaffenhofen und die Fahrtkosten der Kampfrichter und Helfer, die aus der ganzen Republik kommen, sind Notwendigkeiten, die unausweichlich sind.

Die Kampagne soll diese Kosten decken, damit das Meeting seinem Anspruch gerecht werden kann. Ein Überblick über alle Kosten und Einnahmen:

Stadionmiete     400€
Miete der Zeitmessung   400€
Transport der 2. Stabanlage  1500€
Fahrtkosten KaRi/Helfer  500€
Sonstiges (Medaillen,…)  200€

Im schlimmsten Fall muss der Ausrichter (ein gemeinnütziger Nachwuchsverein), das Leichtathletik Förderzentrum München e.V., die Defizitkosten tragen, was natürlich nicht unser Ziel ist. Je mehr Geld die Kampagne bringt, desto kleiner wird unser Defizit. 

Helft uns, den Athleten ihren Höhepunkt zurückzugeben, um den sie heuer gebracht wurden.

Helft uns, das Risiko für einen gemeinnützigen Verein zu minimieren.

Helft uns, die Kampagne bekannt zu machen.

Danke

story:
What is August Noise JP (ANJP)?

August Noise is a free, outdoor concert series in Jamaica Plain, MA. Whether you're a die-hard music lover or just an occasional listener, ANJP removes barriers from the music listening experience.

Thomas James Wible - 2012

Created in 2011, the series is organized by Beth McDonald and Anne Gregory, both JP residents and musicians. Our previous three seasons have featured classical music, rock, jazz, bluegrass, improvisation, pop, and a wide array of interactive concerts.

Neal Markowski Pond Installation - 2011

As musicians, we love the chance perform and share music with our JP community. Both musicians and audiences found the August Noise experience enriching-- and just plain fun! We had a strong following, largely comprised of those who happened to stumble upon the concerts while out and about.

Globular Falcon - 2013

It's easy to forget about the joy and vitality of music, cloistered in concert halls and clubs, often with pricey admission fees. With your support, we can build a cultural community of music for all to enjoy.

Learn more at our website, AugustNoiseJP.org!

How will the money be used?

We are looking to raise $1,900 to run the 2014 season. This can be broken down into four expense categories:

  1. Design - website, social media, posters, flyers
  2. Printing - posters, flyers, labels
  3. Honorariums for Musicians
  4. Assorted Small Expenses - rentals, permits, office supplies, etc.

Our main expenses are in the third category. While we can't pay as much as their talents deserve, we work hard to pay our musicians as much as we can --  honorariums make up over half of our annual budget! All funds raised beyond our $1,900 goal go directly to the musicians.

Maria & Rachel - 2013


Why should I contribute?

Every supporter will be publicly thanked on our website. We also have a wide variety of donor gifts to fit any budget! You can receive a signed season poster, an exclusive "mix tape" of ANJP music, V.I.P. concert seating, and brand new t-shirts to celebrate the 2014 season!

In the spirit of Season #4, we're going crazy for four.... All of our perks are available in multiples of $4! (That's right, math lovers.)

We understand that money is tight, and not everyone can assist financially. But there are plenty of other ways to help; if you like what we're doing, spread the word about this fundraiser, and bring your friends to the concert! You can use Indiegogo's "share" tools to send the link to Facebook, Twitter, email, etc.

 

Thanks for checking us out -- we hope to see you in August!

 


Hayes Griffin Trio - 2011

story:
Who Are These Guys? 

Breakout band Ruder & The Shockwaves is a progressive jazz/rock fusion project of Matt Ruder, featuring Dan Mench Thurlow, Darrell Luther, Nicholas Quintero, and Marcus DiFilippo. Local to Santa Fe, the band is collaborating with a filmmaking crew from the Santa Fe University of Art and Design to produced a debut music video for their single "Cobalt Blue" 

  • Beside the jazzy, fresh sound of The Shockwaves' instrumentals, we'll build parallel worlds, throwing the band into the midst of the glamor of the 1920's and the futuristic party world of the 2020's. 
  • The video represents a huge opportunity for the band and the filmmakers to branch out and garner followers and fans prior to the debut of the Shockwaves' EP. 
  • Support us - by contributing or sharing. Collect promotional incentives and help us create a springboard for a team of talented young musicians. 

Lights, Camera, Action! 

  • We're only asking for $500! The concept is simple and economical, but the resources we have to create the video are an array of professional grade lights, camera equipment and crew - already at our fingertips. 
  • Our funds go straight to production value - costumes, set dressing, glitz and glamour are our first priority - but we also need funds to feed our cast and crew and compensate them for their work! 
  • In return for helping, you'll be given access to free music downloads, t-shirts, posters, singed exclusive photos and more!

Signal Boost Us! 

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

  • Help us spread the word! Share this campaign across any and all social media platforms so that fellow music enthusiasts can catch wind of the project and contribute. 
  • Don't forget to utilize Indiegogo's share tools!

Many Thanks!
From Ruder & The Shockwaves and the whole crew.

story:
ROOTWOMAN the Album,the Spirit,the Work

I’m thirsty for a certain kind of water for my soul. 

Get in the water with us! Be a part of this movement to expand the musical universe. At this moment the potential to reshape the landscape of our access to independent music is RIPE! It's up to us as artists and audiences to make it happen together!

ROOTWOMAN is a sonic journey of my roots/routes from Mississippi to Chicago, to D.C. and Brooklyn, gathering Conjure recipes along the way. My sound lives at the intersection of raw ritual, country Blues, and city funk. It's a Delta girl's Gumbo. You can taste in it my sharecropping, shop-keeping, migrating, farming, herb-doctoring ancestors, and you can hear in it my urban peregrinations and Midwestern obsession with the Groove. It's Memory Medicine, for heart and mind.




WHAT YOUR HELP WILL ACCOMPLISH

Your Contribution will help to cover the Production, Post-Production, Marketing and Distribution of the ROOTWOMAN album!

HOW YOUR FUNDS WILL BE USED

Within the $27K we’re raising, production is going to be the greater part, and a significant amount of funds go into the process of sharing the music with the world: We've chosen the 'Flexible Funding' model --this way there'll be no "surprise" charges in your bank account 2 months after your pledge-- BUT we are focused on an All or Nothing approach-- we need to raise the full $27K by MAY 29! Your contribution will be processed immediately and move us closer to our goal!

Budget Summary

STUDIO TIME with ENGINEER- $9K ($1K/day to record, mix and master)

MUSICIANS- $7K Help us to pay these magnificent artists who travel the world, offering their gifts and who deserve the utmost appreciation for their skill, their craft, their time and their brilliance.

MANUFACTURING-$2K first run of 1500 cd’s, plus shipping

MARKETING & DIGITAL DISTRIBUTION -$4.5K for mailings, ads, download cards, campaign video, etc.

PRODUCERS FEES-$3K

indiegogo CUT-$1080

Nia=Purpose

The ROOTWOMAN campaign is about claiming artistic sovereignty and inspiring folks to speak their hearts with courage. The healing of the planet, our bodies and minds demands that we take some strong looks in the mirror. Soul music brings communion with our purest selves to help us move toward peace and justice on Earth-- the only home we got, y'all!

thisiskarma.net

More Ways You Can Help

Your faith, intention, and attention can also help:

  • SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN LINK, HELP SPREAD THE WORD! 
  • POST, TWEET, CLICK IT UP!!!
  • PRAYER IS POWER, THANK YOU FOR THE GOOD VIBES!!!

AXE-O!

story:
Short Summary

Founders Trey Henson and Joseph Quintana have been recording, producing rap & hip-hop for over a decade. We are here to help make a difference in our communities and develop just not as independent artists but also as business men.  

Trey Dawg Productions was developed to serve businesses and entertainment needs.

Here's How

1. Rather you need audio with video projectors for your seminar

2. DJ for your wedding,

3. Video & audio engineering

4. Equipment rental

5. Styling Performers

 

Trey Dawg Productions Studios Will Offer 

 1) Audio and Video Production

2) Recreation Center

3) Game Room

4) Music Lessons

5) Event Center

Your contributions are very important to us. We have been waiting patiently for our glory. We have lived, learned, seen and been through the worse of the worse. Our close families, friends, and fans continue believing and supporting our destiny. We need this one for them. They have sacrificed with us repeatedly trusting us to make our hobbies and interest with our youth into success.

Contributing into Trey Dawg Productions will make us one-step closer into keeping our youth and teenagers off the streets and our hopes alive. Contributions will also gain us momentum severing business and entertainment functions. 

What We Need

Equipment - Severs, Computers, Printers, Mixer Boards, Cameras, Speakers, lighting, microphones, green screen, flat screens  marketing tools, and a trailer for on the go.

Projected cost total  $13,000 Dollars

Album Recording & Distribution

I would love the opportunity
to share the album to the world.

story:
As an educator, artist, musician and mother, I found that my students and sons again and again asked me to play the “story songs”…the ones that spoke of childhood triumph and love. Where the heroes and heroines overcame their hardships and personal demons and came out as not only winners, but with a recognition that they were the ones that made that magic happen, not fate or circumstance, awakening them to their own connection with the universe. 

Fairytale Endings is a whimsical voyage of self-discovery. Using classic literary characters in fresh stories combined with beautiful art and lyrically poignant original songs I hope to take children on an adventure of the spirit, a musical journey to a place where happy endings are consciously created through self-actualization and personal strength.

It has been my privilege to work with children for over 17 years as a teacher, mentor, artist and musician. I have taught multiple camps, workshops and private lessons in writing, art, theater and music. I currently perform/display art in many local venues in the Denver area, as well as being the house artist at Quixote’s True Blue and The Park House, and Zen and Now (Golden, CO) prominent Denver buisnesses. My art can be found on Facebook and ETSY on the page Thinning Veil Artworks.

My musical partner Yaniv Salzberg  is a nationally recognized composer. He has recorded and engineered commercial soundtracks for advertisements on Grand County Television and for So Loud Recording in New York. Two of his pieces were selected for the Next Paradigm national release based in Boston. In 2008, Yaniv released his first solo album which features him as a songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, producer and his composition Cherry Brain was selected as a theme song for the critically acclaimed Hollywood movie Cherry. As a studio musician, Salzberg’s work can be heard on many projects for commercial television, websites and other media.

With your financial support we will be able to do a large scale printing of the Fairytale Endings Book, as well as a studio recording of the CD, remastering tracks with rich harmonic vocals and bringing in a wealth of Denver's local talent.

In an effort to give back, a portion of all proceeds will go to benefit Love,Hope,Strength; an organization dedicated registering marrow donors resulting in matches from concerts around the world. Through unique events, like Everest Rocks and Kilimanjaro Rocks, they build cancer centers, giving people access to early detection and quality cancer care.

In addition to the book/cd we have included some high end perks for our awesome donors, they include:

Posters of the Fairytale Endings artwork from the book

9 pieces of original framed art from the book

Music or art lessons with Yaniv or Colleen

A CD release party for you and your friends!

A private house concert!

Other Ways You Can Help:

Please share this info with friends and family who might enjoy!

story:
***UPDATE*** 
Well, never too late I guess (2 months later) WE DID IT! CONGRATULATIONS CONTRIBUTORS! You successfully pushed a campaign well passed it's goal. There is some new bittersweet news to report however ... CHECK OUT MY BLOG. CLICK HERE! 
ALSO, you can still listen to live bootleg tracks from my FUNDRAISER CAMPAIGN AWARENESS SHOW @ CHELSEA'S in BATON ROUGE, LA from back in DECEMBER. CLICK HERE!

****************************************************************************

Hello All, and Happy New Year! My name is Jacob Zachary. 

I live in Memphis, TN with my beautiful wife Aimee and two darlin' kids Iley & Ezra. I've been writing and performing music for over 15 years now. I recorded some things in my infancy as a singer/songwriter, got to tour a bit along the way, and grew up alongside a community of some of the greatest artists I've ever had the privilege of knowing while living in Baton Rouge, LA.  Within the last few years, I feel like I've made my best music, and I think it's time to prove this claim with something everyone can hear, see, and touch. I am looking into 2015 with the hopes of making my first record in over ten years, but I need your help!

I'll get right to it...
I need a minimum of about $5000 to make this record. Unfortunately, that's a whole lot more than I've ever been able to save on my own, which is about $17. Obviously, I need to be able to shoot a little higher to reach my goal of $5000, so I've partnered with Indiegogo in the hopes that through the wonderful exchange of your pledges for my meager incentives, we can work together to help bring these songs from my six little strings and a can straight to your pretty little ears. 
   The most exciting part of this project for us is that we are making this record at the legendary Sun Studio here in Memphis, TN - the place where artists such as Elvis, Johnny Cash, and Jerry Lee Lewis got their start. Here's a short video documenting the history of this special space. 


 My only risk is not reaching my goal.
 The good news there is that Indiegogo will let me keep your pledges and let you keep your incentives either way. Should I not reach my goal, either a smaller project will be considered, or production on the intended record will just have to be delayed until the rest of the funds can be raised by another means. The better news is that there's no such thing as over-reaching my goal either. Should I happen to find 1 or 5,001 of you in the most charitable mood of your lives, exceeding my goal is obviously the greatest possible outcome of this campaign, and here's why:

The budget for making a record is not considering of just 2 or 3 things as you might think. There are a great many expenses throughout three phases of production (pre, pro, and post). For a minimum of $5000 I will be able to hire a producer and book the time I need for me and 9 other players to record about 10 songs in a short span of a few days. These 9 players in my band are beautiful people who are only in it for love. They will be caravanning up here to Memphis from Baton Rouge, LA. Some of the $5000 will go toward feeding them and providing accommodations. And then, of course, after everything is in the can there comes the process of  trading hands between several different engineers who will mix, master, and manufacture the record before it's left up to me to promote it. A piece of it will also go toward manufacturing some of these incentives you'll receive (t-shirts, posters, etc.). As you can imagine, all of this expense will likely stretch $5000 as thin as a penny, though it should be just enough ... Every dollar more, however, will afford me the wiggle room to make this record everything I want it to be. With a little bit more, I can actually compensate my band for their time and incredible talents! With a little bit more, we can buy additional time in studio and afford 2 or three more takes on every song, or 2 or 3 more songs! With a little bit more, I can distribute a larger volume of discs and make the artwork look amazing! With a little bit more, I can hire a photographer/videographer to document the making of this record. Put simply, with a little bit more, this record just gets better and better.

Let's make a GREAT record! 

From the bottom of my heart and on behalf of the other 3/4 of my household (Aimee, Iley, & Ezra) Thank you, and Happy New Year!!!

story:
Legendary Skies Tour with Blue October Spring 2015

Our friends in Blue October have invited us to come on their Fear tour and we need your help! Your contribution will help us cover the expenses of transportation fees, accommodations, and merchandising. Below you will find more information about our band and the tour that lies ahead. 




TOUR DATES: 
April 18 - El Paso, TX w/Dayluta Means Kindness
April 20- The Wilma Theatre - Missoula, MT
April 22 - Knitting Factory Concert House - Boise, ID
April 23 - The Depot - Salt Lake City, UT
April 24 - Boulder Theater - Boulder, CO
April 25 - Amarillo Civic Center - Amarillo, TX
April 26 - Roxy Event Center - Joplin, MO
April 29 - Diamond Ballroom - Oklahoma City, OK
April 30 - Granada Theater - Lawrence, KS
May 1 - Hard Rock Hotel and Casino - Sioux City, IA
May 2 - Austin's - Libertyville, IL
May 3 - Varsity Theatre - Minneapolis, MN


Budget (What you would help us with):

Transportation expenses (rental of van/trailer, gas, and insurance)        $5000.00

Merchandising expenses (Cost of CDs, shirts, posters, etc.)                       $2500.00 

Accommodations and additional travel expenses                                           $2500.00                                                           

                                                               GOAL: $10,000


PLEASE HELP US SPREAD THE WORD! 

Sharing this campaign with your friends, family, and on social media will help us reach our goal for this tour. We have dreamt of this opportunity ever since we were kids and held brooms in our living room. Now we have the chance to live it. 

A HUGE THANK YOU to all that have donated already and helped spread the word.  Your support means a lot to us!

story:
A Short Summary

Hello. We are the Strawhouse Singers, and we need your help to make a record.

We have performed at London's famous "Bedford Club" with Tony Moore, been Guest artists at large concerts for TEENSTAR UK and appeared at Birmingham's NEC. There are 15 of us at the moment and we come from Birmingham, Coventry, Rugby, Leamington Spa, Warwick, Leicester and Northampton. We have all worked very hard to perform at our best and have had help from friends and family to cover the costs of travelling - now we need your help to make this record and we want you to share in our journey too. Look at the Gallery for an idea of what your name, picture or company LOGO might look like on our cover.

We have done so well in such a short space of time and we need extra help to raise funds needed to pay for recording time, and professional assistance in making our EP. This will definitely help us push ourselves to gain further recognition, and take us to bigger shows across the country. In the music industry credibility counts for everything and there are so many young choirs competing for attention. We know we have the ability and the ambition to grow.

Financial points

Those at the Big Help Management (the community organisation helping the Strawhouse Singers) are aware that the choir may not raise all the funds necessary and are prepared to help out by matching £ for £ the crowd funding. BHM and the Choir have already raised £1,000 through fund raising events and donations.

COSTS (£3500)

This is a creative product and costs will evolve, however, these are estimated costings.

1.  Studio costs - £1400 – Recording

2.  Producer/Musician/Mastering - £1100

3.  Pressing/printing/distribution (300 copies) - £300

4.  Artwork/Graphics/printing for digital/physical and promotion materials - £200

5.  Promotion/marketing/admin/copyright/legal - £500

FUNDING

1.  Indiegogo -  £1,250

2.  BHM contribution -  £1,250

3. Already raised - £1,000


The Impact

Individuals will gain the experience of producing and recording a track at professional level, releasing it on an officially registered UK label, working within current industry legal requirements and norms, and have it distributed on iTunes, Spotify, Deezer, Amazon and other digital platforms – as well as on a physical CD.

 The learning benefit and enhancement of self-esteem are both positive outcomes. Future career potential for those who choose to continue the journey is also enhanced through this high value experience.

There is also a benefit to young people from the experience of working collectively and in co-operation with peers and professionals and sets a great example to their local and wider community of what can be achieved.


Business plan: Recovery of costs post campaign

Specifically, they are the actual costs plus additional promotion and pressing costs following release. We estimate that 100 copies will be allocated to pledgers – leaving 200 available to sell direct at £5. This would yield £600 after tax and costs – leaving a further estimated costings balance of £650 in order to recoup the subsidy provided by BHM.  The Choir intend to stage a live concert following the EP launch in order to offset part of the balance.

It is unlikely that we will be able to offset all the costs incurred by BHM, however, any additional funds raised will be invested in ongoing support for Strawhouse Singers members and will also help us reach out to more talented teenagers who would like to sing.



If you would like to know more, and receive some freebies from The Strawhouse Singers, sign up here: http://eepurl.com/5rjrD

story:
Jason Haywood Background & Biography

I am a singer/songwriter from Eastern Canada. I've made three records, including one with my former band, The Divorcees. That album won an East Coast Music Award in 2008 for Country Album of the Year. I've toured across Canada twice and played to crowds of over 15,000 people. Along the way I've shared the stage with Corb Lund, Hayes Carll, Matt Mays, Ron Hynes, Fred Eaglesmith, Tim McGraw and Faith Hill.

THE NEW RECORD

This album is a new musical path for me, and one of the most exciting steps I have ever taken in my career as a songwriter. In collaboration with my writing partner, Helena Berlin, I’ve written over 20 songs for this record. I’m currently paring this material down to ten songs that best evoke the themes of this record: passion, fear, violence and longing.

With ballads ranging from a man's haunted past to settlers fleeing a barren wilderness, this album explores the murder ballad tradition, pushing it beyond its archetypical borders. This album will, at times, walk in step with country music as well. It will tell stories and use some traditional instruments and chord structures. It will also attempt to defy those familiar traditions.

It is important that this campaign succeeds so that I can enlist Dale Murray, a dear friend and award-winning producer, to help realize the sonic vision for this record. This past winter, I sat with Dale and played him the first rough demos for this record. He was enthusiastic about helping me find the right sounds and atmospheres for this album so that I can tell these stories.  Dale is a talented multi-instrumentalist and the winner of 2009 Music Nova Scotia Award's Producer of the Year. He also took home Musician of the Year. Most recently he won the 2012 Music Nova Scotia Award for Country/Bluegrass Recording of the Year for his album Dream Mountain Dream, and the 2012 East Coast Music Award for Audio Professional of the Year.

HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL HELP

First of all, thank you in advance for your support. This record has been in the works since Fall 2013 and I am very eager for you to hear and enjoy it. If you are generous enough to contribute to my campaign, this will help pay not only for Dale Murray's production and mixing expertise and the mastering costs, but also for the talented musicians who will help me bring this album to life. This is a costly undertaking, but with your help, the money raised will ensure this album's ghosts and haunted souls will resonate with listeners who share an affinity with stories from life's darker side. If we are fortunate enough to attain more funds than the projected goal, that money will be used to manufacture CDs and to hire a promotional company to ensure that the album gets the exposure it needs.

On the right hand side of this page, you will see Perks and Incentives that I will be offering in return for your generous donations.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Even if you can't afford to support the campaign in a monetary way, I would appreciate it if you would take the time to tell others about it by sharing the link provided so the campaign has the best chance of reaching its goal.
story_txt:
Jason Haywood Background & Biography I am a singer/songwriter from Eastern Canada. I've made three records, including one with my former band, The Divorcees. That album won an East Coast Music Award in 2008 for Country Album of the Year. I've toured across Canada twice and played to crowds of over 15,000 people. Along the way I've shared the stage with Corb Lund, Hayes Carll, Matt Mays, Ron Hynes, Fred Eaglesmith, Tim McGraw and Faith Hill.
THE NEW RECORD
This album is a new musical path for me, and one of the most exciting steps I have ever taken in my career as a songwriter. In collaboration with my writing partner, Helena Berlin, I’ve written over 20 songs for this record. I’m currently paring this material down to ten songs that best evoke the themes of this record: passion, fear, violence and longing.
With ballads ranging from a man's haunted past to settlers fleeing a barren wilderness, this album explores the murder ballad tradition, pushing it beyond its archetypical borders. This album will, at times, walk in step with country music as well. It will tell stories and use some traditional instruments and chord structures. It will also attempt to defy those familiar traditions.
It is important that this campaign succeeds so that I can enlist Dale Murray, a dear friend and award-winning producer, to help realize the sonic vision for this record. This past winter, I sat with Dale and played him the first rough demos for this record. He was enthusiastic about helping me find the right sounds and atmospheres for this album so that I can tell these stories.  Dale is a talented multi-instrumentalist and the winner of 2009 Music Nova Scotia Award's Producer of the Year. He also took home Musician of the Year. Most recently he won the 2012 Music Nova Scotia Award for Country/Bluegrass Recording of the Year for his album Dream Mountain Dream, and the 2012 East Coast Music Award for Audio Professional of the Year.

HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL HELP

First of all, thank you in advance for your support. This record has been in the works since Fall 2013 and I am very eager for you to hear and enjoy it. If you are generous enough to contribute to my campaign, this will help pay not only for Dale Murray's production and mixing expertise and the mastering costs, but also for the talented musicians who will help me bring this album to life. This is a costly undertaking, but with your help, the money raised will ensure this album's ghosts and haunted souls will resonate with listeners who share an affinity with stories from life's darker side. If we are fortunate enough to attain more funds than the projected goal, that money will be used to manufacture CDs and to hire a promotional company to ensure that the album gets the exposure it needs.On the right hand side of this page, you will see Perks and Incentives that I will be offering in return for your generous donations.
 OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Even if you can't afford to support the campaign in a monetary way, I would appreciate it if you would take the time to tell others about it by sharing the link provided so the campaign has the best chance of reaching its goal.

story:
The hipfresh Story

This campaign is to raise funds to maintain the operations of hipfresh.  hipfresh is an entertainment and artistic news website dedicated to documenting what's hip and fresh in music, art, and culture.  hipfresh has been in existence for 2 years, providing interviews, stories, videos, and concerts featuring famed artists such as Talib Kweli and DJ Hi-Tek, Monie Love, Tech N9ne and Krizz Kaliko, Gamble and Huff, Georgia Anne Muldrow, Dudley Perkins, and Camp Lo.

hipfresh is an outlet for independent artists to showcase their art to the world.  We do not charge artists to have their music or content posted on the site. Any videos that we film of the artists (hipfresh Chronicles, the 7D Sessions, hipfresh Shorts, etc.) are all done free of charge. Although, the content is free, the writers who create the content are financially compensated for each article, video, review, etc.  Therefore, it is imperative that hipfresh receives as much support as possible from supporters like you.  Your contribution goes directly towards paying our writers and videographers, and funding hipfresh events.

The Impact: Your donation will help fund three main components of hipfresh

hipfresh.com Writers

The web component of hipfresh that provides the latest in music, lifestyle, artists interviews, music reviews and much more.  Your donation will help us pay our writers and contributors.  

hipfresh Live Shows

The live show component of hipfresh provides concerts featuring well known "seasoned artists" and up and coming "fresh artists".  Our past shows have included performances by the legendary Camp Lo, Georgia Anne Muldrow, Dudley Perkins, Aquil, Writtenhouse, and Electric Lady. Your donation will help us continue to provide exposure for up and coming artists through live shows.


hipfresh Videos

The video component of hipfresh provides HD professional video free of charge to artists to use as a means of promoting themselves.  Our videos include "The 7D Sessions", "hipfresh Chronicles" and "hipfresh Shorts".  Your donation will allow us to continue this service free of charge.


We sincerely thank you for your support.

Team hipfresh

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise as much funds to as possible to continue to maintain the operations of hipfresh.  We have calculated that $12,000 or more will help us continue to provide the services that we do for artists in the year 2011.  The money will be broken down as follows:

 

-33% of the funds raised will go towards paying the writers and contributors of hipfresh.

-33% of the funds raised will go towards paying independent artist to perform at our live shows.  Not only will the artists get paid to perform, but they will receive exposure in the process.

-33% of the funds raised will go towards providing free professional HD video for artists as a means of promoting themselves.  This includes production, equipment and editing expenses, as well as set rentals, etc. 


If we do not reach our funding goal.  hipfresh will continue to provide the services mentioned above using out of pocket expenses.  So it would be greatly appreciated if you could help us in our mission and movement :-).   By donating you will also receive cool perks (see the right side of this screen).


Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help our campaign by getting your friends involved.  If you love the website, the stories, the videos, and the live shows, please help spread the word about this campaign by sharing the link to this campaign.

story:
Namste. My name is Sachin Shetty and i live in beautiful India as a musician and painter. I've worked as an artist all my life in various commercial institutions and been active in the indian graphic design scene. However, just a year ago, I had a life changing experience while recuperating from tuberculosis. I found myself bed ridden and in constant meditative states, and it was during this phase that something profound happened in my life. I started to see life in a whole new perspective, and a spiritual way of life followed. I began to get visions both in the form of images that i started to paint and in the form of sounds which i began to put down in compositions. By the time i fully recovered from TB, i had a computer full of sounds, art and ideas. 

As I experienced this intense creative energy channel and flow through me, I decided to begin a new life. i quit my job and immersed myself into these sounds, which have now turned into a full length album. I call the project 'Antariksh', which in Hindi means Space. The sounds are ambient and ethereal in nature that intends to take the listener off into a multidimensional audio voyage. So far I've managed to get the album done with the help of friends and family, who i am very grateful to. My keyboard was gifted and so was most of the gear that i used to bring these sounds to life. All that remains now is to get the album mastered from a professional. I am mostly self taught, having picked up things from the internet and by just watching other producers make music. Mastering on the other hand needs expensive gear and expertise which i don't possess. I would love these sounds to reach people across the world, where it can take them on a mystical journey, like the one I experienced while creating it. I hope in my heart that you will help and bring Antariksh out of my Mumbai studio and into your earphones. Love and Light.

story:
Our Story

Hi!

We are a determined 5 piece Rhythm & Blues band from Hamilton, Ontario Canada. We love traveling around playing festivals, private functions, and venues and sharing the classic Rhythm & Blues sound!

Andre Bisson the frontman, guitar player, writer, and arranger of the band started this band while in college so that he could play his favourite classic 60's & 70's Rhythm & Blues songs along side other musicians just like him. He has made 3 CD's, with his originals on "Rhythm & Blues Experience" (2009) which was nominated for "Blues Recording of the Year" for the Hamilton Music Awards. "Rhythm & Blues Christmas" (2010) which is a collection of Christmas songs in the style of R&B, Swing, Funk, and Soul. "Beyond the Covers" (2011) is a collection of great songs by the Beatles, CCR, The Temptations, and more, arranged by Andre Bisson. He is now working on 2 more CD projects for another cover CD and a Blues CD of his originals to be released in 2012.

The band members are all graduates of Mohawk College for the Applied Music program and exceptional musicians here in Ontario. Our tenor saxophone player Francis Smith is still continuing his education at University of Toronto for a Music Degree, and our drummer Matt Burns and bass player Brad Cheeseman are continuing at Humber College in Toronto for their Music Degrees. Our trumpet player Loretta Hale continues study the music business, teach, and perform. 

The UK and Ireland have always been a dream for our band, to perform in Festivals and the many blues venues overseas to make new friends and spread our Canadian touch to another continent! We hope this will be our 1st of many tours overseas.

We will be going to the UK August 13-23, 2012 to perform for the Bentworth Blues Festival in Bentworth, Hampshire UK, The Sunflowerfest in Hillsborough, Lisburn (Northern Ireland), Cardiff, Wales UK at the Blue Dragon Club, the Worcester Beer, Cider & Perry Festival, Worcester, Worcestershire UK as well as other venues across the UK.

We are also going to Ireland from September 7-9, 2012 for the Harvest Time Blues Festival in Monaghan, Ireland! www.harvestblues.com/

The Impact

We hope to raise enough money to help cover the large costs for the flights and accommodations to and from the United Kingdom and Northern Ireland. This would give us the amazing opportunity to give this band a great beginning to tour extensively and bring our music to everyone that has supported us. We would like to share Andre's music to as many Rhythm & Blues lovers possible!

What We Need & What You Get

This would take some of the heavier weight off of what we are raising total for this trip. Our main costs are listed below and thats why we are also having a fundraising concert!

Travel Costs:

- Round Trip plane tickets to the UK for the 5 members of the band

- Accommodations for places to sleep in the UK

- Meals through the week

- Vehicle Rental - Will Help us get around to each event.

- Gear rental (sound system, amps, and drums)

We will also be having a fundraiser in Burlington, ON at the Boston Manor on Saturday, June 2, 2012 at 9:00pm $10 Tickets. www.andreandthejtones.com for more information. Cogeco will be there recording the 1st Set of Andre's originals. http://www.facebook.com/events/156341897826572/

PERKS! Make sure you check out the American Stratocaster just like the one Andre plays, as well as an opportunity to get have the band perform at your private event, CD's, tickets, and more!

Other Ways You Can Help

- Spread this page to anyone you think might be interested in supporting this Canadian bands tour this summer.

- Come listen to us perform at one of our upcoming events http://www.andreandthejtones.com/upcominggigs.htm

- Sponsor the band via a business or product

- Write an article about the band and the tour!

- Post on Facebook, Twitter, Youtube, your blog, and of course,...

- Word of mouth - Tell everyone!

story:
Short Summary

Hello all! My name is Ireland or at least that’s what The Cool Kids call me. I’m coming to you because I want your support in helping my dream come true. My first ever EP “Take Off to Ireland” is swirling around in my head ready to be released to the Universe.  In order for me to take this mental manifestation of greatness and share it with you, it takes money (duckets, benjamins, De Niro (not Robert), cheddar, cheese, gwap, cha ching, or whatever name money goes by these days). I can be long winded so I’ll keep this section brief. Simply: GIMME YOUR MONEY :P. I kid. No, but seriously.

“Take Off to Ireland” is the culmination of my heart on tape; it’s in its purest essence, as close to a physical replica as possible, of who I really am. I want this more than words can describe. Everyone has dreams: that one thing that you could do every day for the rest of your life. This is my one thing. Help me get it. Your donations, support, help, etc will not only enable me to launch, promote, market, disperse, and share my first EP, they will help me take control of my destiny.  My biggest dream in life is to share MY music with the world on a massive scale that represents who I truly am. I think that’s a very doable dream. This is the first step and you can be a part of it. All the extra details are to follow. If this isn’t enough to persuade you the 2000 word essay below will. :P (Dont forget to check out the gallery when youre done)

What I Need & What You Get

This is what I need:

  • Recording/Mixing: $6000+ for a      6-8 song album
  • Mastering:      $500+
  • Copyright:      $300+
  • CD Replication: $1000 for      1000 CDs
  • Promotional Items (flyers, posters, wristbands, t-shirts etc):$500+
  • Production/Beats:      $1000+
  • Indiegogo Artist (I’ll be donating 5% of my donations to another Indiegogo Musician) $500 maximum

These are the things you get!!!!: (Also listed on the side under perks)

Any donations $4 and under will receive a free automatic download of He Still Got It and/or Mrs. Wrong

$5 Free automatic Download of He Still Got It and Mrs. Wrong +Digital copy of a single(of your choice from the album)

$10 Free automatic Download of He Still Got It and Mrs. Wrong + Digital copy of the album prior to release date

$15 Free automatic Download of He Still Got It and Mrs. Wrong+ Signed Physical copy of the album prior to release date +2 exclusive non-album photos (sent via email)

$30 Free automatic Download of He Still Got It and Mrs. Wrong+ Signed Physical copy of the album prior to release date +4 exclusive non-album photos(Sent via Email) +Poster +Personalized Thank you email

$55 Free automatic Download of He Still Got It and Mrs. Wrong+ Signed Physical copy of the album prior to release date +4 exclusive non-album photos (physical copies) +Signed poster + Personalized handwritten Thank you note+ Limited Edition “Ireland and the Cool Kids” T-Shirt

$85 Free automatic Download of He Still Got It and Mrs. Wrong+ Signed Physical copy of the album prior to release date +6 exclusive non-album photos (physical copies) +Signed poster +Personalized handwritten Thank you note+ Limited Edition “Ireland and the Cool Kids” Wristband and T-shirt+ Special Thank you (Full Name) on album Jacket+1 Exclusive digital non-album song (mp3)

$100 Free automatic Download of He Still Got It and Mrs. Wrong+ Signed Physical copy of the album prior to release date +6 exclusive non-album photos (physical copies) +Signed poster +Personalized handwritten Thank you note+ Limited Edition “Ireland and the Cool Kids” wristband and T-shirt+ Special Thank you (Full Name) on album Jacket+ Thank you skype call + 2 Exclusive digital non-album song (mp3)

$300 Free automatic Download of He Still Got It and Mrs. Wrong+ Signed Physical copy of the album prior to release date +6 exclusive non-album photos (physical copies) +Signed poster +Personalized handwritten Thank you note+ Limited Edition “Ireland and the Cool Kids” wristband and T-shirt+ Special Thank you (Full Name) on album Jacket+ Thank you skype call + 2 Exclusive digital non-album songs (mp3s)+ Sit in on one of my recording sessions for the album (Scheduled for July)

$500 Free automatic Download of He Still Got It and Mrs. Wrong+ Signed Physical copy of the album prior to release date +6 exclusive non-album photos (physical copies) +Signed poster +Personalized handwritten Thank you note+ Limited Edition “Ireland and the Cool Kids” wristband and T-shirt+ Special Thank you (Full Name) on album Jacket+ Thank you skype call + 2 Exclusive digital non-album songs (mp3s)+ Sit in on one of my recording sessions for the album (Scheduled for July)+ Attend one of the photo shoots for the album (Scheduled for July) + Private meet and greet/lunch

$1000 Free automatic Download of He Still Got It and Mrs. Wrong+ Signed Physical copy of the album prior to release date +6 exclusive non-album photos (physical copies) +Signed poster +Personalized handwritten Thank you note+ Limited Edition “Ireland and the Cool Kids” wristband and T-shirt+ Special Thank you (Full Name) on album Jacket+ Thank you skype call + 2 Exclusive digital non-album songs (mp3s)+ Sit in on one of my recording sessions for the album (Scheduled for July)+ Attend one of the photo shoots for the album (Scheduled for July) + Private meet and greet/lunch + Be featured guest in a music video for the album+ I will write you a personal song… choose the subject, choose the genre.

 

The Impact

My aim in life is to be the best me that I can be. “Its about finding an identity in something that’s important to you” (Aerosyn Lex). I’ve found my identity in music. I want my music to remain untainted and your donations keep the pure fun, excitement, and love in my music. No one wants to be told how to live their life or accomplish their dreams. This is a way for me to do everything I want with this album without a label, or a manager, or a stylist dictating my choices. Imagine how freeing that is!!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just don’t have it and that’s fine by me. There are other ways you can help me!!!!

  • Spread the word about me, my music, and my campaign. (I mean really spam the hell out of people)
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! We all have like 16 million social networks post it on every one of them.

$300 Free automatic Download of He Still Got It and Mrs. Wrong+ Signed Physical copy of the album prior to release date +6 exclusive non-album photos (physical copies) +Signed poster +Personalized handwritten Thank you note+ Limited Edition “Ireland and the Cool Kids” wristband and T-shirt+ Special Thank you (Full Name) on album Jacket+ Thank you skype call + 2 Exclusive digital non-album songs (mp3s)+ Sit in on one of my recording sessions for the album (Scheduled for July)
$500 Free automatic Download of He Still Got It and Mrs. Wrong+ Signed Physical copy of the album prior to release date +6 exclusive non-album photos (physical copies) +Signed poster +Personalized handwritten Thank you note+ Limited Edition “Ireland and the Cool Kids” wristband and T-shirt+ Special Thank you (Full Name) on album Jacket+ Thank you skype call + 2 Exclusive digital non-album songs (mp3s)+ Sit in on one of my recording sessions for the album (Scheduled for July)+ Attend one of the photo shoots for the album (Scheduled for July) + Private meet and greet/lunch
$1000 Free automatic Download of He Still Got It and Mrs. Wrong+ Signed Physical copy of the album prior to release date +6 exclusive non-album photos (physical copies) +Signed poster +Personalized handwritten Thank you note+ Limited Edition “Ireland and the Cool Kids” wristband and T-shirt+ Special Thank you (Full Name) on album Jacket+ Thank you skype call + 2 Exclusive digital non-album songs (mp3s)+ Sit in on one of my recording sessions for the album (Scheduled for July)+ Attend one of the photo shoots for the album (Scheduled for July) + Private meet and greet/lunch + Be featured guest in a music video for the album+ I will write you a personal song… choose the subject, choose the genre.
 
The Impact
My aim in life is to be the best me that I can be. “Its about finding an identity in something that’s important to you” (Aerosyn Lex). I’ve found my identity in music. I want my music to remain untainted and your donations keep the pure fun, excitement, and love in my music. No one wants to be told how to live their life or accomplish their dreams. This is a way for me to do everything I want with this album without a label, or a manager, or a stylist dictating my choices. Imagine how freeing that is!!!!
Other Ways You Can Help
Sometimes you just don’t have it and that’s fine by me. There are other ways you can help me!!!!

Spread the word about me, my music, and my campaign. (I mean really spam the hell out of people)
Use the Indiegogo share tools! We all have like 16 million social networks post it on every one of them.

story:
Presbybop Music invites you to become a partner in our new DVD project, Jazz Belongs in Church.

 

This new DVD will share our discoveries about lively music, congregational song, and creativity in service to the life of faith. While it focuses on jazz as one form of music, it will share basic principles that can extend to any genre of music. The DVD will be developed with a wide audience in mind. It will offer practical examples along with theological reflection on the power of music to transform a congregation, extend its reach, and deepen its spiritual vitality.


We want to create this DVD because there is no other resource like it. Together we will explore the spiritual power of creative music. We will hear from jazz musicians, church leaders, and choir directors as they talk about the possibilities and potential of jazz. With lots of footage of live music in numerous settings, we will show what happens when jazz enlivens the life of faith. This will be a full length DVD suitable for adult classes, worship committees, study groups, and personal enrichment. A study guide will be included for those who wish to unpack its insights.


Can you help us make this possible? That is our invitation to you. Through this fiscal sponsorship program, you can make a tax deductible donation and become a partner in this project. As you can see on this Indie GoGo project page, we offer a variety of premiums to thank you for your support. There are support levels for every budget. Those at the Conversation Partner level will be invited to a special Q and A session that will appear on the film. For a limited number of our most generous partners, we will name them as Associate Producers for the project and list them on the DVD.

Presbybop Music is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions in behalf of the Presbybop Music may be made here online, or made by check payable to Fractured Atlas, with the words "In behalf of Presbybop Music" in the memo line. Contributions are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law. Feel free to e-mail us at office@presbybop.com if you have any questions.

We are excited about this project and hope you will be one of our partners! All funds raised will go toward production costs of the DVD, which include filming, editing, duplication, and packaging. We will gratefully use every gift to make the best possible recording. Sign on today to become a partner. Spread the word among your friends through the links and widgets on this site.

story:
My Story

 Hello, my name is Joseph Thomas - When on stage I usually go by Assasin or Poetic Assasin.  Over the past two years I have been working on four different CDs, working on concepts, scraping ideas, listening to instrumentals, and overall making sure that I didn't rush the process of creating quality material. I still like physical CDs, I know there are people that prefer to get it over the computer, so that option will be available too. 


The Impact

I am trying not to be selfish and give people refreshing music.  I do have a daughter on the way so I won't be collecting the money and taking pictures with it naked on a bed.  Diapers, clothing, and everything under the sun is needed.

What I & What You Get


I need $500 (actually I calculated everything and it came to 328, but you aren't allowed to put anything under 500) The money is going towards

CDs
Cases
CD inserts
Studio time

---


The four CDs I am creating are:


Cloud 9 Lives  (Relationships)

Filter   (Older Material) 

File Cabinet  (Things I have locked away)

Screaming Mimes (Why I do what I do so effortlessly) 



Do It With Others 


As much as I think I can, i can't do this alone -- spreading the word will help me just as much as donations, because it will get to more people than I can. 



Prices


Physical Copy Mailed- $9

Sent via internet- $5

In person- $5

story:
RightLeftTurn Radio:

RightLeftTurn is one of the newest radio stations to hit the paranormal community. We are a live internet-streaming radio station that is FULLY funded and supported by our listener base.

Since we launched the station only one month ago, we have had a skyrocketing amount of supporterts and ever expanding listener base. We didn't anticipate the magnitude and impact that our station would have in such a short amount of time.

Because it has been so successful, it has grown to become a much bigger project than anticipated. We have had a wide variety of celebrity guests on air and have many more lined up for the months ahead!

We intend to bring you voices to the air that you want to hear from, and we will give a voice to those who are not already represented. We will bring you the best possible entertainment, with a focus on the paranormal, talk, music, and art.

To keep this show on air we need support from our listeners. This is where we need your help.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

What We Need:

Since we are fully funded by the support of our listeners, any contribution will make a world of difference.  Help us reach our goal!

We are looking to fund the first year of broadcasting and live streaming on the internet. At RightLeftTurn we are all volunteers and devote a huge part of our lives to making this station a reality. Running a radio station takes hours of work and planning! Your contributions will fund our station software/hardware and internet streaming costs.

With your help, we will continue providing the latest and greatest, and will bring you the best paranormal talk radio ...to a set of computer speakers near you!
 
Thanks for taking the time to check out our project!

Love,
Rachel, Lisa, & Leah
RightLeftTurn Radio

http://www.blogtalkradio.com/rightleftturn
http://www.twitter.com/rightleftturn



-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Other Ways You Can Help!!!

You can make this effort successful! Share this campaign on your facebook page or twitter account! Blog or tweet about RightLeftTurn Radio.

Let your friends, family, and coworkers know about RightLeftTurn Radio

And of course tune in when we have our live radio shows! We'd love to hear from you.


If you have any other questions please email: rightleftturnradio@gmail.com

story:
Hi Everyone!

 

First of all, if you’re reading this – thank you for stopping by and checking out what I’m up to!

 

About Myself and The Album

 

For those who don’t know me, I am a singer-songwriter from Baltimore, Maryland. I’ve been performing since I was about 2 years old and have been recording, touring and writing music pretty much all my life. Besides touring across the US, I was a finalist on Season 4 of the NBC show America's Got Talent.

 

I’m starting to record my third studio album this Summer. I’ve been working on writing, pre production and funding for the album for a while now and the time has finally come to hit the studio!  I’m really excited for everyone to hear the new album!

 

Why I’m Doing This & What’s In It For You

 

Basically, the costs of making a professionally done studio album can be extremely expensive – and coming up with the funds as a touring musician can be quite difficult. Paying for the studio, mixing, mastering, producer, artwork, musicians, travel, etc can cost a fortune! The amount I’m shooting for desnt cover all  of the cost but is a huge step in the right direction… But every little bit helps.

 

So, by donating to a level of the campaign, you will get the record before ANYONE else, you will also get very cool and unique perks that only supporters like yourself will have access to. You will allow this record to happen!

 

Thank you so much for all of your support,

Drew Stevyns

story:
Short Summary

Hi!  You know us, we're Miami's Sweat Records.  We've been selling music, throwing events and providing resources for the local cultural community since 2005.

We've put on a free block party/music festival called Sweatstock every year since 2010 to celebrate the store's anniversary and Record Store Day.  We close down the street next to our shop, take over Churchill's Pub next door, and have a full day of live music, DJs, food trucks and VINYL!


THE REAL DEAL: the last three Sweatstocks were put on with funds from our 2009 Knight Arts Challenge grant and support from a beer company.  Our Knight funding period for that is over and the beer company ain't around this year.

Your contributions will help us put on what is one of the only all-ages and free music festivals in South Florida! 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are pros at throwing events on the cheap and Sweatstock is no different, but there are unavoidable costs and that's where we need your help.
  • Funding is needed to cover all the permitting for the event and the street closure, renting the stagemobile, production (sound, power and lights), security (street closures mandate a minimum amount of police presence), insurance, and sanitation.
  • The main perk is the full day of festival happiness itself, but we still have some extra goodies for those who pitch in!  Limited edition tees, special parties and more. Keep reading.

Even if we don't reach our entire goal, every cent raised will still go toward making Sweatstock 2013 the best one yet! 

 

The Impact

We can't do this without you!

You contribution is greatly appreciated AND will also be matched dollar-for-dollar by our 2012 Knight Arts Challenge grant.  (You're probably asking "Why can't you use that money?" and the answer is that the 2012 grant is for a different set of projects. As a general rule, Knight doesn't fund the same project over and over again).


Sweatstock 2010, 2011, and 2012 were AWESOME (click for recaps) and we are doing all we can to keep this tradition going, keep it free, and keep it local.  Sweatstock is for everybody.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can't help!

  • Tell your friends!  Spread the word about this campaign on FB, Twitter and beyond.  Indiegogo has great sharing tools.
  • Volunteer at the festival! Email info@sweatrecordsmiami.com to pick up a shift.

 

Thank you so much for your support and for eight amazing years!


xo,

Team Sweat

story:
Freedom Rockers,

What's up everyone???  I am Andrea, an inspirational freedom rocker who brings music to spiritual venues.  Originally, I grew up in Kentucky with horses and mint juleps....not that I drank them. hahahhahahah

I am so super excited to announce that I am going into the studio again! Whooooooooooo hoooooooooooo!  Here's the deal:  My vision of transformation, love and freedom has guided me to write a new series of songs.  These new songs  have a hip hop influence!  I have been writing music for years and it has usually been rock n roll. Rock on!  Now, I am expanding into the world of beats.  This is way outside of my box and it pushes my creativity in a beautiful new way. I love the freshness of the beats and it sharpens my edge. It's such a great way to reach the next generation and inspire towards spiritual principles.

Here's where you come in. I can't do it alone.  In the past, I have spent so much money on recording that I could hardly pay for daily living expenses. I'm sure some of you understand the incredible expense involved in studio time, musicians, mastering, and replicating  CDS (not to mention artwork and hours of rehearsing).  That's why musicians have chased the infamous 'record deal' , in hopes of having funds to do their CD the way they want.  Yet the record deal is a hefty loan from labels that the musician is required to pay back.   WELL, let's move up to 2013 where indie artists are doing it with their fans' and friends' help. Yeah!! This means so much to me that I am ready to levitate! ahahahha Yes and I want you to do it with me!! I even want to write a song with you.  There is a special perk offered where we can write a song together. WHOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!

Additionally, a percentage of funds raised will be given to Rickie Byars-Beckwith's winter/summer arts school for children.  The Kuumba Arts camp is a mobile creative experience for youth and their families.  Visit Kuumbainmotion.org Let's help kids to learn music, math and movement in a creative way that actually WORKS! Are you in?

Thanks for reading this far! You will see perks along the side of this page where you can be a part of my dream.  Any amount is greatly appreciated. xoxoxoxo Let's rock out together in a funky way! HA!

Here's where the funds go:

recording 

musicians  

mixing, mastering

replicating the cd 

artwork  

marketing and promotions

donation to Kuumba School for children- % of amount raised

You may also mail a check to : PO BOX 3821 Redondo Beach, CA 90277

 

This will be an EP or short CD.

If you are inspired to help out by promoting:  you can share this page on  Facebook or your twitter account. I appreciate any help or promo you are able to give!! Rock on Freedom Fighters!

 

 

This campaign runs from the 1st day of spring until DERBY DAY May 4, 2013. This is an all or nothing campaign. No funds will be taken unless the financial goal is met.
