story:
Hello Music Lovers,

Please watch the video above to get the full story about how positive music can be a powerful tool of change, then keep reading about an opportunity for you to play a significant role in the development of my new CD!

About Lisa Bell

I am a singer-songwriter based in Boulder, Colorado and I know that music can can make the world a better place. For the past 11 years, I have been writing and performing music that makes a difference through positive, empowering lyrics at venues throughout Colorado and most recently, across the country and internationally. I have co-produced all of my CD projects and have had the opportunity to work with some outstanding musicians along the way.

My new CD, “The Italian Project,” will be the product of a beautiful dream come true; one that embodies love, hope, and the overriding positive message that we can truly achieve anything we set our minds to. The songs speak of hope and getting past the fear in order to move forward and become the best person we can be. For this project, I have assembled an uber talented “virtual” band of musicians from Colorado and Italy for what will be our most amazing sound yet.

This will be my fourth CD and the first transatlantic project that includes collaboration with my new friends and immensely talented musical colleagues in Italy. Along with Lisa Simmons in Italy and Bob Story here in Boulder, we have been writing songs via Skype for the past year and a half. Throughout the writing process, we used a theme of positive messages and beautiful stories of change, manifestation and empowerment. Some of the songs are uplifting. Others share important stories such as the challenges of homelessness, racism and our societal fears. All are designed to make the listener take heart and take action.

What We Need

We’re asking you to make a contribution RIGHT NOW to help fund the production costs of this groundbreaking CD. In return, you’ll receive a pre-release download of the disk and as you increase your contribution, your perks will increase (see all of the fun perks to the right of the page).

As a member of my IndieGoGo community, you’ll get an inside look at the CD production process, including interviews with the musical team, video from Italy, pre-release samples of music and a sneak peak at our music video "Walk with Me," for which a percentage of the download proceeds will benefit the Humane Society. A percentage of the proceeds from the song "From The Outside Looking In" will benefit the Boulder Outreach Homeless Overflow organization. We plan to complete the CD project by January 2013.

Our goal is to raise $22,000 to produce and manufacture the new CD. The costs for the CD include:

  • Paying salaries for amazing talent on the project
  • Studio production costs in the US and Italy. This is a unique transatlantic project and we are utilizing studios both in Boulder and Sirmione, Italy to record all the parts. I’ll be visiting Italy in October to oversee backup vocal and keyboard recording. Please note, thanks to a virtually free frequent flyer ticket and staying with friends, there are no significant travel costs for me to go to Italy this go round.
  • Photo shoot and graphic design for the CD
  • Pressing and manufacturing the hard copies and digital posting

The Musicians

Bob Story – My longtime co-writer and musical partner who plays electric & acoustic guitar, mandolin, ukulele and probably a ton of other stringed instruments we haven’t thought of yet! Bob will also be editing and mixing the CD project. He has been writing and producing music for more than 20 years including his other project Martian Acres.

Lisa Simmons – Lisa grew up in my hometown of Boulder, CO and we attended the same high school. But Lisa and I only crossed paths again at the end of 2009 when we found each other on Facebook. See the video for the full story! Lisa has performed around the world for the past 25 years, and has lived in the beautiful Lago de Garda region of Northern Italy for the past 10 years, where she fronts her band Hippie Tendencies. Lisa co-wrote all of the songs on the CD and will be providing backup vocals.

Mario Pagliarulo – Born in Naples, Italy, Mario is a kick-ass bass player who currently does session work and tours internationally with artists including Serj Tankian’s System Of A Down and Trevor Hall. Mario recently moved to Denver from LA, and through yet another amazing synchronicity, we were fortunate enough to meet on Facebook. Mario is co-producing the CD with us, bringing additional flavor of Italy and serving as a translator for our colleagues in Italy!

Cesare Valubussa – The amazing drummer from Verona, Italy who also plays with Hippie Tendencies. Cesare plays with a variety of well-known bands in Northern Italy, and tours throughout Europe. We welcomed him to Colorado along with the rest of Hippie Tendencies in 2010, and fell in love with his amazing sense of backbeat and stylistic percussion.

Marco Cermaschini – Marco also resides in the Lago de Garda region of Italy and is the co-leader and co-composer along with Lisa Simmons of Hippie Tendencies original music. Marco is a fantastic keyboard player and will lend his talent on the keys as well as his new favorite toy the Hammond Melodica that I hand-carried to him in Italy last summer!

Christian Codenotti – Christian also lives in the Lago de Garda region, where he is constantly fending off the droves of women who flock due to his velvet vocals and model-like features! Christian is also a member of Hippie Tendencies and joined the group for the Colorado tour in 2010. Christian will add his beautiful voice and loving essence to the CD.

The Perks!

The last two years has been an amazing journey for me, with significant time spent writing and performing with my colleagues and friends in Colorado and in Italy. Some of the unique perks we are offering will give you a taste of the fun we’ve had! From a backyard concert and lunch at my home in Boulder to a private concert and authentic barbecue in an Italian vineyard, we’ve covered the gamut with our special perks on this campaign! At the minimum, you’ll receive a pre-release download of “The Italian Project."

No matter the amount raised, we will see the project through to completion, so you do not have to worry about not getting your goods!  Foreign currency is accepted, so you can help even if you are outside of the United States.

YOU Make the Difference!

This is the fourth CD project that I have undertaken in the past 11 years. For the previous CDs I was fortunate to have funding from friends and family, my numerous credit cards and have even borrowed on the equity of my house more than once! While I could shortcut the production value of this CD and do it for less, I want this project to be of the same high quality as my past three CDs. It takes a village to make this world go round, and with a small donation from all of you, I’ll be on my way to creating a project that we can all be proud of.

With my own tendencies to give back to my community in a big way, my Karma bank is pretty full these days! On any given day you’ll find me donating my time and money to a variety of non-profit ventures that are all designed to make this world a better and brighter place. And now I’m asking for a little assistance in return to bring my latest musical project to the world and continue on my path of spreading love and positive messages to create change through music.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word about my campaign on your social networks and use the IndieGoGo share buttons (under the video above) for easy distribution. Thank you all for your support and I can’t wait to share the music with you as we go along!
story_txt:
Hello Music Lovers,
Please watch the video above to get the full story about how positive music can be a powerful tool of change, then keep reading about an opportunity for you to play a significant role in the development of my new CD!
About Lisa Bell
I am a singer-songwriter based in Boulder, Colorado and I know that music can can make the world a better place. For the past 11 years, I have been writing and performing music that makes a difference through positive, empowering lyrics at venues throughout Colorado and most recently, across the country and internationally. I have co-produced all of my CD projects and have had the opportunity to work with some outstanding musicians along the way.
My new CD, “The Italian Project,” will be the product of a beautiful dream come true; one that embodies love, hope, and the overriding positive message that we can truly achieve anything we set our minds to. The songs speak of hope and getting past the fear in order to move forward and become the best person we can be. For this project, I have assembled an uber talented “virtual” band of musicians from Colorado and Italy for what will be our most amazing sound yet.
This will be my fourth CD and the first transatlantic project that includes collaboration with my new friends and immensely talented musical colleagues in Italy. Along with Lisa Simmons in Italy and Bob Story here in Boulder, we have been writing songs via Skype for the past year and a half. Throughout the writing process, we used a theme of positive messages and beautiful stories of change, manifestation and empowerment. Some of the songs are uplifting. Others share important stories such as the challenges of homelessness, racism and our societal fears. All are designed to make the listener take heart and take action.
What We Need
We’re asking you to make a contribution RIGHT NOW to help fund the production costs of this groundbreaking CD. In return, you’ll receive a pre-release download of the disk and as you increase your contribution, your perks will increase (see all of the fun perks to the right of the page). As a member of my IndieGoGo community, you’ll get an inside look at the CD production process, including interviews with the musical team, video from Italy, pre-release samples of music and a sneak peak at our music video "Walk with Me," for which a percentage of the download proceeds will benefit the Humane Society. A percentage of the proceeds from the song "From The Outside Looking In" will benefit the Boulder Outreach Homeless Overflow organization. We plan to complete the CD project by January 2013.
Our goal is to raise $22,000 to produce and manufacture the new CD. The costs for the CD include:

Paying salaries for amazing talent on the project
Studio production costs in the US and Italy. This is a unique transatlantic project and we are utilizing studios both in Boulder and Sirmione, Italy to record all the parts. I’ll be visiting Italy in October to oversee backup vocal and keyboard recording. Please note, thanks to a virtually free frequent flyer ticket and staying with friends, there are no significant travel costs for me to go to Italy this go round.
Photo shoot and graphic design for the CD
Pressing and manufacturing the hard copies and digital posting

Bob Story – My longtime co-writer and musical partner who plays electric & acoustic guitar, mandolin, ukulele and probably a ton of other stringed instruments we haven’t thought of yet! story:
Crooked Cowboy & The Freshwater Indians

I am The Crooked Cowboy, leader of the project. I began C.C. 13 years ago with the clear intention to focus on Intercontinental Western Music from the 50's, 60's & 70's including soundtracks, songwriters, experimental artists, jazz and orchestral; everything having to do with Western Music, and to reach a vast audience thru classic recording techniques derived from those very eras. So far, it's working. I just released our debut album on Neurotic Yell Records and the response has been overwhelming. This funding is to go towards our Sophomore effort, to be released either by NYR or another company, which I am not short on offers for.

Through the travels of recording and performing much over the years, I have learned so much from so many different people.  It has made a solid foundation for me to share my knowledge and teach up and coming writers, producers and recording artists, and has also made for enormous payoffs for the sacrifices I have made over the years to pursue excellence in the crafts I have chosen. Each and every person and experience in life ends up in a song. A true song catcher knows this and allows themselves to take it all in. All of it! All of my compositions are written with somebody in mind, or multiple persons in one song.

Earlier this year I suffered a massive heart attack and I have vowed to myself and to my friends to release this music I have written, for those very people I speak of. By contributing, you become a part of the record as well. I have always been about community efforts when it comes to music, which is why I once led a 37 piece orchestra to a live show in east Los Angeles: to bring people together through the power of music.

Above is a video from our last live show here in Los Angeles on November 3, 2012 at the Overpass. There are many videos on You Tube, Vimeo and Tumblr that wouldn't all fit on this page, but if you google Crooked Cowboy & The Freshwater Indians you will get pages full of years of hard work. Any questions you have please feel free to ask, just message me. I love talking about music, art and film. I'm sure I will end up meeting many of you as travel is in the works, and we will be traveling to promote this very album. We can take that video you just watched and rock any town we venture into. Wish us luck on this new fundraising journey , and power to positve music! C.C.

story:
Jim Beckwith: Songwriter Turned Chanter:

Play a clip from Om Sri Rama - in-progress!

I'm honored to be published recently in The Bhakti Beat! Read it here:

CROWDFUND THIS! ‘Sound Colorist’ Jim Beckwith’s Debut Chant CD Fuses Kirtan With Original Lyrics (Interview, Photos)

About my campaign and why it’s important to me:

Well, friends, I'm excited to create this next project, and I am looking for your collaboration and support. It takes an abundance of resources to create a high-level music project.
This recording project is totally devoted to the Bhakti crowd - lovers of chanting to the divine. My writing style isn't pure kirtan - I create hybrid tunes of mantra and English lyrics that relate to the concept of the chant. People love hearing these chant tunes at yoga classes and kirtans. I am honored to share my inspirations with others and  humbled by how many people are moved by my music.

In case you are not familiar with my work, you can listen to some samples of my previous projects here: Jim Beckwith music

What contributors will help me achieve:

I want to create a new offering on par with the other well-known artists in the genre of kirtan and chanting. I know many of those artists and have played with most of them, including Jai Uttal, Bhagavan Das, Saul David Raye, David Newman, Dave Stringer, Girish, Brenda McMorrow, Govindas and Radha, C.C. White, Shantala, DJ Drez and Sean Johnson and the Wild Lotus Band.

The Impact - & What You Get!

Your contribution will get you some fabulous perks! These range from in-progress mixes, to CDs sent to you before anyone else hears them, to me flying to your town to give a concert in your house or studio. It will also help me continue to inspire a lot of people with these new great songs.

As I travel to different places and share my music with others, so many people tell me how much they continue to listen to my music and how much it inspires them daily. Nothing could make me happier than to hear that. I am certain that this group of song chants is my best work to date, and I can't wait to get it out! Thanks so much in advance for your support and belief in what I do. It's so great to bring something into the world that inspires and heals. I feel so lucky and blessed to do what I do. Jai Ma! Jai Hanuman! Jai Sri Lakshmi!


What We Need & What it Takes to Make it Happen

I have already begun work on the project and have been investing my personal funds, as well as some good-faith extensions in time to pay for my services (studio and musicians). I have recorded my guide tracks and then taken it to the high-end studio and recorded all the fabulous bass and drums with my friends David Watts and Matthew Hufschmidt, as well as harp on on one sweet tune with Jennifer Sparks. Looks like there will be 9 tracks, maybe 10.

Here's the estimate:

• Studio Recording at high-end studio - $3k - 46 hours @$65/hr
• Recording and Mixing at home studio - $3k - many hours
• Studio Musician Fees - $2k
• Mastering - $1k
• graphic design and photography - $700
• Replication - 2000 CDs - plus shipping $2.3k

If I raise $12k, I only get $11,160. Fundraising isn't free, so I really would like to get above the goal. Let's go! Thank you ALL!

History of Jim Beckwith's Music for Yoga:

I've been specializing in making music for the yoga crowd for abut seven years and have focused on developing techniques and musical material for it full-time since then. I've played with many of the nation's top teachers, including Shiva Rea, Saul David Raye, Seane Corn, Desiree Rumbaugh, Dana Flynn, Hemalayaa Behl, Kia Miller and Tommy Rosen. I have also been leading kirtan at various venues including the infamous Bhakti Shala in Santa Monica. I have played various festivals, including my own very successful set last year at Bhakti Fest with an invitation for this fall as well! Quite a few Yoga Journal Conferences under my belt as well!

I have been a music producer for 20+ years, making music products for artists and commercial TV and film projects, all the while keeping up with the tools and technology to make great sounding products. Before stepping out to create my own dream creation of making music for yoga and singing more in the world, I finished a whole lot of projects for others. I've been a singer/songwriter for many years. I have 6 CDs available to date, but none that address the genre of kirtan chanting fully. This is the next step in my evolution of making music for yoga.

Somehow I have some magic in this voice and I'm so grateful to be able to share it. It is a gift. I never forget that and I also realize it doesn't last forever - one reason I want to capture it and share as much as possible. Name drop: I sat with Placido Domingo, Jr. a few years ago to listen to a bit of my music and he said "Your voice is like - a refined 'Sting'". It is really nice to have our talents acknowledged :)

About Jim:

Jim Beckwith (Hanuman Das) is an accomplished musician, songwriter and teacher. His love of music and yoga inspired him to focus on bringing live music to yoga classes. Jim's music is soulful and evocative of healing and inner awakening. He mixes mantra chants and English lyrics with a melodic and accessible tapestry of sound, exotic instrumentation and undulating rhythms. A compelling lyricist with a voice that soars from high to low with the greatest of ease, Jim is a devoted yogi and musician who focuses on Bhakti - the great yoga of the heart.

"Jim Beckwith is a sound healer and shaman. He opens healing doors with his beautiful voice and array of musical talents. He can cover such a wide range through his music that it's always inspiring and great fun to play with him. I highly recommend Jim's soulful music, voice and vibe with all those seeking healing conscious music."
~ Saul David Raye, Yoga Teacher

Other Ways You Can Help - Post it!

  • I understand if you just can't contribute money. There are other ways you can help, and I totally appreciate it. It will also help so much to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign via Facebook, Twitter, email or any other method you can think of. I would so much appreciate it.
  • Indiegogo has sharing tools to help make helping easy - here is an easily copy-and-paste link that will take your friends to my campaign page: Give to JimbeckwithCD Fundraiser

story:
First EP by TinaMazyck

Hey you! Most of you who are my friends and family know me and some of you are just meeting me for the first time. My name is TinaMazyck and I am a recording artist/ singer/ songwriter. I am now ready to showcase my talent and skill in my First EP to the world! I am enjoying embracing the artistry of music and want to share it with everyone. I create music that moves you, music that encourages to step out and be your true self. What I have to offer is transparency but most of all- positivity. I have always been a hard working individual that delivers her best work. I am putting that very dedication I have to music right into this EP. 

My style is Alternative R&B. My music focuses on vocals and style. I get my inspiration from older singers like Patti La belle, Celine Dion, Whitney Houston, Mariah Carey and Etta James. I admired that these singers made real music that bought about emotion. When I would hear any of these artists, I would be drawn in and put in a better mood. This is the type of artist I am. My music has a twist on it. Theres pop, Hip Hop, opera and Dance influences. When I merge these styles, it creates an original, real, unique sound that will leave you wanting more. I hear music in my dreams fully composed and thats where I get the bulk of my music creations from. My ultimate goal is to make the listener feel what I feel upon listening. With that being said, I am ready to make music now! 

I invite you to come and check out my raw singing videos. I sing cover songs A cappella and opera too. Check me out on Facebook having complete fun singing and see what I am really about here https://www.facebook.com/tinamazyck/. Don’t forget to sign up to my Facebook mailing list to stay up to date. This is where I have the most exclusive info, updates, tips and giveaways!! I am also on Youtube and Instagram at- tinamazyck. Feel free to share any of my videos around and come by to say hello : )

Over the years I have struggled as a musician because of fear and I didn't know where to start. Everyone knows its not easy to be vulnerable. It takes time and preparation. As of now, I have finally conquered my fear and now seriously going for it. I now consider myself in a space where I can finally make things happen for myself. I am taking this opportunity to give my fans and the world musical masterpieces. I am going all out guys. 

With your help I will be able to do exciting professional shoots. You guys will get first looks. I will be working on songs with award winning producers to deliver my best work. Working with creative videographers on my music videos, giving away behind the scenes footage and much more. I am very excited about this project and planning to let my creative side fully take the wheel. Its really moving for me to be doing something I love! Join me on this musical journey and make my dream come true. Anything helps, really! 

If you can’t help out financially, I ask of you to please Like, Share and subscribe to my social media!   Share this campaign too

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7i4GBulfrwFotnialENiTw  (Share, like, comment, subscribe)  

 https://www.facebook.com/tinamazyck/  (Like and subscribe to my Facebook mailing list to stay up to date with me. 

I can’t wait to meet you! I am very thankful for people like you helping me get to where I truly want to be!!

My name is TinaMazyck and I am a recording artist/ singer/ songwriter. I am now ready to showcase my talent and skill in my First EP to the world! I am enjoying embracing the artistry of music and want to share it with everyone. I create music that moves you, music that encourages to step out and be your true self. What I have to offer is transparency but most of all- positivity. I have always been a hard working individual that delivers her best work. I am putting that very dedication I have to music right into this EP. My style is Alternative R&B. My music focuses on vocals and style. I get my inspiration from older singers like Patti La belle, Celine Dion, Whitney Houston, Mariah Carey and Etta James. I admired that these singers made real music that bought about emotion. When I would hear any of these artists, I would be drawn in and put in a better mood. This is the type of artist I am. My music has a twist on it. Theres pop, Hip Hop, opera and Dance influences. When I merge these styles, it creates an original, real, unique sound that will leave you wanting more. I hear music in my dreams fully composed and thats where I get the bulk of my music creations from. My ultimate goal is to make the listener feel what I feel upon listening. With that being said, I am ready to make music now! I invite you to come and check out my raw singing videos. I sing cover songs A cappella and opera too. Check me out on Facebook having complete fun singing and see what I am really about here https://www.facebook.com/tinamazyck/. Don’t forget to sign up to my Facebook mailing list to stay up to date. This is where I have the most exclusive info, updates, tips and giveaways!! I am also on Youtube and Instagram at- tinamazyck. Feel free to share any of my videos around and come by to say hello : )Over the years I have struggled as a musician because of fear and I didn't know where to start. Everyone knows its not easy to be vulnerable. It takes time and preparation. As of now, I have finally conquered my fear and now seriously going for it. I now consider myself in a space where I can finally make things happen for myself. I am taking this opportunity to give my fans and the world musical masterpieces. I am going all out guys. With your help I will be able to do exciting professional shoots. You guys will get first looks. I will be working on songs with award winning producers to deliver my best work. Working with creative videographers on my music videos, giving away behind the scenes footage and much more. I am very excited about this project and planning to let my creative side fully take the wheel. Its really moving for me to be doing something I love! Join me on this musical journey and make my dream come true. Anything helps, really! If you can’t help out financially, I ask of you to please Like, Share and subscribe to my social media!   Share this campaign toohttps://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7i4GBulfrwFotnialENiTw  (Share, like, comment, subscribe)   https://www.facebook.com/tinamazyck/  (Like and subscribe to my Facebook mailing list to stay up to date with me. I can’t wait to meet you! I am very thankful for people like you helping me get to where I truly want to be!!

story:
Our Project

    Hello, my name is Chas Helge, and I am a Doctor of Musical Arts Degree Cello Performance student at the University of Oklahoma. On behalf of myself and the 25 consortium cellists who have already committed to the commission of this cello concerto, we thank you for your support.

    For my last degree recital at OU, I have commissioned a new cello concerto by composer Gene Knific. This piece is brand new multi-movement work scored for solo cellist and string chamber orchestra (2 vn1, 2vn2, 2va, 2vc, and 1db) and will be premiered in fall of 2017 at the University of Oklahoma. The commission is funded by consortium. I have given $500 of my own funds and each cellist has pledged at least $25 individually. Additionally, all the cellists have signed on with the intent of learning, performing, and/or teaching the concerto in the future.

Our Vision

    This model of consortium and crowdsourcing a cello concerto for string chamber orchestra accomplishes three objectives:

  First, it reduces overhead costs by using chamber string orchestra. More cellists can put together an ensemble of this size with ease. This also makes the group more flexible and nimble. We can bring a concerto like this to non-traditional venues more easily than a full orchestra and with more impact than a soloist or quartet. 

   Secondly, it greatly amplifies the impact of the new work. Rather than having an isolated event (the premier), one performance replicates into many performances. Additionally, teachers can give it and teach it to their students. Thus, we are also building a larger network of stakeholders, performers, and audience members than could be connected by one cellist.

  Thirdly, if we can prove that this can be done with a concerto, then why not genres of our repertoire? We want to turn the most logistically challenging, technically difficult, and artistically ambitious genre of our repertoire into a powerful and flexible tool for as many cellists as possible to use. We hope that other artists will apply and build up our model to commission their own works.

What We Need & What You Get

    We need at least $1,100 to fund our premier ($1,000 plus $100 for Indiegogo processing fees). That's a $100 honorarium for each musician of the orchestra and the conductor. If we raise more than our goal, we can schedule another rehearsal and/or increase the individual pay of the musicians.

    By investing in our project, either the commission or premier, you will receive:

  • Level 1, $5...     Our Eternal Gratitude
  • Level 2, $10...  MP3 Recordings of the Premier (+ Level 1 Reward)
  • Level 3, $25...  Commission Credit in Solo Part and Score (+ Level 1, 2 Rewards)
  • Level 4, $50...  Video Recording of the Premier  (+ Level 1, 2, & 3 Rewards)

The Consortium

    We are honored to have assembled such a diverse and international collection of students, teachers, performers, composers, arrangers, conductors, and academics. By supporting project, you help to bring this music, not only to the audience of the premier, but future audiences across the nation and globe. 

Chas Helge

  • Founder, The Knific Cello Concerto Project
  • D.M.A. Cello Performance (Currently Studying), University of Oklahoma
  • Cello and Violin Instructor, The Norman School for Strings

Dr. Rob Bradshaw

  • Principal Cellist, The Fort Smith Symphony
  • Adjunct Faculty, The University of Oklahoma

Crispin Campbell

  • Instructor of Cello, Interlochen Arts Academy
  • Faculty, Javeriana University and the Filarmonica Joven de Colombia, Colombia

Anna Clift

  • Instructor of Cello & Chamber Music, St. Olaf College
  • Founder & Director, The International Cello Institute

César Colmenares

  • Graduate Assistant, OU Symphony Orchestra
  • DMA Cello Performance Student, University of Oklahoma

Emilio Colón

  • Cellist, Composer, Arranger, Conductor
  • Associate Professor of Cello, Indiana University

Ryan Fitzpatrick

  • Term Instructor, Cello & Music Education, University of Fairbanks Alaska
  • Principal Cellist, Fairbanks Symphony

Ross Harbaugh

  • Cello Professor and Chairman of the Department of Instrumental Music, University of Miami
  • Cellist, Bergonzi String Quartet

Evan Kahn

  • Cello Instructor, Music Mission San Francisco
  • Master of Chamber Music Student, San Francisco Conservatory

Dr. Melissa Kraut

  • Co-head and Professor of Cello, The Cleveland Institute
  • Founder and Education Director, Sitka International Cello Seminar

Dr. Thomas Loewenheim

  • Professor of Cello & Director of Symphony Orchestra and Strings, California State University
  • Music Director and Conductor, Youth Orchestras of Fresno

Dr. John Marshall

  • Professor of Cello & Chamber Music, Eastern Washington University
  • Principal Cellist, Spokane Symphony Orchestra

Warren Oja

  • Graduate Assistant, University of Tennessee
  • Counselor, International Cello Institute

Ian Robinson

  • Director of Strings, Norfolk Collegiate
  • Bassist, The Original All Star Big Band

Russell Rolen

  • Cellist/Cofounder of the Spektral Quartet
  • Artist in Residence, University of Chicago  

Dr. Jonathan Ruck

  • Professor of Cello, University of Oklahoma
  • Principal Cellist, Oklahoma City Philharmonic

Paula Santa Cruz

  • Graduate Assistant, Crouse Quartet
  • DMA Cello Performance Student, University of Oklahoma

Bashdar Ahmad Sdiq

  • Representative of The National Youth Orchestra of Iraq
  • Former teacher, Sulaymaniyah Fine Arts Institute Music Department

Lauren Shriver

  • Cellist, Carolina Philharmonic
  • Cello Instructor, Moore Music Company

Eric Stephenson

  • Cellist, PROJECT Trio
  • Cellist, IRIS Orchestra

Derek Stein

  • Founding Member Gnarwhallaby & Trio Terroir
  • Cellist, wild Up Modern Music Collective

Emily Gosma Stoops

  • Celllist, Oklahoma City Philharmonic
  • Instructor, Norman School for Strings

Mark Summer

  • Cellist, Composer, Arranger
  • Co-founder of the two-time Grammy®-winning Turtle Island Quartet

Joseph Tatum

  • Composer and Electro-Acoustic Artist
  • Cellist, Reno Philharmonic

Bruce Uchimura

  • Professor of Cello and USO Conductor, Western Michigan University
  • Cellist, The Merling Trio

Adriana Fernández Vizcaíno

  • Interim Principal, Cuenca-Ecuador's Symphony Orchestra
  • M.M. Western Michigan University

story:
14 year old musician and filmmaker, Zaneta Ambassa, needs your support to help her take the next big step in her career. 

 

After the launch of her career at 12 years old, Zaneta wasn't sure what to do next. Was she going to be a 'one hit wonder' she wondered? She reached out to her local film cooperative, FilmPEI, and the Executive Director, Renee Laprise, recognizing Zaneta's talent and drive agreed to be her mentor. 

When Zaneta showed Renee her song 'Hurt Me Without Sounds' Renee thought it would be awesome for Z to do a music video as her next film. But she thought that the song needed to be professionally recorded. 

Renee reached out to local music producer and Billboard recording artist Desi Caruso www.desicaruso.com.  Desi liked the song and has offered to record, sound design and master it! 

Once the song is recorded, Renee will act as producer and mentor to Zaneta for the writing and directing of her very own music video. 

Normally recording a song and creating a music video would take thousands and thousands of dollars but Z has a team of people ready to step up and help her see her dream realized ... AND YOU CAN BE PART OF MAKING Z's DREAM A REALITY! 

Contribute now to her Indigogo campaign and you'll get an MP3 of her professionally produced track 'Hurt Me Without Sounds'. 

THANKS TO EVERYONE IN ADVANCE FOR BEING PART OF THE MAGIC!

story:
Who Are We?

7th Street Big Band was conceived in the depths of East San Jose by our drummer and fearless leader, Gabby Horlick. Gabby had always dreamed of starting a big band, and in 2013, she was finally able to to make it a reality. It’s been a difficult journey, but four years later, we’re still going strong—and still rehearsing in Gabby’s living room.

Now that we’ve had time to establish ourselves, it’s time to take our next big step: recording an album. Our debut album, “Off Cinderella Lane,” will feature entirely new compositions and arrangements written and performed by young, up-and-coming musicians. We’re not your grandparents’ big band—we’re bringing some of the hippest beats and rhythms to the table, and we’re ready to get funky.


The Music

Our band is incredibly tight-knit. We’re not just colleagues; we’re close friends, and those friendships are what brought many of us to join this band in the first place. We know from experience that making music with people you know and trust is not only more fun, it results in better music.

We’re also a very diverse band. We have many members who are people of color and/or children of immigrants. Additionally, while women continue to be underrepresented in jazz, we are proud to be led by a woman, and we have five women members total. We believe that when certain groups of people are left out or left behind, their potential artistic contributions are lost, and both performers and listeners suffer. We are proud to represent the many ways one can be “American” while coming together to play America’s original musical genre—jazz.

While we are proud of jazz’s American heritage, we also believe that it’s a living art form which continues to evolve. “Off Cinderella Lane” will feature original compositions written by seven different band members, each with their own unique style and perspective. There will be some swing tunes, but this is not an album of straight-ahead jazz. Our composers draw on a variety of influences and incorporate styles ranging from hip-hop to reggae.

The Budget

Our total budget is $8,000. Here’s what that will go towards:

  • Studio Time: This October, we will be spending three full days at 25th Street Recording in Oakland, CA.
  • Mixing & Mastering: Once we’re done recording, we’ll need an audio engineer to make sure everything sounds just right. (No auto-tune, we promise!)
  • Promotion: There’s no point to making an album if we can’t share it with our awesome fans! This includes promotional videos, advertising, and the cost of producing posters and T-shirts.
  • Artwork: The amazing artist Ellen Hoffman has painted our album artwork, which features everyone in the band. We’re happy to have such a personalized look and feel to the album, and excited for the opportunity to showcase such a talented artist.
  • Duplication: The CDs aren’t going to print themselves!

Risks & Challenges

Overall, our band members are pretty young. Many of us are still in college. We think of this as an asset, because it means we have a fresh perspective and room to grow. But, there are also downsides. We don’t have the money or resources that come with age and a more established career. This makes embarking on a big project like this risky and a little scary. But it’s a risk we feel compelled to take, because we truly believe in this band and this album.

Over the past few years, we’ve overcome a lot of hurdles. A big band is…well, big! There are twenty of us all together. Communicating, planning rehearsals, and scheduling gigs can be a bit like herding cats. Even finding a rehearsal space is a challenge. Four years in, we still rehearse in Gabby’s living room!

Finding paying gigs for a group of twenty people can seem nearly impossible. This band is not a full-time job for any of us. We all have many other obligations: day jobs, school, and other musical endeavors. This is truly a labor of love.

Other Ways You Can Help

Broke like no joke? Want to advocate the sound, but still need to support yourself? We get it. It only takes a click or two to spread the word like the spread on your mama’s deli sandwiches. And remember, every little bit helps. We appreciate your love in any form, and celebrate that you love us hooligans in the first place. Also, don’t forget to follow us on social media to hear about our upcoming events and other antics straight from the source.

story:
This is the beginning of something beautiful

We've been working hard to create an incredible new album and now we're ready to get into the studio so that we share these song with you! We're shooting for the stars, and you are the jet fuel we need to get there!

 

What we need & What you get

We're not asking you to fund our entire album. We've been working hard and saving up for that as well... What we're asking is your help to get this album done and into your hands sooner as well as help us be able to make this the best sounding record possible.

The writing, recording, editing, mixing and mastering of a great album takes an abundance of time, energy, and money. We're raising the funds in this campaign to help with the costs of the studio time, production, and post-production.

We've estimated our costs to be around $6,000. But again, we're not asking for all of that from you. 

  • How the $4,000 will be spent:
  • $2,500: Production and Post-Production costs; Recording, Editing, Mixing, Studio rental, Musicians and Production team
  • $1,000: Mastering the Final Product
  • $500: Album Artwork and Design
  • $1,000: Manufacturing of Physical Copies and Digital Submissions
  • The remainder will be to help offset the costs of fulfilling our Perks and covering costs for traveling of all the musicians throughout the process

Any funds raised beyond $4,000 will go towards the Indiegogo fees and additional production and post-production costs, musicians' time, developing our website and online presence, marketing and distribution. 

We have incredible packages that will never be on sale anywhere else, exclusive releases limited to this campaign, and some fun limited experiences. 

Stretch Goals

We cannot thank you all enough for the early contributions that helped us reach our goal, as it all goes directly towards the production of new music. NOW...In order to incentivize contribution, we've attributed the number of backers to what we think will be some awesome one of a kind rewards back to you "The Backers" ONLY:

50 BACKERS (LOCKED): ALL BACKERS GET FREE COPY OF 1ST SINGLE EMAILED TO THEM!

100 BACKERS (LOCKED): ALL BACKERS WILL RECEIVE A ONE-OF-A-KIND SHIRT SENT TO THEIR DOOR!

150 BACKERS (LOCKED): ALL BACKERS WILL RECEIVE A 3-SONG EP OF SECRET SONGS (NOT ON THE ALBUM) SENT TO THEM!

200 BACKERS (LOCKED): ALL BACKERS WILL GET INTO THE CD RELEASE SHOW FOR FREE!

250 BACKERS (LOCKED): WE GET TO GO ON TOUR THIS SUMMER!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a spot to contribute to the production of this record, you can still help! The best way is by sharing this campaign via email and social media using the IndieGoGo Share Tools by the "BACK IT" button the top of the page!

100 BACKERS (LOCKED): ALL BACKERS WILL RECEIVE A ONE-OF-A-KIND SHIRT SENT TO THEIR DOOR!
150 BACKERS (LOCKED): ALL BACKERS WILL RECEIVE A 3-SONG EP OF SECRET SONGS (NOT ON THE ALBUM) SENT TO THEM!
200 BACKERS (LOCKED): ALL BACKERS WILL GET INTO THE CD RELEASE SHOW FOR FREE!
250 BACKERS (LOCKED): WE GET TO GO ON TOUR THIS SUMMER!
 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you aren't in a spot to contribute to the production of this record, you can still help! The best way is by sharing this campaign via email and social media using the IndieGoGo Share Tools by the "BACK IT" button the top of the page!

story:
“a plausible mission of artists is to make people appreciate being alive at least a little bit”

                                        -Kurt Vonnegut

 

Hello fans, friends & family! 

 

You have just heard the tale of the formation of this Analog Dog, a rare hybrid band-plant, just emerging from its seedling stage, ready to flourish. Now, we need your help to grow!

 

We could of course continue to develop the plant theme ad infinitum with great metaphors like “we’re ready to produce some dazzling flowers for you”, etc., but we’re told it’s best to keep it honest and simple here. 

 

So, here’s the pitch: We are Analog Dog, five guys from all over the USA* who by bookkeeper’s odds should never have met, yet have managed to come together in San Francisco to form a bodacious rockin’ band. As a group, we’re committed to honoring the diverse musical backgrounds and pursuits of each band member, while looking ahead to develop new sounds and compositions. 

 

After writing and rehearsing for several months, we self-funded the recording, production, and release of our first two singles, “Product Pivot” and “Moon High,” this past September. We followed this release with a string of shows in the Bay Area, while writing and rehearsing for the production of our first EP. In the process of promoting our singles and building our audience, we’ve been continually reminded that as a new band in today’s streamy music business, it is a real challenge to make any proceeds from our primary product, i.e. the music, once it is actually produced. 

 

Rather than see this as a negative, we are embracing the opportunity to ‘flip the script’ and are encouraging our fans to contribute to the production of the music up front. This in turn will create that sweet endorphin boost when you listen to the final product that you helped conjure out of thin air with a mere 16 digits and exp. date. 

 

We are looking for investors who believe in Analog Dog and want to be a part of producing new and original music with the stated goal of helping people appreciate being alive and in the moment. at least a little bit. Our dream is to take this show on the road, and with our EP finished we will have the beginnings of a catalogue to support musical adventures up and down the west coast, and beyond. 

 

How much does that cost? Where does the $$ go?

 

Well, to be honest, it costs more than you might think and the money we raise will go to many different places. But for the sake of clarity, here’s a list of things that cost $3000:

 

2.5 days Recording studio fees - $1600

Mastering - $300

Video production for one song (on a budget) - $500

Cover art - $300

1 month rehearsal studio rent - $425

Van - $8000

______________________________________________

 

Total: $11,125

 

Oh shoot, may have gone over. Well, you get the picture. In return for helping us bring these songs to life, you’ll not only get to call yourself a patron of the arts, but you’ll also get some extra cool swag, like plants or a polaroid photo of the band!  

 

There are inevitably countless challenges inherent in the creative arts -- we routinely debate the best way to spend our time and money to create the highest quality recordings and performances that we possibly can, while continuing to connect with and grow our audience. We believe this crowd fund can be the spark to launch a truly magical rocketship, and are grateful for your participation. 

 

And in the end if you can’t part with the cash at this time, please share our music with a friend! We’d love them to hear it. 

 

Thank you so much!

 

With love,

Rob, Eric, Jason, Steven, & Austin

a.k.a. Analog Dog

 

*Quite a distribution indeed - Northeast, Mid-Atlantic, South, Southwest, Midwest, and now all live in the West. If you connect all points with a line it makes a smile!

story:
Si t'as déjà ta carte de crédit dans les mains, tu peux cliquer sur les images pour voir les récompenses!! 

    Qui sommes-nous? 

    Et on déjeune est un band formé de 5 témiscabitibiennes qui composent des chansons originales depuis 2019. 

    Nous sommes 5 femmes passionnées et issues de parcours différents (arts visuels, musique classique, DJing, technique de scène, danse, théâtre, communication, intervention, etc.).

    Étant impossible de nous caser dans un style musical déjà existant, on a donc décidé de créer notre propre style : L'«Oestro-prog alt-indie».

    Notre campagne/ pourquoi un socio-financement?

    On a hâte de faire un show depuis des mois, de présenter nos créations, de triper avec les gens. SURPRISE! Pas cette année! Pour partager notre musique et notre passion en ces temps de m****, il faut se tourner vers des outils qui se partagent sans contact. La solution qui se présente à nous : Enregistrons nos chansons et tournons un vidéoclip! 

    Ceci dit, nous voulons profiter de cette opportunité pour travailler avec d’autres talents de la région et ainsi faire rayonner le potentiel témiscabitibien et ce, dans plusieurs disciplines! Ce sera super enrichissant de collaborer avec des vidéastes de chez nous, des producteurs et des mixeurs de musique de chez nous.

    Ce sera un cadeau qui nous permettra de définir notre identité professionnelle. On ne va pas se mentir, ce produit-là sera pour le band, un outil professionnel, une carte de visite.

    On veut se balancer, donnez-nous une pousse!

    On vous inviterait bien à des spectacles, parce que c’est ça qui nous fait tripper mais faut prendre notre mal en patience : Pour l’instant on sollicite votre participation qui nous aidera à partager nos créations de façon virtuelle. 

    Nos besoins : 

    •     5 000 $ pour l'enregistrement de l'album (par des gens de la région) : déplacements, producteurs et mastering ;
    •     7 500 $ dans un vidéoclip (par des gens de la région) ;
    •     1 200 $ de frais Indiegogo ; 
    •     1 300 $ de gestion de carrière musicale.

    Vos récompenses uniques : MALADE!

    •   Avoir notre premier single avant tout le monde ;
    •   Recevoir notre EP ;
    •   Avoir votre nom dans une chanson et/ou dans le générique du clip ;
    •   Aller déjeuner avec nous ;
    •   Recevoir un spectacle exclusif dans votre cour.
     

    Si l'objectif final n'est pas atteint: 

    Nous allons prioriser l'enregistrement de l'album et mettre le surplus directement dans le vidéoclip, quitte à contribuer de notre poche pour atteindre notre objectif.

    Votre impact

    Donc si vous voulez encourager des « femmes bad ass de la région »,  et voulez pousser d’autres personnes à dire « je veux déménager à Rouyn » ou encore, « vous êtes les grandes gagnantes de la pandémie », encouragez-nous! Ça nous fera plaisir de vous livrer toutes nos âmes sur des plateaux d’argent.

    D’autres façons de nous aider!

    On comprend que c'est pas tout le monde qui peut donner des sous, mais vous pouvez faire aller vos réseaux sociaux. 

    • partagez la campagne avec la page ici (juste en dessous du montant accumulé il y a les petits icônes : Facebook, Indiegogo, etc.)
    • parlez-en à votre entourage ;
    • allez cliquer j’aime sur notre page Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/etondejeune
     

    MERCI !

allez cliquer j’aime sur notre page Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/etondejeune

story:
Introduction

Hi, I'm Laura. A singer, musician and songwriter. I've been working on my debut solo album and it's nearly finished! But I need your help to wrap it up and get it out there. I've released music before with laki mera and God's Boyfriend but this will be my first outing as a solo artist. I've been working hard and I'm so excited to finally let people hear it and with your help we can make that happen.

How's it going to sound...?

I believe there are some people out there who will love this album (even if I do say so myself)! Sound wise there are a lot of similarities with laki mera and I know the sound quality of the finished product will be top notch 'cause I've got co-producer Andrea Gobbi on the case! 

Feel free to check out our previous work...
laki mera - Fool
laki mera - Talk To Me
laki mera - Facebook

The Money Stuff

Up to this point I've self funded all the recording - it's taken a couple of years. This has included studio time, equipment hire and bringing in some amazing musicians to add drums, brass and strings. 

Apart from a couple of tiny things to record there is now mixing and mastering to be done.

The remaining costs look like this:
Mixing incl. studio time + engineer = £2900
Mastering = £450
CD pressing, licencing and download set-up = £1500
Materials for the perks = £300
(this is a rough estimate and depends entirely on what perks people go for...)
Postage and packaging of CDs and perks = £400
(again, this depends on how many people manage to support the campaign!)

Working Total = £5550.

As I'm going for the flexible funding option this means if I don't reach my target I can still access any money raised and put it towards these costs. This album will be finished by hook or by crook!!

As a graphic designer with a textile degree I'm turning my hand to art and design to provide some unique rewards for those of you who wish to give a bit more. I will hand embroider lyrics, have some limited edition prints made of the album artwork (one lucky person could also own the original!) and there will also be t-shirts which I will design myself. Click on each perk to see full details of what you'll receive.

You can help by sharing...

Any money raised through the campaign will be a huge help but if you can't afford to pre-order this album you can still help by sharing this campaign on any social media with anyone you feel may be interested. Either way, thanks for reading this far! Onwards and upwards...

Let your listening be wide. xx

story:
Too Much Joy's First New Album In 24 Years

Remember Too Much Joy? Way back in the '90s, the Village Voice (remember the Village Voice?) said, "These guys were sarcastic before Pavement knew how to smirk. And they nail the hard-pop thing that made Green Day a household product. They're the lost big brothers of indie's sweet 'n' nasty contingent, redolent with wit and wet with musical spit. They'll make you slam and think at the same time."

Too Much Joy never broke up, they just sort of stopped playing shows or releasing records. Until now.

Equal parts bored and inspired in quarantine, they asked each other why they'd never recorded certain old songs of theirs they remembered fondly, and started swapping ideas for new tunes. Before they knew it, they had a couple dozen tracks in varying stages of completion. Some of them were written when they were in their twenties; some of them were written yesterday; some of them are still unfinished while Tim types this instead. 

Their somewhat ridiculous goal: complete the album in time for Christmas 2020.

How You Can Help

They've already begun recording for the new album. But the more people who pre-order it now, the better it will sound, because they'll be able to spend more time in the studio and master the results properly, and the prettier it will look, because they can hire an actual designer to create a cover and booklet, instead of relying on Tim's rudimentary Photoshop skills and atrocious taste in fonts.

The album's tentatively titled Last Century, because half the songs were written in the literal last century, while the other half were written in what metaphorically feels like it might be humanity's last century. Something about the juxtaposition of songs they composed as callow kids and songs that are just now springing to life feels good and true and right, as if the tunes are having a conversation with one another. The old songs challenge the new ones to be louder and faster, while the new ones scoff at how naive those old ones were. You can hear some of them already here.

Announcing their intentions publicly is mostly just a way to give them a genuine deadline so they don't spend too much time bickering about who needs to be louder in the mix. But it's good news for fans of the band, or anyone who enjoys loud, literate, slightly snotty but secretly earnest music. To wit:

  • Everyone who contributes gets the album before it's officially released!
  • Folks who contribute at higher levels get rough mixes of selected songs even before that!
  • You can also attend a Zoom hangout with the band, if hearing them make fun of Jay interests you.
  • Ever wanted to be in a song? That, too, is possible! 

The Plan

The band has set a goal of $5,000, because that's what the designer and the mastering engineer will cost. If they raise more, they might be able to swing a limited-edition vinyl release. If they raise less, maybe they can bargain with the designer and the engineer.

Important Caveats

Plans can change! The album could take longer to complete than anticipated, or the band might decide the old songs aren't as good as the new ones (or vice versa), or change the title and concept halfway through. Such is the nature of any creative endeavor.

But you will be getting a record, when it's completed. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We hope you can help the band make their somewhat humble dream a reality by donating. But if money's tight, or if you'd simply prefer to wait until the record actually exists to purchase it, you can still assist them by sharing news of this project as far and wide as you're able.

We thank you either way.

story:
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

You've Released Projects Before, Why is This One Special?

The project, simply put, will establish a case for Rhys Langston as a multidisciplinary artist whose ideas are the limit, not the medium.

  1. the audio will be more musically refined and pop-sensible than any release thus far

  2. the book will show the literary strengths and instincts of his lyrics, written to stand alone as poetry

  3. an introductory absurdist manifesto will frame the work in a contemporary and (increasingly) surreal cultural context, stylistically teetering between prose poetry and parodic academic discourse.  

  4. the e-book will feature audio that can be played, paused, rewound, and fast-forwarded as the text is read through 

  5. an interactive glossary at the end will provide caveats and hints for cross-references and subtextual scavenger hunts. 

  6. the yet-to-be-unveiled album cover will showcase Rhys Langston's technical and aesthetic sleight of hand in the art of painting, as a work unto itself

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

With these intents, the album and book serve to gather crossover interest from unlikely sources, like those interested in music but not poetics, and vice versa.  As he figures on track 8 of the album, he might just be the Spotify-friendly poet laureate of his living room. 

It as well is an intentional stab at the reasoning for segregating art forms, and a proposal for the challenges in communicating various levels of depth in an age of diminished attention spans. 

This is all surely big talk, so trust others' praise for Rhys Langston's early artistic attempts:

  • Rhys Langston as The Cover Story of LA Record Magazine Winter 2016/17 Issue

  • Passion of the Weiss on R.L.'s Aggressively Ethnically Ambiguous Album

  • A sweet and short review by AFROPUNK

  • LA Weekly's Profile on R.L.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Why Crowdfunding / What Will You Get?

Though there will be help in formally releasing the work, your assistance is sought in paying for finishing costs, including:

  • A professional master for the album’s audio

  • The creation and coding of the multimedia e-book

  • Press photos and music video production

  • Any copyediting fees and supplementary marketing materials

Based on the contribution amount, patrons will receive a variety of perks and rewards.  All donations of $5 and above will automatically earn a digital download of the album upon its release.  Upwards of $10, those who donate will receive some (or all) of the following, based on quantity given:

  • A digital copy of a yet-to-be released EP

  • A physical copy of the album's book

  • Two physical albums from Rhys Langston's back catalog

  • Limited edition art prints

  • A custom-made art piece

  • A custom song written

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

What Your Contribution Will Mean to Us!!

You, the people, will be directly aiding the ascension of Rhys Langston's fledgling venture Black Market Poetry and the mythos of Langstónia.  So as to not run the personal well too dry, we have come up with the figure of $2,000 to help launch these ideas from our hard drives to your physical and digital hands.  Please consider supporting a small Black business. Though other hands with connections and means might help us in circulating the work, the peer-to-peer support and backing is truly the only way for this potentially transformative art to take hold.

 

If You Cannot Donate Right Now/Want to Help Otherwise

  • Wait a few days, and blindly donate without checking your bank balance.

  • Let your friends, enemies, lovers, coworkers, second cousins twice removed, twice moved across the country, know about this (that means by phone, text, Cambridge Analytica dossier, a post with male-presenting nipples on Instagram, etc.)

  • Listen to Rhys Langston's music on streaming services to get his numbers up, under fealty to the nobles of intangible media forms

  • Stick your head out the nearest window and yell, "I'm broke as hell and I'm not gonna take it anymore!"

Thank you for any and all consideration you may have!

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

IMAGE CREDITS (Top to Bottom)

"Jesus of Los Feliz" by Parker Day

"Aggressively Ethnically Ambiguous (self-portrait)" by Rhys Langston

"R.L. in His Bureau of Internal Affairs" by Salim Green

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
story_txt:
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
You've Released Projects Before, Why is This One Special?
The project, simply put, will establish a case for Rhys Langston as a multidisciplinary artist whose ideas are the limit, not the medium.

the audio will be more musically refined and pop-sensible than any release thus far
the book will show the literary strengths and instincts of his lyrics, written to stand alone as poetry
an introductory absurdist manifesto will frame the work in a contemporary and (increasingly) surreal cultural context, stylistically teetering between prose poetry and parodic academic discourse.  
the e-book will feature audio that can be played, paused, rewound, and fast-forwarded as the text is read through 
an interactive glossary at the end will provide caveats and hints for cross-references and subtextual scavenger hunts. 
the yet-to-be-unveiled album cover will showcase Rhys Langston's technical and aesthetic sleight of hand in the art of painting, as a work unto itself

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
With these intents, the album and book serve to gather crossover interest from unlikely sources, like those interested in music but not poetics, and vice versa.  As he figures on track 8 of the album, he might just be the Spotify-friendly poet laureate of his living room. 
It as well is an intentional stab at the reasoning for segregating art forms, and a proposal for the challenges in communicating various levels of depth in an age of diminished attention spans. 
This is all surely big talk, so trust others' praise for Rhys Langston's early artistic attempts:

Rhys Langston as The Cover Story of LA Record Magazine Winter 2016/17 Issue
Passion of the Weiss on R.L.'s Aggressively Ethnically Ambiguous Album
A sweet and short review by AFROPUNK
LA Weekly's Profile on R.L.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -


- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
Why Crowdfunding / What Will You Get?
Though there will be help in formally releasing the work, your assistance is sought in paying for finishing costs, including:

A professional master for the album’s audio
The creation and coding of the multimedia e-book
Press photos and music video production 
Any copyediting fees and supplementary marketing materials

Based on the contribution amount, patrons will receive a variety of perks and rewards.  All donations of $5 and above will automatically earn a digital download of the album upon its release.  Upwards of $10, those who donate will receive some (or all) of the following, based on quantity given:

A digital copy of a yet-to-be released EP
A physical copy of the album's book
Two physical albums from Rhys Langston's back catalog
Limited edition art prints
A custom-made art piece
A custom song written 

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -


- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

story:
Short Summary

The Y Axes are a San Francisco-based indie outfit who play a unique blend of dreamy, synth-glossed pop and rhythmically robust rock.

Having initially formed as a recording project by vocalist Alexi Rose Belchere and guitarist Devin Nelson, the duo decided to take on the project full time after premiering a set of songs at their space and prom-themed joint birthday party in July 2011. Bassist Jack Sundquist and drummer Paul Conroy and joined in 2015 and early 2018 respectively to contribute their groovy and heavy rhythms to the quartet’s energetic recorded and live performance.

Alexi’s lyrics cut through the intricate riffs of guitarist Devin, while bassist Jack and drummer Paul lock up the rhythm with double-bass kicks and slaps. They combine intricate instrumentations and ethereal vocal melodies to create pop that is simultaneously frantic, anthemic, heartbreaking, and hard-hitting.

What We Need

"No Waves" is our most expansive record yet and we're so excited to share it with you! Unfortunately, we have several outstanding costs to settle and so much we still want to accomplish, and we need your help!

With your financial backing, we hope to achieve the following:

  • Finish all outstanding album production and settle all recording costs
  • Press the album to CD, Vinyl, as well as attain worldwide digital distribution
  • Promote our upcoming release and tour through the help of industry PR and marketing professionals

The Impact

The Y Axes has been a band for 5 years and "No Waves" will be our fourth full-length album. We've cut our teeth playing in clubs and house shows all over the San Francisco Bay Area and California. The reason we've now decided to finally crowdfund an album is because "No Waves" *is* the record we truly believe will take us to new heights! Obtaining the much-needed financial backing for this record release makes all the difference in reaching new audiences, opening new opportunities, and touring in new cities where we've never had a presence.

Risks & Challenges

It's no secret that there's little money in being a musician, and living in San Francisco as a musician is a challenge in and of itself! As a band, we risk the possibility that we will not secure the funding needed to publish this record on our target release date (early 2019), or that we won't secure enough to press it on vinyl. Regardless, we love writing music and performing and are dedicated to utilizing every penny we receive on sharing this album with our fans!

Other Ways You Can Help

Short on cash? No problem! Share our campaign and our music with friends and on social media. Every share will be rewarded with a free download for our new single Empty Space, just tag us or use the hashtag #theYaxes. Every little bit helps!

story:
We're back in the studio to produce our 3rd full length album. 


Why do we think you should support us?


In a time dominated by big business, product placement, and electronic bands who record at home we think it's important to provide an alternative. 
It's not cheap to produce a good album and its not easy to be independent. We spend a lot of our own money and usually end up with a loss. Fans tell us 'you are different, there is no other band like you, you are crazy', which is nice for us, but not fitting into a niche means we are on our own. If we were a typical female fronted gothic metal band it would be easy, if we were a typical political punk band it would be easy, but easy is not always right and do you want us to be typical?

Save the underground, save the dream. Help us to be atypical and we promise to deliver another kick ass album, 

Now here's the deal..

The next album will be produced by none other than Lord of the Lost mastermind Chris Harms, who needs no introduction. Lord of the Lost are a fixture in the European gothic scene and headlined all the major festivals. He believes in us and so should you.

We know there are millions of bands out there who want your money and some of them even deserve it, but you are not just one in a million and neither are we, so why not stick together? You might even like the fact that there are always the same bands on each festival, but how about some change? Just for once a little bit of fresh blood. Together we can make a change. Help us to conquer the stages and join us for the insanity that is a Lolita KompleX show.

Why do we need money?

We might be willing to lose money on this because it's our passion, but the people we work with need to pay their bills and feed their families. Even if everyone would be working for free (which they are not), there is still the issue of electricity bills, material, transport and such. We ourselves had it a habit to support artists we like. If you like something, give back. Makes it easier for everyone and exposure doesn't pay bills.

Aren't you famous enough?

Try paying at the supermarket by showing them how many instagram followers and likes you have. Famous is a pretty shaky concept given that most people tend to like the stuff they are bombarded with and/or what fits their perception of themselves . We like to think are fans are smarter than that. 

OK, so what am I paying for here?

This campaign aims to get additional funding to pay for the production including session musicians (valued at around 10.000 EUR), GEMA fees, transport to and from the studio (several Malta - Hamburg - Malta flights), accommodation in Hamburg during the production, artwork, physical album, promotional items and merchandise for perks. So you can see. It's just the tip of the iceberg.

Why are you not recording it at home like everyone else?

As our tattoo artist always says 'good work ain't cheap, cheap work ain't good'. We aim for a certain quality level and authenticity. You don't get that with drum computers and home recordings. It might work for electronic bands or a certain style but for our 'sound' it simply doesn't work. We already took all possible measures to reduce costs. This is as far as we can go.

story:
“A perfect synthesis of eclectic influences”  -Acoustic Guitar magazine

 

I am an acoustic guitarist in the Pacific Northwest. This project will be my seventh album, and my first new solo record in over six years. Though most often billed as an acoustic “jazz” guitarist, I like to think I’m exploring areas between Americana, jazz, and blues. My approach is somewhat informed by studying some classical guitar when I was school age, and a bit from being exposed to the "California style” of solo guitar playing on the Windham Hill label that was happening around me as a young person in the Bay Area in the early 80’s.  In the 90's I lived in San Francisco and was very active in the blues, jazz, and funk scene. Having an original style is something I always strive for, as well as having a healthy respect for the groove. But most of all, I have a passion for up-close, uncluttered, and unadulterated acoustic sound.

 

 

 "A fabulous 'seminar' on quietly building drama" -Guitar Player magazine

   

I have performed live on morning television for NBC and FOX. My music has been featured on National Public Radio and Public Radio International. I’ve been in magazines such as Guitar Player, Fretboard Journal, Premier Guitar, Acoustic Guitar, Guitar World, Jazziz, Jazz Improv, 20th Century Guitar, and I was on the cover of Acoustic Guitar in China. I’ve played all over the United States mostly in small venues and house concerts. Some notable public venues would be Yoshi's, Club Passim, The Freight And Salvage, The Rio Theater, the Alberta Rose Theater here in Portland… I’ve also been a regular at the NAMM Show in Anaheim California for years. I have played at quite a few guitar festivals, including the Healdsburg Guitar Festival, and the Fretboard Journal Summit. In 2011 the Santa Cruz Guitar Company released a signature model guitar that I designed with renowned builder Richard Hoover that has gone on to become a best seller for them.

 

"Taste, tone, and technique!" - JAZZIZ Magazine  

 

My previous release, “June Apple,” is a collection of traditional fiddle tunes arranged for mandolin and guitar, and features virtuoso mandolinist Tim Connell. Just before that I did an acclaimed acoustic guitar duo album, “Artifact,” which is a collection of eight original, highly improvisational guitar pieces recorded with Los Angeles based Mark Goldenberg -longtime guitarist for Jackson Browne, Bonnie Raitt, Linda Ronstadt, and many more. 

My last solo guitar release was 2012's “A Different Kind Of Blue" -a solo acoustic guitar re-imagining of the iconic Miles Davis record Kind Of Blue, which was named in Acoustic Guitar magazine's top ten albums of 2012. I have three other albums that are currently out of print. Slow Moving Dog -an acoustic funk album featuring acoustic guitar, upright bass, and drums. And my first two solo acoustic guitar albums, “For Lulu,” and "Acoustic Jazz Guitar Solos.”

 

 

  "An acoustic guitar master" - Stage and Studio

 

This new project is something I’ve thought about doing for years.  As mentioned above, I’ve been involved in a lot different styles of music in my forty-five years of guitar playing, but the first things I learned to do were blues based, and that is really something that I believe hopefully comes through in everything I've done since. Playing with feeling is the most important thing to me. I knew I wanted to make a blues focused record, and I think that’s mostly what this is. But there’s a also a few jazz ballads, some new original things. Some of it has a funk feel, at least one bossa groove, some shuffles too. But it's all tied together by trying to dig deep and pull up something authentic in the moment. 

 

 

 

“Stunning improvisational performances” -Acoustic Guitar magazine

 

I have already recorded all of the music for the new album in one big single-day tracking session recently. It was captured by my good friend and longtime recordist Bruce Robertson. Bruce is a very talented engineer from NYC that has an amazing room here in Portland.  My budget goals reflect a to-do list that includes mixing and mastering the recording, buying the artwork, paying the graphic designer, manufacturing CDs, and get a promotional campaign going. 

 

I hope you’ll look over the incentives, and consider being a part of the ride. And maybe sharing this page with friends as well.  Thank you for your time and consideration.

Best, e 

 

Webpage

Facebook

Instagram 

Twitter

Youtube

 

 
 

 

 

.

story:
Crippled Black Phoenix - Support the Tour!

The collective outfit Crippled Black Phoenix are touring Europe in March and April, along with Soft Kill and Fotocrime. Since touring with 8 musicians from various countries (the UK, Sweden, the USA), getting them together for rehearsals and then putting them on the road is not cheap, and since we do not want to borrow money from our record label, we are offering some special perks and rewards so that you can help us complete the tour and also feel good about getting something unique back in return.  A full list of tour dates are listed below, underneath the package options.  Even if you're not contributing, come out to a show and say hi!  Getting this behemoth on the road is always a tricky proposition, but there's nothing we'd rather be doing.

 

Here's what we are offering to backers, while quantities last:

  • A new and exclusive T-shirt design, limited to 100 shirts, available in your custom size (from S to XXL), for €30.  This shirt will not be sold at our live shows or re-printed!
  • Hand-written lyrics to your favorite Crippled Black Phoenix song, written out for you by CBP founder Justin Greaves, limited to the first 40 backers, for €25.  You pick the song. 
  • An exclusive tour pass which gets you free entrance (for yourself only) into any Crippled Black Phoenix headlining show in 2019 or 2020 (excluding festival shows or shows where CBP are not headlining) for €100, limited to the first 20 backers!
  • The exclusive tour pass from above, plus the exclusive T-shirt, for €125, limited to the first 10 backers!
  • For those who just want to contribute €5 to help us out, an option to do that too.  Every little bit helps.

 

Notes:

- All prices are exclusive of shipping costs.  Shipping for the lyrics or for the tour pass are €10 per item (combined shipping isn't possible if you order both, since they are being shipped from two separate locations), and shipping for the T-shirt or T-shirt/tour pass combo is €15. 

- The T-shirts will be manufactured to order based on the quantity (maximum 100 sold) and sizes of each order, and shall not be available after this campaign.

- The tour pass will gain you free entry into any Crippled Black Phoenix show (other than festival appearances, shows which CBP are not headlining, fundraising/charity appearances or unique events. The tour pass may already be used for the forthcoming March/April 2019 dates, and will be valid for CBP live shows through December 31st, 2020.  If using the tour pass, please let us know by sending us an e-mail or Facebook message at least three (3) days prior to such event, to prevent issues with maximum venue capacity.  The tour pass shall not entitle you to backstage access or special entry.  

 

Spread the word!

If you can't assist or aren't interested in any of the perks here, we ask that you still help us out and share the word of this campaign with your friends.  There are share tools provided via Indiegogo to make this even easier. 

 

Come see us live!

Here are the dates, so come see us on tour (Crippled Black Phoenix/Soft Kill/Fotocrime)
19.03 - Scunthorpe, UK @ Cafe Indie (no Soft Kill)
20.03 - Manchester, UK @ Rebellion (no Soft Kill)
21.03 - London, UK @ Underworld
22.03 - Brighton, UK @ Patterns
23.03 - Osnabrück, DE @ Bastard Club
24.03 - Hamburg, DE @ Knust
25.03 - Aarhus, DK @ Voxhall
26.03 - Stockholm, SE @ Kraken
27.03 - Copenhagen, DK @ Vega
28.03 - Berlin, DE @ BiNuu
29.03 - Dresden, DE @ Scheune
30.03 - Prague, CZ @ Underdogs
01.04 - Aschaffenburg, DE @ Colos-saal
02.04 - Martigny, CH @ Caves du Manoir
03.04 - Vaureal, FR @ Le Forum
04.04 - Strasbourg, FR @ La Laiterie
05.04 - Nimes, FR @ La Paloma
06.04 - Luzern, CH @ Schüür
07.04 - Villingen Schwenningen, DE @ Klosterhof
08.04 - Vienna, AT @ Arena
09.04 - Munich, DE @ Feierwerk
10.04 - Cologne, DE @ Luxor
11.04 - Tilburg, NL @ Roadburn Festival (CBP and Fotocrime)
